Reviews.Title: “Nice location! But poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: DallasBenA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a wonderful location. There are many restaurants, and places to get a drink or just simply to relax. Some issues with the wireless connection, they were supposed to be available on the 1st, 2nd, and 9th floor. The connection on the 9th floor was not working. I would think as a Sheraton, they should have connectivity in every floor. One additional thing, the breakfast is extremeky overprice, you can walk across the street to a Subway, and get a better breakfast for 1/3 of what will cost you. The service in the hotel restaurant (breakfast) was extremely poor, the older gentlemen that was talking care of me, was not happy I did not choose the buffet, he really did not want to refill coffee , etc. if you watch, most of them just stand around and chat. Not a clue about custom service.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: DKNY21
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but it did have a moldy smell upon stepping into the lobby. Room was very nice, and clean. We stayed 4 nights in March. The only complaint I have is that every night we were there I had to call the front desk about noise, drunk people screaming in the hallways. Other than that it was a great trip and would definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: flgal65
Reviews.Content: We booked this room for a week's vacation. Got a great price through their website: three nights get the fourth night free and breakfast for two. We upgraded ourselves a bit and went with a junior king suite. Awesome. Huge room; flat screen tv, two balconies..one of which overlooked where the cruise ships came in. The hotel itself was fine. Had a great time in the casino, the roof top pool and sauna were perfect after a long day, the breakfast buffet was tasty. The worst problem we had was with housekeeping. As in there was none. We got in on a Monday. Tuesday no one came by. Went to the front desk at 5pm, told them no one stopped by and we really just needed coffee and towels. No one ever showed. Had to call down at 6am to have coffee brought up. Left Wednesday morning for a zip line trip, stopped at the front desk and AGAIN requested housekeeping to come by with a minimum of coffee and towels. Again, nothing. Had to swipe towels from a cart in the hall just so we could take showers when we got back. Thursday, they came by at like 4pm. I'm not sure if that is standard, but I was not pleased with that at all, especially after saying something twice on two different days to the front desk. Overall, I would stay here again. The location was absolutely perfect. The room was large, comfy, clean and spacious (although could have used a fridge). Had a great time in Old San Juan and would recommend this hotel if you could get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and proud”
Reviews.Author: jennascloset
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 2 nights before boarding a southern carribbean cruise. The hotel is gorgeous, the roof top pool and hot tub awesome with views to die for, and the location can't be beat. It's close to shops, restaurants, a CVS (which we loved for soft drinks to take on board the boat), and the free trolley which can take you all over Old San Juan. The only bad thing about this hotel was that we happened to be staying the two nights that they were hosting proms! The whole hotel was absolutely shaking from the beat of the music until about midnight each night. It was okay with us since we were on vacation but if I had been travelling with small children I would have been livid. Just a side note, we got to ride in the elevator with the US Mens Olympic Volleyball Team!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT STAFF AND GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LouRosario
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 5 nights and could have not have a better stay. The staff was PERFECT! If I needed anything they took care of it right away! The room although not a 5 star... it was good enough to rest your head after a long day out in the sun.... The roof top pool is definitely a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient/Great Location for Cruisers”
Reviews.Author: bsilly
Reviews.Content: Formerly a Wyndham property, we are starwood members and spent the night prior to our cruise at this property. Staff was awesome. Rooms were just o.k. But for the purpose they served.... a night to crash prior to a cruise, they were fine.... until we tried to take a hot shower and there was no hot water. But overlooking that, by staying here, you are right across the street from the cruise pier and you can walk into the terminal, hopefully saving some money on transfers. Even though we didn't have hot water, I would recommend this place because I would stay here again without hesitation because of its location and the fact that I have every confidence that starwood/Sheraton would have addressed our concern had we brought it to their attention.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Street_Science
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the center of it all in Old San Juan. Close to nightlife, restaurants and all attractions. Staff is friendly, building is clean and relatively new looking. The hotel restaurant is also the best place to have a well rounded healthy buffet breakfast. You'll soon find PR doesn't have the healthiest diet and you'll be craving normal food after a while. Again the hotel's restaurant has scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns and fruits. All for about $20 US. The one downside of this hotel to be aware of is don't be fooled by the terms "City View" when you book your room. This is actually a view of the parking garage. Only couples with a single large bed get the ocean view. Anyone with separate small beds gets the garage view unless you're willing to pay an extra $50 per night.

Reviews.Title: “expensive, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: fool4travel
Reviews.Content: I think this place is quite expensive, but it's still a good value for the heart of San Juan. The hotel itself is nothing thrilling, considering the price, but it is very clean and the location cannot be beat. Professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lleweltg
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience at this hotel. I was really surprised because I thought Sheraton hotels were suppose to he reputable. Anyways, the rooms don't have proper ventilation so no moisture could escape our room; therefore, only dry clothes became damp. Also I found a roath in my room. When I confronted the woman at the front desk she had an attitude. The rooms even smell musty and moldy. If I come to visit PR again I'll make sure it's a lot better of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great in Old San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaCarol46
Reviews.Content: When we cruise from Old San Juan, this is the most convenient hotel in the area. Just walk across the street and you are at the pier for most of the cruise lines. The rooms are older but kept in good shape. Also very convenient to all the attractions in Old San Juan. Excellent restaurants within easy walking distance and right next to one of the stops for the free trolley that tours Old San Juan. The boat that takes you across the bay is just a few steps from the hotel. We've been to San Juan 5 times and ALWAYS stay here. If you like to gamble, that's next to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Most unaccomodating staff and no customer service”
Reviews.Author: Shane F
Reviews.Content: Let me start my saying I spent one night at this hotel on March 16, 2012. It was recommended by a travel specialist since it was close to the cruise ship piers. We paid a premium price at nearly $300 per night. We would have been treated better at a $99 per night Courtyard Marriott. I suppose the big difference is the level of service customer service expected of Marriott Franchisees as opposed to Sheraton franchisees. Upon check in the staff was immediately put out with the fact that we did not have a "voucher" from our travel agent. Keep in mind I had called two days prior and to confirm our reservation and get the hotel confirmation number directly from them. All this information I had and I was made to feel that without the voucher I may not get the room that I had already paid for. Never was I told on the phone when I called to confirm my reservation that I would need to provide a voucher to check in to the room. After much rumbling and a check with the manager we were allowed to check into the room we had paid for in advance. To say the least it was NOT a warm welcome to our $300 per night accomodations. The room was mediocre at best. The furniture and surroundings did match the pictures on the website. However, the bathroom had not been updated in several years. At the rates they charge, a modern bathroom should be standard. This was not even up to Interstate Express hotel standards much less hotels charging much more. The elevators looked like a horse race had taken place inside of them. Not sure they had ever been cleaned touched up or updated. The real attitude and lack of concern by the mis-informed staff came when we returned from our lovely seven day cruise. Since we had a large amount of time between our disembarking from the ship and our flight times we thought it would be nice to re-visit Old San Juan for more shopping and dinning. Since we had stored our luggage at the hotel after we checked out to take advantage of the time we had before boarding the ship and saw they had a VERY LARGE luggage storage area we figured we would do the same thing before heading to the airport. Upon arriving at the hotel from the pier via cab I asked the bellman who was standing there like a statue doing nothing if we could check our bags into storage. He asked if we were checking in and I said no we had been guest a few days ago and wanted to use the baggage facility while enjoying Old San Juan before our flights. He informed me that they did not have a sotrage area for bags. Really??? Mind you this was the SAME bellman who had stored our bags before we left. I pointed out that I knew where the room was and it looked ample size for our bags. No he said hotel policy we do not store bags. Apparently bellman are paid better here than any other hotel in the world because even the offer of a substantial tip for the services was met with more rudeness and disconcern. I thought bellman used the assets at their disposal to make more tips and to not cause a scene, I was proven wrong at this hotel. I went to the front desk where again I was told by the very unfriendly female desk clerk that there was no room for our bags and it did not matter anyway becasuse we were not hotel guests. I explained that were had spent very good money to be hotel guests before the cruise and she quickly, and in a tone I have never experiecned by anyone in guest realtions, that "Sir we accomodated you while you were checked in as a guest and your accomodatoins ended when you checked out". She said there were other options. When we checked the other options they were closed. She did not even know the facts of the "options" she was suggesting. Well she was exactly right about one thing. My accomodations with Sheraton and Starwood brands did end that day. NEVER will I spend my money with a company that cares so little and is focused so much on policies that in no way help current or previous guests of these hotels. Please stay away from the Sheraton Old San Juan. The staff is the worst I have seen in any hotel, the policies are very unaccomdating, and the rooms are expensive and mediocre at best. Thanks to a very nice Taxi driver who took us to a RESTARAUNT in old San Juan that checked our bags while we shopped and contributed nearly $1000 to the local economy. How much did the restaraunt charge??? NO CHARGE..it was suggested a $5 tip (total not per bag). That is TRUE customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a weekâ€™s stay. The room was nice and the staff was very friendly. The staff highlight were the concierge's. They were the reason our stay was extra special. A week before arrival they made arrangements for several tours. Our second night in San Juan was my wife's birthday and they suggested Aguaviva and took care of the details for us, the restaurant was excellent. They assisted several times with directions and getting our boarding passes when the hotel's internet service was down. Five starts for concierge's. Dinner at the restaurant was very good and priced competitively. The hotel is close to everything in Old San Juan. We only had two minor issues, one was internet service, it was not available for most of the stay and had to have our boarding passes faxed to the hotel after using a cell phone to check in, which to say the least was painful. The second was breakfast. The buffet offered did not live up to the $20.00 per person. Our breakfast there was $50.00 with the tip and tax while a short walk to local eateries was one-fifth the price and just as good.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay at Sheraton Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: goodfoodstartshere
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed, our room was nice, but small and a tiny window across from the parking garage. It was a place to put our head before and after our cruise.. About 2 months after we got home, I noticed there was another fee on our credit card for $498,00, I phoned them directly, and they suddenly could barely speak English...but they would look into the charge. I phoned VISA who also did an enquiry. The hotel came up with a story that AirMiles did not honour our AirMiles certificates from 3 months earlier....soooooo, I phoned Air Miles, they told me that indeed the Hotel got their money back when we checked in. Thankfully, VISA reimbursed our card. Upon phoning the hotel again, they apologized and said it was an accounting error...... The second time we stayed, the week of our visit was very pricey, so we booked via Price Line. We came to understand that they do not like that and the staff does not treat you as nice!!! When we checked in, they wanted our credit card on file for anything we charged during our stay. On the last day we rec'd a bill for $24.00 a day because we booked through someone else we had to pay room service fees. When we asked what it covered, they hymed and hawed....came up with the pool is not covered on the PriceLine fees...Anyway, nothing you can do about that, they would not refund it. There was a musty smell in our room both times, but we have travelled to many Tropical places and do get that often. It's liveable. The pool is beautiful, scarce on chairs, but nice. I am not happy about the way we were treated when we booked through a 3rd party, apparently they do not like to give special rates through these companies, they want all the money and don't want to pay a 3rd party. Mario and Joseph the bell hops are amazing!!!!!!! Hats off to them! Friendly, helpful and very kind. Also to Jocelyn...we lost our cell phone in a cab and our reading glasses, these 3 people helped us to get them back, and are in the process of shipping them to us.

Reviews.Title: “TOO MUCH HOT WATER!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigApple1
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Sheraton after spending 5 days on board the "broken" Caribbean Princess. Our room, 931 was really nice and large, especially after being on a cruise ship. The problems started when we took showers. The temperature changed from hot to scalding, and then to cold. We reported this every day we were there and although plumbers showed up the problem was never resolved. The faucel on the sink leaked and the air conditioning never reached the sleeping area. We enjoyed the restaurant in the hotel, as well as the views from our balcony. The rooftop pool is small and has limited seating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and not a bad hotel if you are lucky to have quite neighbors.”
Reviews.Author: Rossar
Reviews.Content: I am not picky and my expectations of the hotel are very simple. To me the amenities are usually not important as I like to go out and explore the area, so it is just a place to sleep. Unfortunately on this trip my wife and I have not had a single night of good sleep. The walls of the place are so thin that you can hear everything that is being said. The first night we had some group of girls on what must have been a spring break arriving to the room at 1:30AM (after clearly having a lot of fun at local bars) and having loud discussions of boyfriends etc using a lot of profanity (yes, I really meant that you can hear everything). The sad thing is that the front desk nothing about it after my call even though they said that they will send security. After my second call they said that sent some one up as I heard them coming from all the way down the hall as they (the security) were talking on the walkie talkies (as I mentioned you can hear everything) so the girls got quite. Security leaves and the party next door continues until I had to call the front desk again. Keep in mind that it is lose to 3am at that point. The similar thing happened two more nights, although I figured out that knocks on the wall were effective tool to keep the next door parties in check. On our last night we were awaken at 3:30Am by a TV and some loud talking in Spanish. THE WALLS ARE VERY THIN. There are some GOOD things too. The hotel is generally well maintained and the location is just perfect. There is a car rental right in the hotel so you can rent the car and go visit El Yunque or explore a little bit. The local bus termInal is a block away so you can acces a lot of beaches and other areas without a cab if you want to. Everything is in walking distance. There are a lot of restaurants in the area for any taste. In my view this area is much better than Isla Verde or other aras with bunch of resorts stuck to each other unless you just want to lie on the beach all day long. If you are enticed by the pictures of the rooftop pool, then look elsewhere as the pool is actually pretty small but the fitness room is nice if it is important to you. Given the issue with the noise I will look for another hotel In this area next time I visit San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: safricks
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property before and had great experiences in the past. My stay in Mar 2012 was not as pleasent. The door wouldn't close properly, the water temperature fluctuated constantly and the room went completely unmade one day. That said, they compâ€™d me one night and the staff was acceptably friendly. It's in close proximity to restaurants and entertainment. Despite my difficulties, Iâ€™d definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible wifi”
Reviews.Author: OceanCloud
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after our cruise and the fact that it's less than a 5 minute walk from the cruise terminal (if you're at the downtown one) is a huge bonus. Nice lobby, but it can very noisy at times from the casino. Our room was spacious, with a beautiful view of the waterfront and the ship we had just left. Strangely though, it was impossible to get wifi reception in the room. I had to stand in the hallway to get very spotty coverage. The rooftop pool was beautiful and the hot tub was perfect. The view up there is magnificent. Again though, no wifi reception at the pool. It seems very odd to me that a nice hotel like this one would cheap out on inexpensive wifi routers in different locations of the hotel to ensure good reception everywhere. Good quality wifi is as necessary today as cable TV so why not get these details right?

Reviews.Title: “Great for Cruisers!”
Reviews.Author: bleep82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after our cruise in November 2011. It was perfect for this as it was just a short walk from the cruise terminal. Our room was a good size, with an extremely comfortable bed. Would have been nice to have a fridge in the room. A great location, but then so is every hotel in Old San Juan as its a small area and every thing is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “NOT ON OUR "DO-OVER" LIST”
Reviews.Author: WhenCanWeRetire
Reviews.Content: Would not stay here again. NEGATIVES: The rooms smell, not clean feeling, dirty walls, out-of-date, This was really a disappointment with all the hype I've read about how convenient the hotel is (directly across from the cruise terminal) but in fact is only convenient if your sailing on Carnival Cruise Lines (WHICH WE DON'T & WON'T EVER!). POSITIVE: The pizza was really good, bed was very nice. Thank goodness our 1st night was at the OTHER Newer Sheraton San Juan Hotel which is actually more convenvient for our cruise with RCCL.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayla78
Reviews.Content: We booked through a 3rd party for the 1st time, and boy did some of the staff at this hotel have issues that we didn't book directly through them. The location is fabulous, close to downtown OSJ, close to the pier (carnival)... about an 8min walk. The pool is warm and the view from up there outstanding.... The problem is it is a very tiny space, with only 13 chairs, and not room to really put anymore.... Also the sound proofing in these rooms is unbelievably bad. You can hear everything, including when the locks disengage on other rooms. The rooms themselves are very nice, as is the lobby. I don't think I could recommend this hotel, due to the treatment we received.... and although an apology was received, after the fact... I don't think the location trumps the treatment. ** Sheraton head office, has given us an apology, and a credit for the way we were treated. We do love Sheraton's, and have been loyal to them for years.... So I don't know what the issue was at this hotel, and I do hope they deal with it.... because you really can't beat the location of the Sheraton OSJ

Reviews.Title: “No view, no service, little value”
Reviews.Author: wslawrence
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Sheraton because I was working in old San Juan for a while. As I arrived, I found I had to be there over a weekend and asked the hotel if that was a problem. They had the room but raised the rate for the entire stay because I was staying over the weekend. Let me say that again. They raised the rate to $289.00 plus taxes, not just for the weekend, but for the days I had already booked, because I was staying the weekend. I found that very strange! Walked into the room and noticed that not only was there no balcony, there was no big window. The window was about 3 x 3 and was covered by plantation shutters. The good news was that the shutters were there to prevent prying eyes from looking into the room. The bad news was that, when I opened the shutters, I found I was looking directly into the middle of a 12-story parking garage, and that was the only view. The room was freezing cold and I tried to modify the temperature setting (bear in mind this is all happening within 5 minutes of walking into the room). When I moved the temperature up or down, it simply returned to the setting it was initially at. I couldn't adjust it at all. So, I went to the phone to call the service desk and find out how to do that. The phone was dead. Didn't work. Couldn't dial out. Went out into the hall and used the hall phone. Found out the temperature can't be adjusted. The system is either on or off. Can't modify the temperature in the room. (And the voice on the phone promised to check on the telephone.) Went back into the room and began to unpack. Needed to use the phone, so after about 30 minutes, went back outside and used the house phone again. Reached the same guy, who said "Well, tech said if the battery is discharged, you need to just put it in the cradle and let it charge for a few hours." I asked if he was going to call me to tell me that, then realized he couldn't because the phone didn't work (duh!) but also didn't send anyone up to tell me anything. The rest of the room was fine. It was clean, well-equipped, and functional, but not really the quality I was expecting. So, after spending two nights in an over-priced below-value room, I cut my stay short and moved to a different hotel. I found I could stay in a much nicer, less expensive place not that much farther away pay the taxi to get me to work, and still pay less. Overall, the service was poor, people ran up and down the halls all night and the insulation was so poor I heard them all, and the room just wasn't near the quality I expected for the price they charged me.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you're not in a hurry to check in”
Reviews.Author: Ann H
Reviews.Content: We were staying here after our cruise. We got to the hotel at 10:30 am and found out that check in time was not until 3:00 pm. We checked our luggage and when we came back at 3, we were told they had not assigned us a room and it would be on a first come, first served basis. This made me angry since they billed my credit card two weeks before we even left for our cruise! We finally got in our room at 4:30! I have to say that this hotel is very close to the Carnival dock, so it's convenient, the room was so-so and the bed comfy. But the TV didn't work well and their check-in policy and the attitude of the staf just did not appeal to me. Plus they did not offer a continental breakfast. If we had to do it over again, we would stay elsewhere.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: sandyMontgomery_Tx
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight before boarding on a cruise. I had read other reviews stating that the location was good for cruisers and man were they right! We had rooms looking out to the port. The rooms were nice and clean, the a/c worked good and the beds were comfortable. The casino was a plus for entertainment. The check-in was a bit crowded but the young lady helping us made it pleasurable. My only disappointment was the restaurant service....it was too slow for my group. The hotel location was also great for walking around old San Juan. Just down from the hotel was a SeÃ±or Frogs, a Ralph Lauren shop and a CVS pharmacy in case you forgot something at home. There were 3 ships in port the next morning. Two were some distance from the hotel but Carnival was right at the front door. We took our luggage, walked across the street and boarded the ship. The Sheraton Old San Juan is in a great location for sightseeing, even if you are not cruising.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with a great view of the ships and close to Old San Juan.”
Reviews.Author: Beavscabin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights. Four for a meeting and four to enjoy San Juan. The room was a suite and great. Room service was available for breakfast and dinner. The food was well prepared and the room service staff was very good. Security was good in that all guests needed to use their room cards for elevator access to room floors. The casino clientel was a little trashy. I did not enjoy using the casino. Viewing the cruise ships from the 9th floor pool area was great. Especially as they came in or departed. At ground level the ships are closer than anywhere else I've been. Great photo ops. Two blocks behind the hotel is a restaurant street with lots of local fair with entertainment. Many have outside dining and the atmosphere was great. All of Old San Juan is walkable from this hotel. Note: There is a CVS just down the street to buy beer, wine, sodas, water, and snacks. You will save significant amounts. Other people have complained about the mold. The stairs area near the pool was bad. Our room on the 8th floor was fine. The elevator area on the room floors had minor mold. The meeting areas were fine. The wi-fi was spotty. Good at times, connection issues at other times. Overall-marginal. The price was high but expected based on the location.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favourite place ever”
Reviews.Author: ergoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in room 632 for two weekend nights in early March 2012. The 'room' was actually what I would call a suite, with separate living and sleeping parts. Both were more than generous in size. Clean. Bed comfortable. Saturday night started out pretty loud, but settled down after 1 am. Sunday night was OK from early on. No sounds from neighbouring rooms, possibly because they were empty. ;) But only one luggage rack. The furniture showed its years of use. A 'room' costing me more than $300 a night and only plastic cups and no wine glasses? Really!! Luckily, being a traveller of some experience, I brought my own glasses. ;) My wife enjoys casinos, and it was the main reason for our staying here. I also enjoy casinos on occasion, but not enough to suffer the din in this place. The noise level was so high that it should be condemned by the health department. It was also very crammed. Not my idea of a fun place at which to lose my money. We ate here on the night of our arrival, not feeling like exploring after a long day's air travel. OK, the best I can report is that we did not go away hungry. Stomachs happy, taste buds wondering what the heck happened to them. Service was good, though, and we also enjoyed eating outside in a mild Caribbean breeze. Can't have everything, I guess. The place also seems to be a favourite stay-over for cruisers. I couldn't believe the line-ups for check-out and taxis on Sunday morning. After a day's walking around the old town, I can recommend Trois Cent Onze for excellent general cuisine and Aquaviva for seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore the old city”
Reviews.Author: Daniel C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location to explore the old city. We got a room with a partial view of the bay and the cruise ships. Could also see the fort. Very big clean room. Front desk staff very efficient and professional. Also nice casino on site.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: disney03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan from Feb. 7th to the 14th. We loved it. It was a hotwire mysery hotel. The hotel had everything we needed. The day we arrived they upgraded us to a bay view room. It was fun seeing the ships every morning. The beds were fantastic. They were so comfortable. The casino was very nice. It had everything from penny machines to black jack and everything in between. The female concierge in the morning was excellent. She always had helpful hints for us. Where to eat, what to do and where to shop. You really helped to make our trip more enjoyable. Thanks to the front desk people, the casino workers, the cleaning people and everyone in between. We had such a great stay. A cheaper restaurant with sandwiches and salads would be great. The hamburgers were a little heavy in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan”
Reviews.Author: kayshal
Reviews.Content: GReat spot to stay and eat. Second time here at hotel and it was better than the first. Staff is perfect, room was great.. Food excellent. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Bendecida79
Reviews.Content: The room was emaculate, great and friendly staff well worth the money. The only down side you have to pay for parking ($3 dollars a day if you use the garage located behind the hotel) great location in the heart of old san juan. Loved the pillows, bed is comfy loved it loved it!

Reviews.Title: “If you like musty, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: penelopepenguin
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at this hotel because of a conflict with our overnight flight and our planned hotel not being able to have a room ready at 5 in the morning. I booked this hotel using points since we are SPG members. We arrived and there was no one to take our bags. Mind you the people sharing our cab got out at the Caribe Hilton and they're whole staff was there to greet and take their bags. We were traveling with two young, tired kids and some help would've been nice. There was one person at the front desk who initially was annoyed when I asked for help with our bags. Her demeanor did change to a more pleasant one once she saw we were SPG members and I explained our situation. The room was spacious but sooo dated. We finally got to lay down and around 5:45 the hotel had guys power washing right outside the window! So loud. We were resigned to not getting any sleep. So we decided around 9 to get breakfast at Palio. Huge mistake. Will review separately but suffice it to say it was expensive and gross. We promptly checked out and headed over to our other hotel. We spent a total of about 5 hours here and it was 5 hours too long. Don't waste your money or your points. The main floor of the hotel which the restaurants were on had a damp, basement musty smell. What goes on here? Disappointed to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MizzouLincoln
Reviews.Content: After reading several previous reviews of this hotel we were not sure what to expect, but after staying two nights before our cruise out of San Juan - we were pleasantly surprised, and had a very enjoyable stay. The staff treated us very well during check-in; during our stay; and at check-out. Our room was very nice, and we had pretty quiet evenings. We also enjoyed their casino and even won a little money. We had read their resteraunt was a little pricey,(which it was), so we explored Old San Juan and found many eating places within walking distance that were less expensive and good such as - Moreno's Spot(can eat outside in a plaza, which we enjoyed, and Tijuana's Bar & Grill - good Mexican food & not too pricey; also Senor Frog's which wasn't bad. There are man, many other places to eat within walking distance. There is also a free trolley that takes you to most places in Old San Juan. We walked to San Cristabal Fort which was interesting and only about a 5 minute walk away. To get to the hotel from the airport it cost $25 for the two of us with 4 suit cases. People need to keep in mind if you're there for a cruise on either Celebrity or Royal Carribean, the piers for these are about a 5 minute cab drive away, and cost us $18. We would definitely stay at the Sheraton Old San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “location great, hotel needs update”
Reviews.Author: Mira G
Reviews.Content: the location is great if you want to explore the old city of san juan, which is really special. it's on the water on the west side of the island so you can avoid the worst of the traffic getting in and out and is an easy walk to everything (including cvs, starbucks, great restaurants, ice cream etc.) the hotel itself is rather disappointing -- while the service was very good and what you'd expect from the sheraton (clean rooms, comfy beds) there's really no lobby to speak of bc main floor is mostly devoted to a depressing casino and the pool is a wee little rectangle on the roof not worth getting into a bathing suite for. Especially disappointing given hotel is quite far from a beach. we got upgraded to a junior suite, which was great in terms of the space and the balcony with partial ocean (and cruise ship) view. But the carpet was stained and the paint was chipped along the baseboards... it's clearly been a while since they've updated the rooms. irritating that they charge a 10% resort fee on top of $220 room fee (which was apparently a deal...) so with tax we paid $250/night and I didn't see any resort amenities to justify the charge. also worth noting that they often sell out completely to people getting on and off cruise ships so you may have to wait well past the 3 pm check-in time for your room. don't be one of those sad looking people sitting on your suitcase in the lobby -- drop bags with bellman and go explore.

Reviews.Title: “Only good for convenince of going on a cruise”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover2012
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend this hotel if you are going on a cruise and need a place to stay that is close to the pier, walking distance. I stayed 4 nights before the cruise and wasnt impressed by the noise. I would wake up with the slamming of the doors of the rooms. No fault of the guests, it is just that the doors when they close they slam....very disturbing. If you need to stay there dont get a room by the elevator or the vending and ice machine, another thing that kept me up. The buffet for breakfast is $20 a person...a better deal can be found outside the hotel. Chicago Burger that is attached is pretty good for lunch or dinner...not bad in pricing and friendly staff, but under staffed so you will need to have patience with them as it is new. But great to sit outside by the water. Oh and if you want a microwave or fridge it is an extra $10 a night for each...not included in the price and you need to request it.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Sheraton with clean rooms and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: brfk86
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned froma long weekend in San Juan at the Sheraton.This is a standard property near the boat wharf within walking distance of all of Old San Juan. The staff is very helpful. The property is far away from the beach area so if this is what you want it is not the property for you. If you want nightlife the old city is wehre you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: karol_michel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at the Sheraton old San Juan before leaving on a cruise. We did some research before choosing this hotel. The location of it is amazing; just across the port for Carnival pier and a very short distance from Princess and Royal Caribbean pier. There are numerous places to eat and have some fun. Room : The room is nice and comfy and the view was ok. Food : We took the breakfast in the main restaurant on the second floor. The outside balcony was great with a superb view. Service : The service exceeded our expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RosieS
Reviews.Content: Just back from a lovely time in old San Juan. We got a good price at the Sheraton on Priceline. I was a little unsure of the location due to the proximity to the cruise ships. and the possibility of being overrun by passengers every time we stepped out the door. It never was a problem. In fact I enjoyed looking out and seeing which ship was in every day. I found the location so central to all of old San Juan that I'd choose it again for just that reason. Every staff person we came in contact with was friendly and helpful. We had a standard room, and it was fine. It isn't shiny new, and the furniture was dark old wood of the West Indies style. I liked it all. The beds were very comfy and house keeping did a good job of cleaning and fulfilling any requests we had. In the room, I never heard other guests except the ones in the halls who appeared to be returning from late night partying. It feels like on weekends all of the island comes to town, so there is probably noise everywhere. My suggestion would be to join them and walk around the old town as late as you want. Around the hotel feels very safe, as does all the town within the confines of the tourist areas. The gym was adequate. It was nice to look out over the sea from the treadmills. The pool is small, as others have reported. Not having gone on vacation to swim, I didn't mind. I felt I could have done some laps had I been inclined to -just short ones.The few times we went up to sit by the pool there were chairs open, and it was peaceful. I imagine if a large family came in it would feel a bit crowded. I do like a bit of slot playing, but it didn't take more than one night to find I wasn't going to be lucky in the casino. It's small, and has less choices than I'm accustomed to. Maybe give it an evening if you like. The locals go there and are fun to chat with. I learned from them that while playing the machines, you can order not only free drinks, but free sandwiches as well. They were having some sort of ham and cheese cooked things that might make a nice snack for the price of a tip. If you aren't driving, skip this part...We rented a car to get out and see more of the island. To avoid the $21.40/nt valet parking, we parked on the street. Coming back in the day time, there was usually a spot within a block of the hotel. You have to look closely, because it's illegal to park where the curb has yellow or blue paint. You will see many people park there anyway, and I don't know how many tickets were written. At night, there are various fellows who stand on the curbs and direct people into parking spaces. They will guide you in as if they are teaching you to parallel park for the first time, then they stand near waiting for a dollar or two tip. We questioned one man after we parked and realized the curb was yellow. He assured us the police didn't give tickets at night for parking there. We moved the car shortly anyway, and soon saw a ticket being written to someone else nearby, so - do it at your own risk. On the weekend, the city seems to fill up and make street parking at less available. We ended up valet parking Friday and Saturday night. There are 2 or 3 parking garages near the hotel. Short term, they seem like a decent price, but it's unclear about the pricing for 24 hr parking.Check before you enter and have to pay to leave if you change your mind. We didn't find a garage that was less than the valet for our needs. We did do some driving in and around town. I wouldn't have had the patience for it had i been on my own, but my friend drives regularly in London and found it manageable. If you can't decide about getting a car, you can walk all over old town and just rent when you want to get out of town. The major touristy sites out of SJ also have tours to take you if you don't want to drive.There's a Hertz office in the Sheraton. We took a taxi to Coronado one evening so we could drink, and it was $12 one way and $15 back. Taxi to airport from the hotel was $21. If you are going to the Sheraton pre-cruise, do your research and see where your ship docks. You may be able to just cross the street and board, but if it's farther down the docks, you may choose a short taxi ride. As for the restaurants in the hotel, there were so many others we wanted to try, we didn't eat there except for a quick burger. It was just that - a burger. Nothing more. I recommend getting up and walking the city early while it's cool, or near sunset. There is so much to see and if you get lost, just head downhill toward the docks and you'll find the Sheraton. No matter where you choose to stay, do get out and soak in the charm and color of old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Ty Xavier W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for about 4 days, it was my first time there. The room was very nice. The lobby is interesting and give a lovely theme.. I was particularly impressed with the polite personal service I received from the staff, Wendy in particular, helped me out so much with my bookings. However, all of my interaction with the staff was pleasant. The only discrepancy is the scent of the room has a unique odor, but is easily ignored. I would certainly stay there again when I visit San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: bren3
Reviews.Content: We have been to San Juan three years in a row and have stayed a few different places. The best hotel is the Sheraton in Old San Juan. It is the perfecct location, clean, has restaurants, safe, pool, computer, very large bedroom and batghroom and a great value. The staff was always very helpful. We had a problem with the bathroom sink on our last visit and they were there within 5 minutes and fixed it immediately. It was 9 PM. Great service. This trip we also rented a car and drove to the Rincon area. They need to take some lessons from the Sheraton. The rooms were the same price, but dirty, unsafe, no restaurant-just plain disgusting. We so happy to return to the Sheraton Old San Juan when we returned. We will never stay at any other hotel when in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AZCasualTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan Hotel & Casino for two-nights as a pre-cruise hotel location. The Sheraton is just across the street from two-cruise ship berths, but there are several other cruise ship berths that are across the bay that require a short taxi ride to get to. The check-in process was quick and simple and the service counter was friendly and efficient. The check-in clerk automatically gave us a map of the Old San Juan area without even asking. We had booked the optional partial-bay view room where we could view the bay and cruise ship piers to the East of the hotel, but not the pier across the street - nice view. The hotel room was found to be clean, comfortable, quiet and enough room to walk around without any problem. The bed mattress was great - extremely comfortable for a great night sleep. Free Internet connection - I used the in-room cable connection to my laptop, but I did not check to see if there was a wi-fi signal in the room. The Sheration Old San Juan has a gambling Casino on the ground floor level which definitely gives the hotel some "action and life" and it is open to late night (2am weekdays, 4am weekend). From our hotel room on the 4th floor and we did not hear any noise from the Casino at all - so don't let the Casino room prevent you from booking. The Casino also features live musicians which features both Pop and Latin music. What makes the Sheration Old San Juan great for us is it is located almost centrally located in the Old San Juan area - where most tourists come to visit and see. We were able to cover the entire Old San Juan area by just walking from the hotel - Great! For those who do not feel like walking, there are Free Old San Juan Shuttle trams/buses that you can hop-on and hop-off. While walking through Old San Juan, we felt totally safe among all the tourists who also walk the streets. There were many shops, eating places and photo opportunities all around Old San Juan. If we were to come back to Old San Juan, I would pick the Sheraton Old San Juan as a favorite for exploring the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Historic Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: alexandermanley
Reviews.Content: A nice experience overall but had reserved a suite and the room we're in isn't one. The room's location is excellent otherwise since we are on a corner with views of the bay with the cruise ships right in front. Can also see San Cristobal Castle from our room. It also has three sets of french doors that provide a great breeze when open. If you tai a taxi from the airport ask them if they take credit cards and what is the minimum. The driver we used said he took Visa or Mastercard but when we arrive he said the minimum is $30.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Onourway547
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan for two nights pre cruise Feb 2 and Feb 3. We used points from our AirMiles program. This did not go smoothly, the AirMiles people were of little use but they did give me the code that Sheraton were supposed to honor. I made contact with the hotel directly and they agreed the code was good and reserved the room. We have Theresa at the hotel to thank for her help with this. About 2 weeks prior to arrival I requested an upgrade to a water view room. The request was granted for a small upgrade fee, again Theresa was of great assistance. We arrived late, checking in at approx 9:45 PM. The front desk were very helpful. Our bags had not arrived in San Juan with us, the desk said not to worry they would be delivered when they arrived. This happened without any additional prompting at 10AM the next morning direct to our room. The room was wonderful, it had a great view over the harbour and also had a narrow balcony. I have read other reviews complaining of musty smells and noise, this was not the case for us. We have stayed in more modern rooms in newer hotels but rest assured this room was more than excellent. We had a great sleep, no noise problems. The next morning we had coffee, bagel, muffin breakfast at the cafe across the street near the ferry terminal and I picked up hot cereal and juice at the hotel restaurant, yum. After a day of exploring we really enjoyed the pool and hot tub before having dinner at the hotel restaurant. The meal and service was very good. Everyone we saw around the hotel had good things to say. We did not hear any negatives. The casino noise was never a problem and the staff noting but polite and helpful. I would recommend this hotel, in particular to people interested in exploring the old city and forts. It was a $20 cab ride to the Pan Am pier to board the ship. The cab fares are all flat rate to and from this area of San Juan. The free trolleys pick up one block in either direction from the hotel and go around town including the forts. There is the above mentioned cafe, a Subway, a CVS , SeÃ±or Frogs in one direction, more cafes etc in the other direction. A couple of blocks into town are more eateries and a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Location with All Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: LMDominguez
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Old San Juan is located near the cruise boat piers and within easy walking distance of most sights in Old San Juan. The hotel is clean and the rooms are spacious. Air conditioning control was a bit of a problem and the room was colder than desired during our three-day stay. The HDTV in the room was fed actual high-definition programming. We had a 9th floor room facing the bay and the views were excellent. The hotel also had a well-equipped exercise room also with spectacular views. The staff was helpful and service for the couple of requests we had was prompt and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locations for a few days in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a few nights before heading to Culebra and really enjoyed our stay. Beds were very comfortable, big tv, but no fridge in room and carpets could use a cleaning. Besides that everything was great. Location was perfect, short walk to everything in Old San Juan, good burger restaurant in hotel. It is located right across from were the cruises dock, but its never really an inconvenience. There is a CVS with everything you need just 1 min walk down the road. Pool area was a bit small, but GYM was brand new and barely anybody using it. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: Carlos B
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 days, the room smelled bad, we had a room for the interior ... received poor service from the maid, there was much noise in the hall employees, the very small pool, no beach nearby, definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you don't care about a pool”
Reviews.Author: berned_you
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, large rooms, free Starbucks coffee, super soft beds, modern decor, close many cruise ships and attractions. The downside? A crazy small pool with very limited seating and shade. Great rooftop views but the pool but good luck finding a lounger. Overall, we had a nice stay here though for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Its in Old San Juan, its Central to life, its OK if cruising from this pier”
Reviews.Author: The-Clitheroe-Kid
Reviews.Content: If you are staying here because you are cruising check you are not on the Pan-Am pier which is $21 plus bags way at the other side. This Hotel is faded and although has a regular lick of paint requires an interior designer to give it something of character. The 3:00pm check in time is very inconvenient if getting off a ship and the queues on Cruises changeover days are unbelievable with very little pre-organisation and space for the regular event. The Hotel is in a good position in the town centre for life on the street and with the bus station close and very handy for getting around although the drivers consider foreigner should use taxies and are not very obliging. There is free wi-fi around reception and a couple of floors, with free computers to print boarding cards etc. which is good, the pool on top deck is sufficient but small with only a few chairs. Staff overall were very friendly, but the breakfast staff only chase the tip, the hot-cold breakfast buffet which I included in my week stay was very poor by any hotel standard and tasteless, if you wanted eggs or even (bacon not served everyday) it was extra, marmalade and honey could only be found on day one, and once used it was not replaced. There was nothing in breakfast that would make me have dinner here although we did have burgers and a beer on the front terrace which were normal US fodder. Would I stay here again, or recommend to a friend, NO. I would go out onto a beach hotel and catch the bus into town when I needed to visit. Also beware of festivals, we hired a car without knowing about the Festival of San Sebastian, and for four days Old San Juan was shut off with lots of traffic jams and we could not get back to our hotel by car and had to park miles away and catch a bus to our own car, on return of the car (day early) to Charlie Rentals they refused to take us back to town as per contract due to traffic and after waiting 45mins for a bus that never arrived, we insisted that they could not leave us and they took as close as they could.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: xj6jj
Reviews.Content: I too was a little worried about staying at this hotel after reading other reviews. I don't know what people are complaining about! Yes, there is a different smell when you enter the hotel, but it is right across the street from the ocean. And I only smelt it in the lobby. The room was fine. Check in was a breeze. Our room was very, very nice and clean. The location is great to experience Old San Juan. The hamburger restaurant in the hotel had atrocious service. The casino was nice and clean. The pool area is very small. Definitely have to take a taxi to the cruise ship port. All staff members I dealt with were friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for downtown or cruising!”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie1111
Reviews.Content: If you are cruising with Carnival, this is the spot to be. To go to the ship or when you disembarke,you only have to cross the street. The room is ok but only a small window. Very clean but half the bed was deforme.The pool is on the top, great view but few chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a pre-cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdventurousEve
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super nice & clean! After reading some reviews I was kind of worried, but it turned out to be much better than expected. We stayed here due to its proximity to the Royal Caribbean cruise port, which is about a 5 min taxi ride (it is NOT walkable). We still had to pay $10 for the taxi. Staying in Old San Juan and then taking a taxi to the port would have only cost about $5 more, so there is really no advantage to staying closer to the port, but it was nice seeing the ship from the hotel window. The morning of our cruise we checked out of the hotel and they held our bags so we could enjoy the hotel pool. It is a nice small infinity pool. If you are going to Puerto Rico to lay out the entire time, I would choose a hotel closer to the beach. In addition, to staying here we also stayed at the Doubletree by the Condado area. Both hotels were very nice & clean, but I would choose Doubletree over the Sheraton due to the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaToronto
Reviews.Content: There's nothing wrong with this hotel. Great location across from cruise ship docks and near some really great restaurants on Fortaleza street. I liked the rooftop pool and jacuzzi. I would stay here again if I go back to San Juan, mainly because of the location. But only if I could find a deal. Not really worth the high standard rates. It's a bit dated and does not feel like a luxury hotel by any means.

Reviews.Title: “None of the statements in any negative reviews appeared to be true to us”
Reviews.Author: kellgator
Reviews.Content: The hotel check-in went smoothly. There were NO extra charges. The room was spacious clean and had no odors to speak of. The casino is no big deal, but we aren't gamblers so that didn't matter to us. all the staff were friendly & helpful. the pool area is small, but it is nice & relaxing. i travel a lot for business and this was very nice. not luxury, but nothing for anyone who enjoys luxury to turn their nose up at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Before you Cruise”
Reviews.Author: CruiseNView
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights before we cruised. Usually we at least stay one or two nights before any cruise as a way to get in vacation mode, and provide some insurance in case there are any delays we will not be stressing about missing the boat. The last trip to PR we stayed in Condado, but found we were always coming down to Old Town for the great Restaurants (Dragon Fly, etc) and night life. This trip we chose to stay downtown. Location: The hotel is a short walk to the Carnival ship dock (not RCL). We dragged our bags the ~400 yards. It was hot, but no big deal for anyone in decent shape. Any closer and you would be on the boat. It is a 10 min walk to the Grocery store (beer, snack run), and maybe 15 to the fort. Hotel Staff: Great attitude, very friendly. I travel a lot and would be hard pressed to find a friendlier helpful front desk staff (especially the nice lady who checked us in and upgraded the room). Pool: Small, warm, but considering you are downtown it was good enough for a couple of nights to cool off. They did not hassle us at all for bringing up a few beers. Rooms: The standard rooms are on the small side, but clean and comfortable. The JR Suites are not that much more and give you twice the space, very nice. Elevators: Not enough, and you cannot take the stairs all the way down (we tried, and then had to walk back up a floor)â€¦.so you just have to wait. When the rush was on it could be 20 min, but other than that most of the time it was not an issue. Work out area: My wife loved the roof top open air feel, and it had enough to do for a regular hotel. We will be going back this year for two nights before the cruise, I looked and do not think there is a better deal for the location. We will stay a few nights somewhere else to enjoy the beach and then move down to Old Town to enjoy the nightlife, restaurants, and easy trip to the boat.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Tech-trekker
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan for a business trip that lasted from a Saturday night through the following Friday morning. I didn't select the hotel. The rate at the time was $179 USD without the taxes and resort fees. Expect this to add another $20+ to the nightly room rate. The room we had was adequate with a comfortable bed and clean linens with extra pillows. There was a dresser and wardrobe tha accommodate the two of us fine. There is a desk with lamp and internet cabling. In-room coffee and a daily (almost) bottle of water grattice. My room had no wirless internet. Get your room activated by contacting the front desk. I have an iPad with Verizon data plan. No data service in SJ but the phone worked fine as well as email and texting. Basically you get "1X" service with good signal strength in most places. Wi-fi is available in the meeting rooms. I don't know how much it cost as someone else set up the service. The resturanrt on the second floor was good. Breakfast could be obtained from the full buffet consisting of both hot ($15) and cold ($10) options. You can also order off the menu if you have special dieteray needs. The coffee in PR is stronger than on the U.S. mainlaind, so you may want to get a pot of hot water and cut it accordingly. Warm milk is a standard accessory. I had dinner there two nights and breakfast every day for 5 days. Never a problem and the wait staff was courteous and professional. We also used a couple of the larger meeting rooms for our function. They were well set up and accommodated us well. The hotel also provided the a.m. and p.m. snack breaks daily. Food quality was very good. The hotel provided A/V screens and cords and podiums. It all worked well. The fitness center appears to be fairly new. It is equipped with 2 bikes, one recumbent and one upright by LifeFitness, also by LifeFitness, 3 treadmills, 3 ellipticals and a rack of dumbbells from 5 to 50 pounds. There is also a weight machine that will accommodate activity for a couple muscle groups. There is also a flat bench that can be adjusted to tilt. Stability balls also were on hand. It's all installed in a fairly small room, given the amount of equipment but they seem to make it work. I used the room 4 times during my stay. On my last day the room was way too hot. The fitness center and pool are located on floor 9. There are locker rooms on this floor so you can lock up your stuff if you have a lock to apply. Somewhat disappointing here was the fact that both the men's and women's rooms on this floor were almost always out of towels or the dispensers were not functioning properly. We tried on numerous occasions to get extra towles but that didn't always work. I don't know if it was a language barrier or not, but they seemed to understand but then when we came back from an outing we rarely got them after they cleaned the room. You need to use your room key card to access floors 3 through 9. The 9th floor is as high as this hotel goes. If you are on any of these floors, you must also use the card to traverse between floors as well. You do not need a card to get to the ground floor. We had a particularly bad time with the key cards on our last night here. For unexplained reasons they both stopped working, even after being reprogrammed. Then we got news sets of keys TWICE. Neither elevator would read any of our keys. Other guests started expereinceing problems but it was intermittent. After getting a fourth set of room keys, we finally got things working. This is when all you want is a simple elevator that does not require a room key to access your floor. Apparently all this is done in the name of security. It was a hassle and was among the only low notes on the stay. San Juan is a party city for many people. That said, yelling, screamining and running through the hotel's halls at 3:00 a.m. by some of the most discourteous obnoxious "guests" resulted in my calling the hotel front desk TWICE Saturday night. By Sunday night these jerks were long gone, presumably or perhaps thrown off the property. THAT episode was awful. Overall I give this Sheraton a 3 out of 5 because nothing really stood out to validate a higher rating. If you soend your time here on vacation you will probably be fine. Just nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “OK Experience”
Reviews.Author: Stargazer111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location where cruise ships dock. It is also close to the bus areas, where you can hop onto a free trolly or bus that goes around to many places of interest. I would highly recommend visiting the Castillo San Felipe del Morro fortress. The entrance fee is $3/- but it is worth visiting it. You can pay $5/ and visit this and the other fortress called Castillo San Cristobal. They are all within walking distance from Old San Juan. Old San Juan is the place to hang around. There are many restaurants and shopping places, all within walking distance. I would highly recommend visiting El Convento which has a lot of history. You can have lunch or dinner there. The Spanish architecture with the courtyard in the middle will delight you. There is some construction going on on the ground floor of El Convento at the moment though. Enjoy lovely Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but adequate”
Reviews.Author: localhomeandgifts
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed in Old San Juan for eight nights for a romantic and relaxing getaway. Loved the convenience of this hotel - everything was at our fingertips. After seeing the awful lobby/casino and atmosphere of the hotel, we made the best of it by spending as little time there as possible. We had breakfast included with was very blah except the pastries were delicious. Service there was not very friendly and we couldn't figure out why they didn't serve everyone out on the patio overlooking the bay. Happy hour there was lovely. The upgrade to the view of the bay was probably worth it, but the window was small. Know that beaches are a 15-20 minute cab ride from Old San Juan. Hotel was clean and staff was polite.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property, Walk to Everything, Beautiful Views!”
Reviews.Author: open15
Reviews.Content: We shot a television show from this hotel, the proximity to everything in Old San Juan was perfect, we couldn't have been better located. Clean rooms, a tad small, but comfortable. Beautiful views of the cruise ship harbor!

Reviews.Title: “Location with decent service”
Reviews.Author: MichaelB88
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a great location. Most everything was OK with this place. Rooms were big but without much windows or light. Linen was almost clean. People were real nice. If you want to stay in Old San Juan you wont suffer here but you wont be in luxurious surroundings either.

Reviews.Title: “Average in every way - except very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jylze
Reviews.Content: All staff - front desk, security, bellmen, concierge, housekeeping - were all very helpful and considerate. Other than that, the only thing going for it is its location in the gorgeous neighborhood of Old San Juan. The AC was hard to get right, and the room - we stayed in two different ones - are lacking amenities, the TV is frustratingly hard to change channels, and the building is old and smells it. But overall, I guess so what? We didn't spend very much time in the room anyway, so the things that mattered - location and staff - were enough for me to cautiously recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “So so”
Reviews.Author: TennyG
Reviews.Content: Great location, only walking distance to cruise ship. Not a standard Sheraton quality, old facilities. I would say it is overpriced. It costs 7000 points to redeem a free night, if u use points, it is not bad compare to the high rate.

Reviews.Title: “Practical, but not gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: DavilaBayamon
Reviews.Content: Excelent location. Good personnel service. A little lonely the day I stayed. The restaurant closed too early. No entertainment besides TV or Casino. Nice store. Good bar snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to kick off and end our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: OakandCypress
Reviews.Content: We flew into San Juan for our honeymoon and stayed two nights. We arrived and was warmly greeted by all of the staff, and the woman behind the counter noticed my reservation note about it being our honeymoon and upgraded us to a balcony room! The view was awesome with a stunning view of the bay and the many cruise ships that come and go. I am a supervisor in a 4-star, 4-diamond hotel and I felt that the room quality and available amenities were very nice. They even gave us a bottle of champagne and a snack with a heart-felt note. The location is ideal to walk around Old San Juan and a CVS next door that sells snacks and liquor kept us well-stocked. We then checked in again before we flew out the next morning and was greeted with the same warmth. AND this time, they upgraded us to an even bigger room! We used the pool and hot tub and it was a really nice touch with only a few people there at one time. We also used room service both times, the food was prompt and delicious. The gentleman concierge also gave us great directions across the island. The only reason I don't give 5 stars is because we did have quite a hassle getting a rental car at the Hertz desk. Our reservation was really screwed up and it took FOREVER getting the car which made us decide against going to see El Yunque that day, (that was really the only reason I rented a car to begin with). I'm not really sure if that is the hotel's fault or not, but outside of that, we had an incredible time and will definitely stay there on our next trip to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good access to old san juan”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel as good but not very good. The location worked well for my boyfriend and I. We were able to explore all the streets and plazas in and around old san juan. We walked to the fort but did not actually visit it. Our room was large and clean but with an interior view. The pool was so sad! But the views of the port are phenomenal. Dinner at El Convento was not memorable but we thought the atmosphere was romantic and relaxing. We stayed for one night before leaving for Rio Grande. I would stay at this Sheraton again only if I were boarding one of the cruise ships. The hotel is typically 100% booked with cruise passengers which may mean you're room will probably not be ready if you arrive before 3pm (ours wasn't) and your request for late checkout may not be granted (ours was!)

Reviews.Title: “Right in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: calenita
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in Old San Juan this is great. If you want the beach and swimming - no. Right by the cruise terminal where ships stop for the day - NOT where you get on the ships if you are going on a cruise out of San Juan - it is an ideal location for visiting the old town. A huge CVS next door has everything you need for last minute. Old San Juan is just enchanting and felt very safe - maybe because of the high number of cops all around. Walk the streets of old San Juan and just enjoy the atmosphere. There was a nice cafe with lots of locals in it a few blocks away where we ate lunch. The hotel has a small pool on the roof but it was never crowded. This is not a hotel where people go to swim it appears. The hotel is big and you need to use a room key to access the elevator - which did not always work well. I guess this is for security but it was annoying. The rooms were comfortable and beds nice. All the hotels in San Juan seem to be expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a SHORT stay”
Reviews.Author: tripgrl727272
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for part of our trip to Puerto Rico. This hotel is right in the middle of everything... easy walking to all attractions and nightlife. The room was clean, and the view was nice (cruise ships). We saw a dolphin out the window immediately upon check in! The pool is on the rooftop... it is small but nice. We hung out up there and enjoyed the night air one night. Old San Juan is crowded and the Sheraton is NOT near a beach. In my opinion, this Sheraton is a great place to stay for a night (or maybe two) but I would recommend heading east toward Luquillo and Fortuna for a beach vacation feel when visiting northern Puerto Rico. Traffic makes it difficult to easily travel in and out of San Juan, so I would only stay at this hotel if you actually plan to stay inside the city.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra convenient,nice views, unimpressive facility”
Reviews.Author: 1228applejax1228
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights before moving to other PR beach resorts. Amazingly convenient to Old San Juan's greatest hits - nothing more than a ten minute walk (20 if you're really strolling). Stayed in a suite, which was big and had nice views, but was appointed like any hotel in Akron or Boise. Felt old inside, but it was definitely clean and tidy. Bathroom was the worst part - unluxurious to say the least. Well, worst part of the physical building that is. Overall worst part by far was the noise. The restaurant downstairs was more of a nightclub than a place for dinner. So loud until about 3am. We asked to move our room, but the only alternative smelled like it had just been painted and made us light-headed in an instant. Staff was friendly but a tad incompetent. Pool on roof is pretty but tiny. Would stay again, but only for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Robert O
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel to stay for a couple of days prior to take a cruise. We were looking for a hotel in the Old San Juan area as this was the part of Puerto Rico we were most interested in. We also wanted to stay close to the cruise pier. (Be aware that if you are taking a Royal Carribean cruise, the pier close to this hotel is not used by this cruise line to start a cruise) Location was great, Staff efficient and friendly and room was large and always clean. I saw some travelers rate this hotel poorly in the area of cleanliness and hotel upkeep and almost did not book because of those reviews. I am not sure what they are looking at because we had not issues for the 2.5 days were were there. We would definitely stay here again and highly recommend you give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Only thing Sheraton, was the name out front. Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: TravelingOnline
Reviews.Content: Lobby over crowed, long line to check in, and room wasn't available yet. Room had the appearance and smell of being worn out and old. The smell was so offensive, we walked to CVS and purchased candles in an attempt to rid the awful must/moldy smell. (No other rooms available) Although a room card is required for the elevator, we found MANY who obtained access to the pool area from cruise ships awaiting boarding or passing time before going to the airport. This created over crowding and a play area for MANY kids, as no staff in area to observe. The next morning, the drilling, hammering and other constructions sounds woke us up at 7AM!! The room next to us and across the hall apparently were being worked on? Placed a call to the front desk to communicate the noise level was unacceptable for the time. The noise continued along with the loud speaking workers and the music, until we left..... We moved from this hotel to their other property on Convention Blvd. This hotel did not compare to their other property. Clean, updated, friendly staff, had a live band, casino, and the room and bedding were clean. I do NOT recommend this property in Old San Juan. If it's about location, keep looking as while walking around, awaiting our room we walked past other hotels in the same vacinity. (block or two away) This reminded us as a cheap hotel you could rent by the week as many disappointments we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service but beware of accounting department”
Reviews.Author: subbulu
Reviews.Content: I completely enjoyed my stay at Sheraton old san juan. The location is excellent. We go a room on the 9 th floor with bay view- would see all the big cruise ships such as Princess, Carnival etc. depart at mid night 12. The room service is excellent. The lobby is all the time crowded and filled with cruise passengers trying to store or retrieve their luggage from bell man. The casino is very good too compared to other casinos in old san juan. We booked our hotel room with Priceline so priceline already already charged for 2 nights stay. After we checked out and came home, I saw that their accounting department charged my credit card for the 2 night stay again. So I was charged first time by priceline and second time by Sheraton Old San Juan's accounting department for the same stay. I called their accounting department and they say they got my message and would call back but nobody ever called back or e-mailed me on the incorrect transaction. I had to loose my peace of mind on this and finally a lady e-mailed back after some days saying that it will be refunded back to my credit card in 10 business days. I got the money back. The only parking available in valet parking and they charge $24 a night. There are some public parking places around the corner but not sure of the safety in down town.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but not Sheraton quality.”
Reviews.Author: WrldTrvllr777
Reviews.Content: Good location, but should never carry the Sheraton name. It's a mediocre 2-3 star hotel. Plugs, hair dryer not working. Rooms very small with no natural light. Pool extremely small. Staff super slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...Not Quite as Described on Website”
Reviews.Author: KristiK7774
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, easy to walk to any of the sites in old San Juan. The hotel itself was sort of a let down when we walked in because the casino is RIGHT there just off the lobby so you walk into a pretty loud and chaotic atmosphere. The room itself looked pretty much nothing like the picture and we had a view of a parking garage, it was a little dingy and smelled musty and could use some updating. The breakfast buffet.......well, it sucked and we really are not picky eaters, so for me to say that it means it did. The breads were stale and cheap with no flavor, the potatoes were cold, the coffee was weak and the only other option was cereal and it was $42 for two of us. The one really nice thing about the hotel was the roof top pool. Great views from there! The staff was also very nice and helpful. Overall, it was pretty average, if you stay there be prepared to hear music coming from downstairs until midnight and don't eat breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Alicia B
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton was a good location for one day in San Juan. We could walk everywhere in the city and didn't need to take a cab or car anywhere. The room was nice, and clean. The pool was small and cold but felt refreshing after a day of walking around. There were a lot of people at the hotel and it was very busy since it's right next to the cruise ship dock.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ben P
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights after taking a nice cruise out of S.J. Can't complain, great location to walk around Old Town S.J. Clean, Quiet, wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT USE THEIR CONCIERGE!”
Reviews.Author: Marlin F
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and the hotel is in a great location. We attempted to book two excursions through the hotel and they managed to mess up both of them! The first one we booked was to the biolumimescence bay and the forgot to confirm our reservation with the tour company so we waited an hour for a tour that never showed up to pick us up. We also booked a trip to the caverns and at their recommendation we booked on a Saturday. Friday night they contacted us canceling because of a festival that was going to be in the city where the caves are. How as the concierge did you know know this festival was going on?!? After both of these instances, entirely their fault, they never offered to compensate us for our lost time in any manner. Terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Pez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right in the old town of San Juan and is just a minute away from the center. Although the hotel is quite dated the rooms were fine and the bed very comfortable with lots of feather pillows. Good water pressure in the shower too. The jacuzzi up on the roof was also pretty good fun in a tropical storm! We also hired a car through the Hertz desk at the hotel and the girl working there was extremely helpful and friendly. Altogether a good hotel for the price and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Kitti29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on our way to a sailing trip in the BVI's.
