The location can't be beat -- easy in/out access from Old San Juan, and it's walking distance from everything in the area. The staff was friendly and the rooms were comfortable and clean. The furniture is a bit worn and there is a funny smell in the hotel that takes some getting used to... Our room overlooked the bay, right where the cruise ships come in and out, which was neat, but could get a bit loud. Our room had a French balcony, which added to the ambience. Also has a casino, but we didn't have a chance to play. Overall, a very comfortable, functional place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: adair578
Reviews.Content: My husband and some friends of ours stayed here for 2 nights and it was pretty much what we expected - nothing fancy, but centrally located and within walking distance to everything we wanted to do in Old San Juan. The pool is small and there is no beach, so if you are looking for those things I would stay elsewhere, but if you are looking for a convenient location from which to explore Old San Juan, I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: garridogal
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a night before our cruise. I arrived WAY earlier than they did - around 6am to be precise - and we couldn't check in until the afternoon. So I spent a lot of time in their lobby. I'm happy to say that the lobby is comfy and a good people-watching spot. I spent part of my time looking into the casino which opened at 8am. (Yikes!) It has a couple of restaurants, including one on the ground level right by the casino. The location is wonderful if your cruise happens to be leaving from one of the ports it's across from. Ours didn't so we had to take a taxi over but the location is also excellent to explore Old San Juan from. This is a beautiful section of the city and one you should not miss. Since I was playing the waiting the game I interacted with a few of the staff members. They were all very nice and helpful. The breakfast buffet was a little steep at $15. It didn't really have a selection of food that would merit that price unless you ate several plates of it. And it was too much of traditional American breakfast. I ate there because I didn't know where else to go at 6:30am! I was a little concerned about the noisy restaurant in front of the hotel which was going full force by the time we returned to our room to sleep. We were only on the 4th floor and I though its sound might travel up. I was so happy to be wrong and we didn't hear a thing. The room although very basic in its decor - white comforters and curtains - was comfortable and clean. The beds were great and covered with wonderfully thick and plush comforters which just make you want to sleep extra long. The location is great too for touring beautiful Old San Juan. There are cruise ships right across from the hotel. Ours, unfortunately, was a taxi ride away. But hey, you may get lucky! My only complaint is the sensor on the lights. I woke up to use the bathroom and the foyer light popped on. One of my friends told me that this same light came on by itself at another point during the night. Either the sensors are way too sensitive or we had a ghost. I'm going with the sensor story...

Reviews.Title: “Good Property”
Reviews.Author: travelguy6
Reviews.Content: Hotel good for cruise customer , location in front of the pier and in the middle of the Old San Juan.Hotel is busy on saturday and sunday, expect wait for 20-30 minutes Room is very clean, bathroom need update.Property is nice, location is great and room is good

Reviews.Title: “Good location for short stay”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinFishy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights before leaving for a cruise. did not rent a car and wanted to be in Old San Juan. Property was clean and room was standard but somewhat worn. Staff was helpful. Pool area is small but we got a place to sit both days. Can pick up drinks at Chicago Burger Restaurant to take to pool area if you want. The restaurant had outdoor seating with live music on Friday night. The free trolley/bus system is easy to catch near hotel thus we toured the Forts on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Avg hotel centrally located in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Travelondollar
Reviews.Content: Busy, noisy, bustling hotel. We booked via priceline. Avg room but we hardly spent time on the property. We walked around and spent time in Old San Juan and didn't do much at the hotel. We parked the car on the street and did not use the hotel parking. The staff is quite impersonal. The chicago burger place (at the ground level) does live music and had good energy. The stay was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad smell”
Reviews.Author: phoebebobo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very bad smell in the lobby and the rooms. But I give it three stars for the location, since everything in old san juan is pretty much walkable from here. Be aware- if you come to PR for the beach expereience, this is not the hotel. Beach is not anywhere close. And it is next to a port and street that gets lots of noises at night or early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent good service”
Reviews.Author: byco
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Old San Juan is in a great, safe location, the property is well maintained and the customer service from the staff is great

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay at Sheraton in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MTCA_8
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a two night stay at the Sheraton in Old San Juan. I would rate the hotel as your standard Sheraton. It has a good location directly in Old San Juan and walkable to sites in the area. The gym at the hotel has nicer, new equipment. The staff and concierge were very helpful and friendly during our stay. The staff went out of their way for us on one occassion and it was much appreciated. If you are looking for a hotel in Old San Juan and your budget is within the range of this hotel, I would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: ITravel614
Reviews.Content: I love sheraton hotels, but I wasnt too impressed with this one. The room was okay but could certainly use some renovations especially the bathrooms. We only stayed there one night and thankfully so. Our room was right next to the elevator and very close to the pool, so very noisy from other guests walking by all hours of the night. However, the hotel is in a good location. Close to lots of restaurants and sites to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - elevators a headache”
Reviews.Author: cappleya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night - great location for wandering around old san Juan - lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Visited the bodies exhibition which was right next door. Rooms fine but no space in bathroom for anything - no countertop! The most annoying thing was the elevators - need to use room key to get to your floor but didn't work very smoothly and we, and others, had several rides up and down because we couldn't stop at our floors!

Reviews.Title: “Only for one night!”
Reviews.Author: MTATL
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of proximity to the port, as we were cruising the next day. (port is across from hotel) Reception/lobby area is nonexistent. It seemed as if they sacrificed the lobby to enlarge the casino area. Rooms were nice, big & clean. In the Old San Juan, which is undergoing redevelopment so I expect improvements to this hotel in the near future. Conveniences are close by, but I still can't justify the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Old San Juan woop-woop and flashing lights!”
Reviews.Author: mc0r0na
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was great could not ask for any better service. Clean, comfortable rooms. Well pleased. Great location. So close to the fort and castle with great food and Senor Frogs at the front door. Be sure to ask them about local place to eat and shop. Pool on roof with an amazing view at night! The only thing that was missing was the beach but pricing was right.

Reviews.Title: “PreCruise visit”
Reviews.Author: Melathens98
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights pre-cruise. Hotel staff was great could not ask for any better service. Clean, comfortable rooms. Well pleased. Great location. Great Taxi service at the front door. Be sure to ask them about local place to eat and shop. Pool on roof with view.

Reviews.Title: “Service by Manager on Duty Did Not Meet Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Review2011
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel. Everything in the common areas of the hotel looked good. It's located near the cruise ports and close to many restaurants and the Castillos. Unfortunately, our room had a strong mildew odor but we did not complain the first night there. The afternoon of the second day we noticed that the carpet in the room was wet. There was apparently a water leakage of some sort (perhaps from the air conditioner). The odor of mildew was stronger that day. We called the from desk and asked for a different room while they fixed the water leakage. The manager on duty claimed that the hotel was full and they could not give us a different room. She said she would send someone to check what the problem was and that they would give us a fan to help dry up the carpet. Her response was appalling and uncaring. We waited for a little while and when no one showed up, my wife had to go down to the front desk and argue with the manager that her response was unacceptable. When my wife asked her to put us up in another hotel magically a room just became available. (An employee later told us that the manager had directed that they give our moldy room to another guest.) Be prepare to speak up if you are unhappy with your accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “great locations to see all the sites in old san juan”
Reviews.Author: blucab1
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Old San Juan is a great location. If cruising on carnival their port is within walking distance.....A must see is the Castillo San Felipe Del Morro & Castillo San Cristobal you can purchase a ticket for $5.00 to see both and the ticket is good for 7 days......Hotel is also near free trolley, so if you have walking difficulties get on the green trolley to drive by both of the forts and see what old san juan is like....on sat. & sun there are alot of street activities going on and it is a great time to sample local fares.....the pool at the sheraton is on the roof and is another great view.....if you are looking for a great place to eat try Punta De Vista a couple of blocks away very good food and very good prices......Heineken for a buck......

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: TnBLT
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days at the Sheraton Old San Juan while waiting to leave on a cruise. The location is great if you are wanting to walk around / get a taxi around Old San Juan. It's a great location if you are waiting to board a cruise ship (check which dock # your ship will dock, all are not near this hotel but a short taxi ride away). As others have said, the hotel gets very busy on the mornings that ships leave, and the morning that they return. If this is an issue for you please do speak with the hotel about it and see if you will avoid that issue. Everyone from the valets, to the desk, to housekeeping were very pleasant and helpful. It is an older hotel. There are no refrigerators in the room. (we always like having a cold soda waiting on us). If you have valuables the rooms have safes. If you stay...and you would like to sample a sandwich the locals eat....from the hotel doors turn left....at the street corner turn right. Walk down a little ways and you will see the street vendors and artisans. Try a Tripletta......it's a local sandwich! Delish, only $6, and so big 2 people can share!! San Juan is a lot of fun.....enjoy your visit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: GonzoTheDude
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Old San Juan is a great hotel if you want to stay in the Old San Juan area and close to the cruise ship docks. If your ship is leaving out of Pier #3, you can walk to the ship since it is almost in front of the hotel. Staying at the Sheraton allows you to walk the 500+ year old walled city comfortably. Many restaurants, night clubs and shops all withing walking distance. If you need a beach, then this is not the place to stay. However, you can always take a taxi, a public bus or rent a car to go to the beaches nearby (in the Condado Area). The hotel is clean, the rooms are ample and the beds are very comfortable. The elevators can get pretty busy on weekends when guests are leaving the hotel to go to their cruise ships. Either leave early, or get ready to wait several minutes for an elevator with room for you and your luggage. There is a nice but small pool on the top floor with a good view of the bay. Did not try their restaurant since there are so many nearby. Did lose some money in the casino...easy to do!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLS1007
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton for 4 nights. Room was very nice and clean. Beds were super comfortable. Bathroom was a good size and the shower was outstanding. cleaning service was great. All hotel staff were very nice and pleasant and very helpful. The staff was very good at telling us how to get to places and what places to go to. Hotel was in a great location. Walked to everything. Casino was great and the service in the casino was excellent. was always being offered free drinks and food. Enjoyed our stay here very much and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit less than average....”
Reviews.Author: Lidia1965
Reviews.Content: The rooms were noisy and breakfast was poor. Stayed fo 9 nighs while attending a congress. The room was so sandard, nothing like Sheraton!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: budahhfly
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 7th FL in king room, had a very nice view of the harbor. Room was clean and well appointed. The bed was very comfy and the furnishings were nice. The bathroom is nice and large and tub is big enough for a bath. We were pleased with the room. They offer a breakfast buffet on the second floor in their restaurant. It's VERY expensive with little offerings; however on Sunday morning you won't have many choices in Old San Juan. If you choose to participate in their "eco" program and do not take new towels during your stay you will receive a $5 coupon for the restaurant. This will help with the hefty breakfast bill. The service is in the restaurant is awful, but at least with a buffet you don't need much. Front desk service is decent, they aren't impressive nor rude. There is a parking garage directly behind the Sheraton with very decent rates. Don't pay the exuberant valet rate at the hotel. Overall we were pleased with our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: magon121254
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is across the street from San Juan bay. A short walk takes one into the heart of old San Juan and all the cafÃ©s, restaurants, night spots, small museums and historic spots. The problems with this hotel are mostly due to historic reasons. The fact that the building in which its housed goes back to a different area and wasn't meant as a hotel means that it has no parking of its own. There is, however, a municipal parking across the street at the side of the building, and another a block away. Rates are quite reasonable (Don't use the hotel's valet parking. They use the very same municipal parking, but charge four times as much!). Also because of cramped space, amenities are on the smallish size, but quite adequate. For example, the pool is on the roof and not large, meant to dip in, not swim. On the other hand, they've made it pleasant. On the bright side, they've used their imagination to squeeze in as many amenities as possible in the cramped space. Thus, in addition to the pool, the hotel has a comparatively large fitness room, a restaurant, conference rooms, a bar-and-burger joint and, of course, the casino. The decor is simple, but nice. Very simple, the color schemes being bright pastels (Y'know, the whole tropical thing). Room furniture is on the theme of the austere, dark Spanish colonial look, simple but quite adequate. I personally liked it. The room is comfortably sized. Air conditioned worked fine (A blessing in the tropics), the bathroom larger than in most hotels and well appointed. The whole of the hotel was kept very clean. Tickets were given to me when I checked in for a full buffet breakfast free, with waffles and omelettes cooked to order. There were enough for me and my daughter to cover every morning of our stay. The food was good, the service personnel very pleasant. Rates were reasonable, particularly so for Puerto Rico and especially considering the hotel's location. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: npc2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan for one night prior to our Carnival cruise on October 8th. This was our second visit to this hotel and we were not disappointed. First of all this Hotel is right across the street from the pier that Carnival sails from. The morning of the cruise you grab your bags walk across the street and you are on the ship. Also, it's location in Old San Juan is perfect to sight see in this beautiful city. We opted to upgrade to a suite for $25.00 additional and WOW, we ended up getting the Governor's Suite. Dining room for 8, beautiful living room with big screen TV, seperate King bedroom, 3 balconies and a great view of one of the forts. What a way to start a trip. The people at the hotel were very helpful with sight seeing tips,and restaurant suggestions. All in all I give this hotel a big thumbs up. Hotel outside could use some new paint.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: MissToraT
Reviews.Content: Overall a great stay. I am so glad I ignored the negative reviews of this hotel. All the staff members were friendly and very helpful. Definitely book the breakfast package. Amazing breakfast which helped keep me full through breakfast and lunch. I am so glad I stayed in Old San Juan because I was in walking distance to nearly everything. The only time I caught a cab was to go to the rainforest--which was on a tour bus. I walked to all the beaches and caught the .50 cent ferry to visit the Bacardi factory and ate some yummy mofongo at a restaraunt right off the ferry boat docking area. I am so excited to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: frito58
Reviews.Content: I am always amazed at the bad reviews of this Hotel , we just came back from 2 nights pre cruise the room was clean the people were pretty nice , we got it on Hotwire for a great rate , I would have given it a 5 had we not had to wait until 4:30 to get our room ,our friends got right in but we had to wait for some strange reason , but no big deal . I would never hestitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle D
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Puerto rico has a family this hotel really gave us the welcome feeling at check in with annajanuarly who went out of her way to make us feel welcome with her advice on the Junke forest trails to the great restaurant to vist during our stay breakfast in the morning was EXCELLET !! I didnt catch his name but the older gentleman who worked the am shift was top notch. Rooms were very clean and Housekeeping was on top of towels and anything else we needed we had two room for 5 night and never really had any issues with hotel which is in a great location close to ferry and free public transportaion and restaurants Thank you for making Our stay so especial !!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: elfi s
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 3 nights at this hotel to attend a family wedding. We booked a room for 3 people (2 double beds) and we were told those rooms always come with a lousy view of a multi-story car park. And that's what we got. The room smelled of dampness although the a/c worked well. The refrigerator we had ordered a week before by phone was not in the room. There was no wifi in the hotel and the phone-hook up in the room didn't work, nor did one of the phone lines. A tech did finally come to the room but was unable to fix the problem. The second day we were there we left the hotel for several hours in the morning but the room was never cleaned. At 4:45PM the room service people said that they got off at 5PM so the room wouldn't be cleaned until the following day. The next morning, after making several calls to the desk to get cleaning service right away, I managed to find a cleaner with a trolley in the hallway who finally cleaned the room. Also, the receptionist never mentioned that there was free internet in the lobby, despite our having explained, on two different occasions, that we were unable to hook up to the phone line with the laptop. The location of the hotel is excellent and ideally located for those just staying one night and boarding a cruise ship. I would not recommend this hotel for any extended period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: karl12345
Reviews.Content: One of the travel books gave this hotel one star and they were dead wrong. The rooms were very nice. The service was outstanding. The location was fantastic. You can easily walk to everything in old San Juan. The price was very reasonable for the off season. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “"OK Location-Poor Service"”
Reviews.Author: Ed T
Reviews.Content: When the family and I arrived (a little after 3PM) we couldn't wait to check in and begin our vacation. Unfortunately, our room "wasn't ready" and was told that it would be "a while" before we would be accomodated. Having traveled all day long (with young children) we appealed to the manager for some help. The manager (apparently having told numerous guests before us the same thing) told us that check in was "after 3PM" and made no further attempt to assist us. When we complained he (the manager) simply shrugged his shoulders as the front desk staff watched smugly. When we finally did check in rooms were small, smelled of mold and had poor vetillation. The pool was tiny and dirty. A real dissapointment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumsuuum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night after our cruise, which was extremely convenient. It is directly across the cruise ship terminal, so it was easy to walk there with our luggage. They also let us check in as early as 8:30 am on Sunday! You can easily walk all around Old San Juan as well, we walked to the fort and back which was not bad at all! This hotel is probably an average Sheraton. Not extremely luxurious, but definitely a clean and nice hotel...probably the nicest hotel near the cruise terminal. There is 2 restaurants in the hotel, which we did not get to try, as well as a casino, which was definitely a good time! I also thought the bed was pretty comfortable! We had to leave the hotel by 6:30 am to catch our flight. We walked right out of the lobby and the valet guy got us a taxi within a minute! The drive to the airport was about 15 minutes. The Sheraton made our stay very easy and convenient. If we ever cruise out of San Juan again, I will most definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - but with a budget feel”
Reviews.Author: rahulpat
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Sheraton Old Town, some of it in an interior suite and some in a cityview double room. On the upside, the location is perfect to explore Old San Juan and all it has to offer. The rooftop pool/hot tub and gym are decent, there's a Hertz desk inside the hotel, the breakfast buffet was good (I didn't eat at the restaurants otherwise) and any service requests were promptly taken care of. On the other hand, both rooms had a mildewy smell and windows that don't open, and the A/C either keeps the room ice cold or muggy. The rooms are average but comfortable (nice-sized tv's and basic amenities: no mini-fridge). I was peeved by the high-pressure showers combined with poor bathroom ventilation which leads to...well you can imagine. Wi-fi is only available on the 1st and 2nd floors and the casino with continual loud music could be considered either a blessing or nightmare (but hey, penny slots!). If you're cruising or taking a ferry to the Bacardi factory, the piers are just across the street. Not a lot of alternatives if you want to stay in Old San Juan itself.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean... a good value”
Reviews.Author: unprofitable
Reviews.Content: This hotel, on the bay in Old San Juan, has standard Sheraton amenities. Don't look for luxury, but expect a clean, well maintained room and good room service. Do not expect a quiet lobby - the casino on the ground floor is open 24 hours a day. We found the staff friendly and responsive. The on site car rental staff was particularly helpful; just don't try to rent a car shortly after a cruise ship disembarks at the pier across the street. All in all, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for cruising”
Reviews.Author: mamasita
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan a few days before leaving on a cruise out of the San Juan cruise port. The hotel is very conveniently located across the street from the pier where the ships come in. You can walk, with your luggage, no problem. Hint - unless you really can't manage it yourself, don't pay the baggage handlers to cart your stuff for you. It's not a long walk. The hotel was clean, and the staff were very nice. You can walk all over Old San Juan from the hotel, even up to El Morro. There is a CVS and a Senor Frog's right next door, but I recommend the Old Harbor Brewery, a few blocks away. They have good food and interesting micro brew beers. We arrived in San Juan just after hurricane Irene, so a lot of things were shut down. The rainforest was closed, and many of the local activities, like horseback riding and ATV's, were not running. Electricity was intermittent. But the concierge helped us find something to do, and gave us a contact where we could ride horses and ATV's in the same place not too far away. She also helped us get a car for the day, which is a good idea if you're traveling any distance. Taxis are very expensive, especially since there were 5 of us - they charge per person. The hotel was fine for what we were doing, but if I were going back to stay in San Juan, I'd go back to one of the bigger hotels on the beach, like one of the Marriotts. They are a short cab ride from Old San Juan ($10), and they have much nicer facilities. The Sheraton has a casino, which we did not visit, but there is no bar or lounge area, and the pool is a small rooftop pool. We only went there once, because if 6 people show up, it's crowded. My family did use the gym facilities, and seemed to enjoy them. It's a small space as well. Overall, if you plan to spend all your time in Old San Juan, or if you're heading out on a cruise and only need to stay a night or two, this is a good choice. But if you are looking for a beach vacation or a hotel with more action, head out of Old San Juan to the resort area just a few miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: JavC0
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan Hotel & Casino. I must say, the location is spectacular, if you are looking to really experience old San Juan. It's situated near the ocean and some of the historic sites. I was there on business, but because of its location, I was able to see some of the sites at the same time as taking my meetings. It's near the main highways to get around in the city. That said, the hotel is in some serious need of renovation. I found my room to be depressing. My bed was extremely comfortable, heaven actually, but the furniture in the room bothered me. It felt cheap. Uninspired decor left me less than impressed. There was also a very strange smell in the room, like shower curtain that has remained wet for days and never dried kind of smell. A muggy, mildewey smell is the best way to describe it. The front desk staff was ok. I didn't find them to go above and beyond the call of duty to make me feel welcome. I also felt like they were under staffed at front desk and not very knowledgeable of procedure. My checkout lasted almost 30 mins due to some printing issue. Room service gal was awesome. All in all, the location is AMAZING and highly recommend it for that alone. You can walk to the beautiful old town (and Starbucks). As for the guestrooms, the bed was amazing, but I was very unhappy with the rest of the decor and bulky furniture.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen shirt”
Reviews.Author: Southernbelle441
Reviews.Content: I left my new shirt at the hotel and when I went back to tell them they said it was mysteriously gone. Clearly someone took it. It didn't vanish that fast. I have stayed at Starwood Hotels all over the world and I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stormy Weather Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jessilena22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton in Old San Juan for 8 nights during our honeymoon last month. We were "lucky" enough to have been in the middle of our stay when hurricane Irene made her ill fated appearence. Due to the quetionable electrical system set up in OSJ, our hotel lost power for over 48 hours. This meant no lights in our room and NO AIR CONDITIONING. Needless to say, we were less than thrilled with the circumstances, but decided to try and make the best of it. After all, you can't control much of what you encounter in this world, you can only control your reaction to it. The staff at the Sheraton Old San Juan went well above and beyond to make our stay as comfortable as possible. You could really tell that they genuinely cared that we had a good time at their establishment and were willing to do whatever they could to make that happen. Hotel manager Alejandro Rios especially, was a literal calm during the storm, patiently listening to our and other guests' complaints and then doing the best that he could under the circumstances to satisfy our needs. He and the majority of the staff were truly exceptional and they should be commended for their performance in what was certainly a less than ideal situation. General notes: Location is great. Walkable to everywhere in OSJ and a bike ride or taxi ride to the beaches in Condado. The excercise room is awesome! I took advantage of it every morning (barring the days there was no power of course - I was reimbursed the service fees those days as well, because we could not take advantage of the majority of the services!) Pool is small, but if you get there early enough to get a good spot, you can stay there all day. The breeze off the bay makes the sun much more bearable. Breakfast buffet is great as well. It's pricey if you don't have passes included in your room stay. Ours were and we booked through Orbitz.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a staff who knows how to service guests!”
Reviews.Author: Letsgoseetheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton 8/28-30/11, being stranded in Puerto Rico after a Carnival cruise after all flights had been cancelled due to the hurricane. The beds are so comfortable and the location can't be beat. All I can say is Tina and Marie? are the conceirge's at the hotel. THEY ARE WONDERFUL!! They helped us re-book our flights, find a great restaurant and give us directions. They are so sweet and nice. We even got a hug good bye! The bell men and the front desk reception people were so accomodating, making sure we had the things we requested. This is one hotel who's staff really cares about the guests and it makes all the difference in the world. Oh, and free internet service for guests, a huge plus! Two thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Travelist7499
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not live up to the Sheraton Standard. I mean the rooms were clean (in most areas) but I expected alot more. I wasnt impressed by the staff or the amenities. Check in was just okay, not as welcoming as other places i've stayed and When we went to checkout there wasnt anyone at the front desk. A bell man had to shout for one of them to come from the back and even after that they didnt. So since we had a $0 balance, he said we could leave. WE didnt use the hotel parking, You can park on the street close by just make sure you look at the signs. However, I did like the location of the hotel, in Old san Juan, great to walk around, but I wouldnt stay here again. Oh and Beware of that extra 11% hotel fee per night. Wasnt happy about that either

Reviews.Title: “Stayed one night before cruise - average”
Reviews.Author: SeanMaine
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here the night before heading out on a cruise the next day, and although it was exactly what we needed in terms of functionality, I was not that impressed as I normally am with Sheratons. First, the pluses - it was pretty easy to get to and had easy access to cruise ships with cab fare, which is great. The casino in the ground floor was a nice touch for those that wanted a shot at playing a game and winning, as opposed to cruises, which are notoriously harder to win odds-wise. The pool on the rooftop was nice to be outdoors and not have it be too noisy, and same with the rooms where it was in a busy area but sleeping was no problem. In addition, Old San Juan is great and classic in terms of walkability and things to see right out the front door, so location is perfect. The negatives, the casino was small without a bunch of options and was very crowded the night I was there. The pool was nice as I said above, but being on the rooftop, you would have thought better views, and for safety reasons, it meant the views just weren't there. The pool was small though, smaller than the website makes it appear, but again, still nice. I didn't like the fitness center very much at all, but overall it was a pretty good looking hotel. So not really blown away either positive or negative, but it served its purpose. Old San Juan is a nice area, we never felt like it was dirty or unsafe like I have heard other people claim, and this hotel is right in the middle of some fun activities. I don't know if there are better options in Old San Juan, and I doubt it, and better options may be more out on the outskirts and in "resort areas" themselves, meaning why spend one night there. For spending one night, I would consider this a good option, as there are some good food options within walking distance, and it isn't great, but isn't bad either. I couldn't call it "very good" or four stars, but I would say more around 3.5 if that was an option on tripadvisor, which I wish it was. As it was better than average, but not by much.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rahonda
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Orbitz. I was visiting Puerto Rico for the first time with my finace and our one year old son. Upon check in we were orginally told that there was no reservation in either of our names. After the manger came out the issue was supposedly resolved and for our trouble we were "upgraded" to a 2 room suite and given coupons to MATCH $25 spent at the black jack table in their casino. What a joke! The room had the odor of wet dog. We had to air it out to get rid of the smell (we later figured out that the french doors allowed water to pour in when it rained.) To make a long story short... Tropical storm Irene came across the island and knocked out power to most of the island. Now excuse me, I would think that if your hotel is located on a tropical island that is frequently troubled with storms, a hotel would have some sort of back up generator!! Well guess what! The power went out at 2am Sunday morning and when we left on Wednesday there was still no power. The hotel had no answers for us and refused to compensate us. Our room was hot and muggy and I was concerned for my son who was whining and sweaty. We decided that it would be better to stay at another hotel for a night to escape the heat and rain. We were told that we could stay at another Sheraton at the local convention center. Again, I assumed that the staff would assist us in making the reservation and be willing to compensate us for all trouble. NOPE!!! The front desk attendent dialed a phone number and handed me the phone to make my our reservation. Oh, and it cost us another $173 to stay one night ANOTHER SHERATON HTOEL!!!! Orbitz was no help either. They told us ther was nothing they could do for us if the Sheraton wasn't willing to refund any of our money!! Our trip was fantastic because we got to visit family but WE WILL NEVER EVER USE ANOTHER SPG HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: lapope
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great location (on the waterfront of Old San Juan), but smaller than other Sheratons in my experience. My wife and I had a very nice four-night stay. It was extremely clean and modern. There is a pleasant rooftop pool and hot tub, but they are small and few people will fill them up. The staff was friendly, efficient, and accommodated our 1 a.m. check-in. There is a small casino (mostly slots, but a couple of tables) accessible from the lobby. There isnâ€™t a hotel bar, but thereâ€™s a sports bar right next door with a lot of outside seating overlooking the bay. . We didnâ€™t have a refrigerator or minibar in our room, which would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!! Wouldn't go back!”
Reviews.Author: Maryelena L
Reviews.Content: Nothing about this hotel would impress you. The rooms are so outdated! Staff is very unpleasant. The restaurants in the hotel are OVER PRICED not much selection either. We had no electricity for 3 days when asked when we would have electricity the staff would seemed bother by the question. They did not try to accomadate any of the guest even the ones with small children. Please do not go by the pictures shown in their website, the pool is so small (picture is very deceiving). Room views are of Parking lot and buildings or a restaurant called Senor Frogs (again pictures are very deceiving) I wouldn't recommend this hotel at all. Search for other hotels in the area you will be better off.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay - not great”
Reviews.Author: P R
Reviews.Content: Not the best place I have ever been to. Rooms okay, but could use some fresh paint. Went out in the morning, came back around 1:30, rooms were not cleaned. Breakfast in their dining room was expensive - I didn't have any coupons. Coffee and danish - $6.50. I would say too pricey for what you get.. Okay for a one or two night stay, but if you're spending a week, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Before you book, look at my pics”
Reviews.Author: maggie30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I named my own price on priceline and this room cost me 75 dollars. I would not spend a penny more for this hotel. Priceline told me there would be a 9% resort fee but the hotel charged me 14%. After I put my things in the room, I went to grab a bite to eat and when I returned the lights where out. It took about 20 mins to get everything straightned out, and you could tell the hotel was not prepared for a black out. The rest of the night I did not have wifi. The next day I went out of my room arround 8 am and came back at 2.(my room still was not cleaned) I wanted to take a shower since it was so hot and then go for a late lunch. When I turned on the water it was red. I called the front desk and asked for someone to come and look at my room.I waited 20 mins and no one came. I went downstairs and told them I am going out for lunch when I come back I would like my room cleaned and clean water. I came back 2 hrs later(took my time so they can fix the problem) My room was clean and I thought I could go for my shower. The water was still red. I called for a manager, they instructed me to let the water run. I pointed out that I left my room for two hrs and they could have let the water fun so I dont have to waste my vacation time doing what they should have done. They then blamed the water on the lights going out the day before and that it ruined the boiler and I could take a cold shower. I told them that I took a shower in the morning the day after the black out and there was not a problem with the water, and it affecThey insisted that it was the black out and they were truley sorry. I was compensated with a breakfast coupon, but this ordeal took at least 4 hrs of my vacation time. I honestly do not think I was compensated well. I later learned from a local that the red water issue is something that happens often in San Juan, meaning I was lied to by the people at the hotel. The pool is very small in comparison to the amount of rooms it has, I tried to go but it was really crowded. If I had a choice I would not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to be slapped with an 11% "hotel fee".”
Reviews.Author: n3497v
Reviews.Content: After arriving I was informed about an 11% hotel fee. I asked why I was being charged the fee and the attendant told me that it covers the pool, fitness center, and the internet. This fee was never disclosed during the booking process. Very upsetting. The rooms are ok, but the hotel has a musty scent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect extension to our cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn F
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (our cruise shipped docked at the FAR port, a $12 cab ride away). We were able to check our bags with the consierge, and were given maps and information--so we were able to make the most of our day and see the city- the free Trolleys were helpful. What a beautiful city--- and the people were kind and friendly. Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Old San Juan, PR”
Reviews.Author: jdlajara
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before our cruise. Excellent choice under AmX Starwood Rewards Program! Excellent location allowed easy access to Old San Juan. Pleasant staff, well maintained facilities, and clean room. Quick and simple registration and departure.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever - Never Again.”
Reviews.Author: NCLAX
Reviews.Content: This was hands down the worst hotel experience ever. My wife and I had pre arranged for early check-in as we were scheduled to land early that morning. Upon arrival we there was one attendant handling check-ins and no one tending the Starwood Preferred line. After a 10 minute wait we were told our room was not available and it would be ready shortly. Long story short, it was 3 hours later that my pregnant wife and I were finally accommodated. The staff at the desk could not have been more unpleasant and could not have cared less whether my wife and I returned as customers. Note that throughout this process some selected guests were provided rooms. I was told that rooms were appointed on a status basis and apparently being only gold I was not worthy of a room (despite having a pregnant wife and having been waiting for 2hrs already). . Just as a side note, preferred status means nothing at this location â€“ no amenentities, nothing! I was offered 2pm check-out for my inconvenience. The rooms are dated and musty. There are two elevators that service the entire hotel â€“ be prepared to wait. The view from your window will either be of the back of a building or the roof of Senior Frogs roof. There is not a beach anywhere close and the concierge is rarely available to schedule accommodations. The casino is primarily slot players and table games are often closed or unattended due to the lack of demand. I will never return to this hotel and unfortunately most likely switch my allegiance back to Hilton that understands customer service.

Reviews.Title: “amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: Myrna G
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, nice room, the location is very good. I love the happy hour at the hotel ( 2 medallas for $5). * Tell us how you liked the room * Talk about the location & amenities * Say what you liked best & least

Reviews.Title: “Overall - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SopranosFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 7/31/11 to 8/4/11. Overall the hotel was very good. I decided to stay here AFTER my week long cruise on Royal Caribbean. The taxi fare from the Royal Caribbean pier (which is the Pan American pier on the other side of the bay - NOT the piers in front of the hotel) is $10.00. It will cost $19.00 from the hotel to the airport. If you are cruising on Carnival - then the piers are directly in front of the hotel. The best attributes of this hotel were: 1. Location, location, location! Its right off the water in OSJ. Everything is within walking distance. There are dozens of shops, bars, and restaurants within a few blocks of this hotel. OSJ is very pedestrian friendly so you won't have any problems getting around. 2. The staff! Very nice and go out of their way to help you. The front desk people remembered my name for my entire stay there. 3. The beds in the room are very comfortable. I would have liked to have taken one home. Linens were good too. 4. The air conditioning - you can get your room to locker room cold if you chose. The a/c comes from a vent near the ceiling and not a window unit. This is a big deal to me. It doesn't blow over you while you are in bed. 5. Large rooms with big bathrooms. Overall, very comfortable room with safes to keep your money and valuables while you are out or at the pool. 6. The pool is nice and on the roof top. Its fairly small but adequate. 7. The 3 internet computers in the lobby were nice. Free of charge for hotel guests. Here are a few things the hotel could improve on. 1. The rooms could stand some painting. The ceiling had some dark spots on it. 2. The carpets are not terrible, but not all that great. I saw a few spots and the carpet didn't appear to be too new. 3. The room could use some "softening". There was only 1 picture in the room and 1 in the bathroom. Lots of bare wall space. Also, some drapes/curtains over the patio door would be a great touch and make the room a bit more inviting. 4. I saw some mildew problems in the bathroom (room 809). I bit on the shower curtain towards the top front and some on the tile in the shower and the grout in between the tiles. 5. The grout in the tiles in the bathroom flooring are in dire need of attention. Its much darker in traffic areas then what you see under the sink. The hotel was clean overall. I noticed though the maids left a bit of trash on the floor after they left. That was only one day however. Hotel restaurants.... Overall very good! Chicago burger was my favorite. Very tasty food and the price was not expensive. The main restaurant on the second floor had very good food too but was overpriced in my opinion. I did not try the casino but it looked very busy. The hotel is very busy on Sundays - major turnover with all the cruise ships. If you are arriving on a Sunday you will have to wait until 3PM until your room is ready. The hotel will store your bags. Actually my room was ready around 2:30PM so I was happy. A few other tips.... 1. If you are in need to do laundry - there is a laundromat on O'Donnell Street about 3 blocks from the hotel. Very reasonable there.... 2. I found a deli called the Old San Juan deli on Tetuan street across from the big banco Popular. Great food and cheap! 3. Make sure you visit the old Spanish fort on the northwest side of OSJ. Great! 4. Hotel El Convento - I believe - was featured in the Flying Nun. Its a nice area....a lot of pictures of the area around there as well as the cathedral were taken for the series....sorry I'm a Sally Field fan! The wide stair case that you see at the end of each episode on the Flying Nun are to the left of the hotel. I'm not too sure about the hotel being in the series but those steps are definitely the ones you see Sister Bertrille walking up. Would I recommend this hotel? Definitely! I would love to stay here again. The value for the price I paid was borderline but you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Alyshia
Reviews.Content: We are from the west part of Puerto Rico, and went to stay at this hotel for a mini-vacation for 2 nights. Knowing the island I can honestly say this is one of the best hotels we have visited. First when we arrived the check-in was fast and the lady was very nice to us. We then went to find a beautiful room and good amenities. We had a good time walking around old san juan and did not have to use our car. The hotel has a good, safe atmosphere. And the bed is divine! The only suggestion we can give to the hotel is to provide in the room a guide of the hotel including info like hours of the restaurant and the menus. Also we did not like that theres is no guide for the channels in the tv, the remote is not so good and the movies for rent are too expensive. But overall Awesome experience!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay!”
Reviews.Author: katieaz
Reviews.Content: Hosted family cruise to Southern Caribbean. Chose this hotel because it was in Old San Juan and believe me there are many sketchy chain/non chain hotels in Old San Juan. The hotel was more tired that I anticipated. The carpets/furniture was worn/stained. The hotel was not very welcoming. You could do worse. Location decent if you want to be in Old Town but don't have high expectations. Okay for one night pre-cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Will be returning....but not staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Lirensmom
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were allowed to pre-check in. Our bags were taken and we had lunch at the attached Chicago Burger restaurant (expensive but decent food). We returned to check in at 3:00, the given time, and were told it would be another thirty minutes before the room would be ready. Not wanting to walk around the city with our carry-on bags, we waited in the lobby with about four other groups also waiting for a room. At 3:45, we were told, it would be another hour before our room was ready and that, because we had booked through Orbitz, there was nothing they could do for us. Our room was finally ready at 5:00. The room and the hotel were clean and well-maintained. The security was impressive as well, given that one needs an active room key to make the elevator work. Our room had an excellent view of the parking garage next door. We also had to call for housekeeping every day and then be specific about what we would like done in our room. We booked a tour through the concierge and, other than a slight confusion about departure time, it was an excellent tour with a knowledgeable, friendly tour guide. During the confusion, the front desk staff was helpful and even gave us some free bottled water (not a bad deal considering that a bottle of water is $4 if you use the one in your room). The casino is small but busy with more locals than tourists. We did not try Palio, the restaurant in the hotel, but enjoyed an evening on the second floor patio. The roof pool was small but nice. The hot tub next to the pool was the same temperature and the fitness center was under construction. The bed was very comfortable and the water pressure was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, friendly people, clean rooms, good food, location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: jamesdanielsmith
Reviews.Content: If you are doing a cruise, this is the place to stay when getting off the boat. Stay in Old San Juan for a couple of days after your cruise at this place! They are located right off of the pier within a two minute walk of the ship. Everything in Old San Juan is within one mile of this hotel, it's perfect for staying at the navigating back to after going out. There are taxis located right outside along with the water taxi a few hundred feet from the front doors. Great restaurants are only a few blocks away and a CVS is just down the street. The hotel itself is incredible, the people are very friendly and remembered our names, tales, and events the entire time we were there. The room is spacious and clean and well stocked. There is free Internet downstairs in the lobby for 45 minutes per room. The hotel provides a guide to help book tours on the island and even provides transportation arrangements. The management was great! We had a small problem with our flight and they accommodated us quickly without a single holdup or concern. I would highly recommend this hotel and stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “2 for one, hotel & Casino!”
Reviews.Author: Bish555
Reviews.Content: This nice old place was ideally situated to explore Old San Juan. We were right on the harbour where we could watch the cruise ships coming and going from the rood top pool. We had a great room or rather apartment as we were upgraded. The hotel staff were great. I had a problem with a suitcase, its wheels were broken by the porter taking the bags to the room. I had no option but to buy a new suitcase. I replaced like for like and after some discussion with the hotel security guy, they paid in full for the new case. The ground floor has a casino, which was interesting to look at but we are not gamblers. Within minutes we were in the old town and spent 4 days exploring the old town. Although being in the old town, we had no problems sleeping. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: sherri2314
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here a day before we went on our cruise. First off, the staff were all rude beyond belief. From the bell boy, reservations and maid service I did not encounter one friendly or helpful person. Check-in was ridiculous, we waited patiently in line and several people would walk right up to the front and the front desk people who wait on them. When we finally got our room key the none of the elevators (which requires you insert your key) did not worked. Best part if when I went to tell the front desk they asked me to wait back in line for a new key! Once we got in our room, I immediately went to take a shower and was shocked to find a huge clump of hair on the wall and on one of the towels. My boyfriend called maid service twice no one ever came. I then called and she came 2 hours later! The hotel was so loud with drunk people and kids running down the hall all night. When we woke up in the morning we went to make coffee and there was moldy water in the machine. I called and let the front desk know and they did not say sorry or offer to send up another one. When I checked out I asked for a reciept and she mentioned I did not need one becasue I had no room charges but mentioned I still wanted one because I travel a lot and sometime get randon charges I did not make. It was a huge struggle to just give me the printout. We then gave the bell boy our luggage to hold for a few hours before our boat left as many people did and when we came back he misplaced them and it took over 45 minutes to find. Luckily everything was there but I will NEVER stay in this hotel again and was very dissapointed in the Sheraton for having a hotel and people representing their name. here were two beds when we requested a king

Reviews.Title: “I didn't like it much”
Reviews.Author: BloomingMisfit
Reviews.Content: A room for a married couple turned out to be a room cluttered with two full beds rather than one queen. There was no room for an armchair - the only chair in the room was for the desk, from which, incidentally, the TV could not be seen, due to the cumbersome clothing armoire blocking the view. Neither did that single chair make the room service meal for TWO persons (which meal had lost too much of its heat by the time it arrived) easy to partake of. A request for a different room - one with a view better than the nondescript rooftop of some lower building connected to the hotel or next door, and one without the noise of the ice maker dropping ice each time it was accessed by any guest - was denied. The actual reason was "purchases via (internet travel sites named) are given RUN OF THE MILL rooms - if you want anything better, you shall have to pay extra. This was a 3.5 star room, which felt like a 2 star room. The location, however, is good for tourists of the old city. Food prices around the location are, well, pricey. The cost of parking absolutely prohibited my plan to rent a vehicle. $20 per day is inexcusable, under ANY circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cookmb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. We stayed here post cruise. Check-in was easy. We arrived around 11am and did our pre check-in. They stored our luggage and took my cell number to call us when the room was ready. We had a room by 1pm and were upgraded to a Jr. Suite. Rooms are OK. No fridge or mini-bar which I would expect in a higher level hotel. Biggest complaint was that the gym was closed for renovation, which meant the pool was also closed. It was obsecenely hot in Puerto Rico and a pool would have been nice. Did not eat in the fancy restaurant but did eat at Chicago Burger Co., which is attached to the hotel. Good burger but pricey. My biggest praise was for the staff at the hotel. Everyone we dealt with was extremely friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Loved location and satisfied with hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustPA
Reviews.Content: The day staff was extremely helpful and assisted with planning excursions and getting any extras like additional towels or toothpaste. The room was tasteful and clean with a view of the harbor. Each day we didn't use housekeeping, we got coupons for $5 towards a meal at one of the Sheraton Old San Juan's restaurants, which was a nice perk. The location was fabulous. A post office, CVS and a few restaurants were right around the corner and it was a short walk to the forts, additional restaurants and shopping. We received vouchers for breakfast at the hotel, which was another highlight. Made to order omelets, a selection of fruits and breads, hot items like sausage and potatoes, along with pastries and oatmeal rounded out a filling and healthy breakfast. We also visited the rooftop pool and saw fireworks one evening. The gym is open 24/7 and included TVs, water machine and the essentials. During the week, the hotel was quiet and the smokefree casino was not a problem, people there weren't rowdy or loud. We did have loud neighbors one evening, but they turned off the music at midnight, so no problems sleeping. Otherwise, the hotel was about 45-60 minutes from the El Yunque and about 1.5 hours from snorkeling in Farajardo.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, everyone was so pleasant”
Reviews.Author: tljgolf
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. We got an upgrade when we arrived to a waterfront view with a balcony at no extra cost. The room was clean and spacious. Great location to Old San Juan. The staff was very helpful and happy! We want to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: FRANKRAFFA
Reviews.Content: The Shearton Old San Juan is a big "positive" so far. Apart from the fact that you enter and the CASINO may call you, it is a beautiful hotel with beautiful rooms and is in the middle of Old SAN JUAN. You can walk everywhere from here(if you don't mind extreme humidity!!!). I have a room with a king bed and there is a safe(a premium for me to keep my computer safe), coffee maker, nice desk and "wired" internet. The one drawback for me is that there is no wireless above the second floor. Therefore you cannot use your internet everywhere in the room. I always prefer using my computer while watching tv. Not at this hotel. Apart from that, there is a beautiful restaurant PALIO which is ITALIAN and has an intredible buffet breakfast for $18. Outside, if you do not mind being helped with your food by 20 pigeons, there is a beautiful deck overlooking the port where you can eat (again-remember the HUMIDITY!!) N.B, the hotel taxes and service fees are on a daily basis. You can expect an extra 25% on your room fare. Keep that in mind! The bed was INCREDIBLE. I don't know if it's my imagination, but I slept the best that I have in years!!! The internet is free and you only have to put in your room and last name. It looks like the pool is incredible. It's an all-year pool with the roof opened during the good weather. It is an incredible choice, with friendly people at the front desk, but not the charm of a smaller hotel in San Juan like "EL CONVENTO".

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION TO ATTRACTIONS”
Reviews.Author: mhatter58
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Despite the long check in time. We arrived at 3:00 and had to wait over 2 hours to get a room. Once in the room it was all good from there. The rooms are clean, large and well maintained. This hotel is close to all of the attractions. One block from the ferry that takes you out to the rum factory. One block from where the pickup is for the free trolley. My husband and I enjoy walking so this was awesome. Street venders everywhere........ Very nice. I would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel and will go back myself. Because of the wait for the room we were upgraded to a nicer room and also given some freebies... Things may not always be good, but it ends up being the customer service that responds to it, that makes it worth while.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we could have gone back”
Reviews.Author: DixiePa
Reviews.Content: We began our vacation in PR with 1 day in Old San Juan. It was a little difficult to find the hotel's entrance - it is in an alley. The location was great ; very close to restaurants and shopping. The area is very walkable. We had a waterfront room with a great view of the piers. The room was very spacious, with a sitting area in the front and bedroom in the rear. Quiet, Comfortable. We wanted to return for our last day in PR, but the hotel was full.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: PJP567
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline and got the room for $50.00 per night. Close to everything in Old San Juan, right on the waterfront. If cruising with Royal Caribbean it is a bit of a taxi ride to the Panamerican Pier but still reasonable by cab, ~ 20. First not received a free upgrade to a suite, very nice. Second night (after a cruise) it was quite busy and crowded. Had to wait for our room due to massive number of cruisers checking in. Went to get lunch and front desk agent gave us a room ahead of others on the list when we checked back early. Very thankful for this. They also held our luggage for us while waiting. Room Service food was decent as well. Pool was crowded with kids, no staff monitoring this.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous ~ can't wait to return next year!”
Reviews.Author: RJandBubba
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights prior to our cruise and knowing what we know now, we would have foregone the cruise and just stayed in Old San Juan. The staff from housekeeping, restuarants and the front desk were so very warm and friendly, we were made to feel like we were with family. There was an issue with our pre-paid reservation which I told George (the front desk agent) I would resolve upon my return home. He told me not to worry that he'd have his accounting office take care of things. True to his word, the problem was resolved the next day. This was a 1st for me and I truly appreciate the efforts made on our behalf. The room was spacious, very clean and well maintained. We kept our balcony door open all night and the noise from the street was not in the least bothersome. The restaurant in the hotel was good value for the money and again, the staff was very warm and attentive without being annoying. The casino was fun and not too stingy. The adjacent Chicago Burgers, though pricey, is also good value for the money. My hubby is still talking about the giant burger he had. We've been recommending this hotel to all our friends and are planning to return next year. Calgary, Alberta travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, small pool”
Reviews.Author: PR_09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in historic Old San Juan, but please be advised that the swimming pool is very small. Another point is that when we arrived to make the check in, the room was not available at the check in time. The cost of the parking was $21.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: axraupp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the base of Old San Juan. OSJ is a pretty small town, so pretty much any hotel will be a great location. Everything is within walking distance. You can cover both forts and most of the shopping in one day. So, if you have several days here, take your time. Our room faced the SE so we had a view of the harbor. It seems that you will either have views of the harbor or the pretty town & forts. We used the rooftop pool, which is small, but satisfying. We don't gamble, so didn't really check out the casino, though it appears rather small. There are parking garages around, but we just decided to valet it. US$20/day isn't too bad. The local garages appear to charge ~$40/day, but I didn't verify that. With the town being so small, you walk just for a few minutes and find any number of restaurants. I suggest eating outside on the bricked up street to the NE of the hotel. We were there in an off period, so there were no cruise ships, though with 8-10 docks, it probably gets really crowded on "excursion days."

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Atimonan
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for 1 night and used our SPG points. My husband and I wished we could have stayed longer!! Closed to everything, 10 min to the airport, cruise ships port across the street, good restaurants, and shopping. I like this hotel but my only complain was the room is dark!! We got a big room, one bedroom suite with a bayview with two flat screen TV. The sitting area has the bayview bathroom in the middle and at the end is the bedroom with no view. Check-in was a breeze but if you get there early there are no rooms ready, not available until 3 pm. Asked for a late check-out and got it w/o charge. Nice and friendly staff, didn't have problem at the front or check-in. Didn't have time to do much but found good restaurant at the back of the hotel and go up the stairs there are a couple of nice restaurants and Starbucks. I would recommend to stay here on the weekend, a lot of things to do and a lot of people. If you like to be on the beach and a big swimming pool, this is not the hotel for you, no beach and a small pool on the 9th floor with limited lounge chairs maybe only 12. The bedroom has nice comfy bed and nice pluffy king size pillows, but the comforter is way too heavy so I got rid of that. Didn't try the restaurants in the hotel because of the reviews I read.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: live2travel808
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights at the Sheraton Old San Juan before our cruise on the Carnival Victory. I told the girl at the front desk that we were celebrating my parentsâ€™ 50th wedding anniversary and she quickly arranged for their stay to be special. They were upgraded to a suite with an ocean view which included a bottle of champagne and chocolates. My parents were very pleasantly surprised! The hotel was very nice and the staff was very pleasant and helpful. The rooms were clean, spacious and comfortable. We took advantage of the free internet access and use of computers in the lobby. There is also a casino, small pool, fitness room, and rental car office on site. Shopping and restaurants were all within walking distance as well as our cruise ship dock. We were a little concerned about being so close to the dock, which was right across the street, but it was not a problem. The location was nice and we felt safe walking around, even at night. We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel to those going on a cruise as well as people who want to be in the heart of Old San Juan. Just be prepared for large crowds on the days the cruise ships arrive in port. There was a very long line at the front desk and with the bellhop. We checked out over the phone and called the bellhop to take our luggage instead of waiting in line and that worked out very well. We didnâ€™t sail until late that evening so we had the hotel hold our luggage for us until we were ready to check in at the ship. I would definitely stay at this hotel the next time I take a cruise out of San Juan. It was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service, Parking is the only problem!”
Reviews.Author: yshxa
Reviews.Content: We arrived the hotel at night and the guy in the door told me the hotel had no parking lot and I had to park my car in a parking lot in the next street for $0.5 per hour (I heard the hotel has itself parking for $20 per night). So I went to the next street, found a parking lot and parked there. The next day when we left, we found the parking fee is $42! It is actually a public parking lot and have no contract with the hotel. Maybe we went to the wrong parking lot but the hotel should have given a more clear guidance because we are not familiar to this area. The other services are really good. The front desk girl upgraded our room to a suite, with great location and view. I will come to the hotel again but I prefer not driving there.

Reviews.Title: “My top pick for my business travel”
Reviews.Author: jrs576
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nothing spectacular but I always stay here when I travel to PR for business. Has good breakfast that's included in my rate and have tons of restaurants nearby. Rates are cheap. Located in Old San Juan so can walk to see the main tourist area on the island. Pool on roof. Fitness center kind of sucks.

Reviews.Title: “George at the front desk was great”
Reviews.Author: Sassysusie_11
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel wonderful location unlike other reviews we got there around 1:00 pm had george check us in went right to our rooms and george was great helped us later that day with walking maps and A place to get lunch . Just i quick trip just got back and the con artist that you read about is still there he tryed to con us right before we got to the hotel the story about his father is really sick or he got bet up and he needs money for a taxi to go get him. I just started laughing when he stopped us because i had read about him on this sight so i told him he was famous and he walked off. any have fun great hotel and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the photos”
Reviews.Author: veterantraveler12
Reviews.Content: Good: - We were allowed to use the pool and shower well after our checkout time. Bad: - Sheets were unclean and room was dirty - Evening staff didn't tell us about the amenities the location had to offer. - Photos don't really tell you how small the pool really is. - In House restaurants, especially the Chicago Burger Company, were terrible - VERY NOISY SUMMARY: If you aren't a cruise ship passenger, this hotel is not for you. It's not worth staying here, and spending the money it costs. Get a better hotel option.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean . . . . . . . but Poor Sleep Quality”
Reviews.Author: Tooty91
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in front of the Old San Juan cruise ship port. It is in walking distance to all of the historical sights in Old San Juan. The local map of Old San Juan from the tourist district is not to scale. I'm in moderate shape, and it was a very leisurely walk. There is such a grid-lock of vehicles, we walked around quicker than the free trolley could get us from point A to point B. The hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, and it was in a convenient location, but we didn't sleep very well at all. We were left to wonder if the walls were made of paper because we heard every guest's conversations as plain as if they were standing right in our room. We had an early flight out the next morning, so we went to bed at a decent time, but that didn't matter as we heard every guest right into the early morning hours. I would not stay here again for this reason only. If you don't mind the noise, this was a nice hotel. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom had a large tub. We didn't use the rooftop pool, but it looked very nice and relaxing. I would have liked a refrigerator in our room, but there was not one. I don't know if you can request one or not though because I didn't try. I also appreciated that there was free internet for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service”
Reviews.Author: Danineves
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel all over the world, we use our Starwood points for many of our trips. The hotel had horrible service, we even got talked back by the person at the check in counter! Being a Starwood Preffered guest you get certain percs, such as a separate check in line, at this hotel it did not matter. Lobby area is outdated and small. The room was ok, but I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible except its location”
Reviews.Author: caltraveler007
Reviews.Content: My family stayed there for one night after a Caribbean cruise. The lobby was in chaos when we got there by 11am. People were standing and sitting all over the place. Our check-in was delayed several times before we were told the room was ready by 4:40pm. Our San Juan exploring plan was ruined because of this. When we finally got into the room at 7pm, we found a smelly room was waiting for us. The room was definitely far below Sheraton standard. I have to say the staff were friendly, but just couldn't resolve anything.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible musty smell in both rooms we were placed in”
Reviews.Author: WheretonextBOS
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a FABULOUS location for walking around Old San Juan and for the cruise ships. When we got to our 1st room it had the worst musty smell ever. I've stayed in hostels and mom/pop places all over and have never had a smell like that. We immediately went to the lobby and asked to switch. The staff apologized and switched us right away. The problem was Room 2 was just as bad. At this point, after a long work and travel day we just decided to stay. Room was fairly clean, pool was pleasant and location was great. However, not up to Sheraton standards.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: betty1513
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my mom and my 15 year old. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms were pretty basic. The room did have a sort of dingy wet smell. They could use new carpeting. The rooms are a little expensive, but we didn't pay for the room we paid for the great location the hotel is located at. It's smack in the middle of old San Juan. Very close to shops and restaurants and of course the marina. The hotel has a nice pool on the roof over looking the marina-very pretty. Based on where the hotel is located I would stay here again. Oh, but do not eat at the restaurant on the 2nd floor- not good at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Cruise ship passengers beware!”
Reviews.Author: enjoyingtime5
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a horrible experience for a Sheraton! George Rodregiez should not be in the hotel business. The other two front desk agents were friendly and helpful but Geoge was such a petty and miserable man that he refused to allow any check-ins before 3:30 pm. What kind of service is that? This is the closest hotel to the cruiseship terminal in Old San Juan so they should be used to the high turn-over each Sunday. We check-in at 8:30 am, on a Sunday, after a 2 week cruise, we were told we were 3rd in line for a room and we be assigned a room as soon as one was available. My cell phone didn't work in San Juan, so we went for breakfast, a walk around and checked back at 10:30 am to see if a room was ready, that's when we encountered "George". He basically told us that rooms would not be ready before 3 pm, and not to check with staff anymore in a very unpleasant, arogant and dismissive manner, even though other staff told us that we would be contacted as soon as a room was available. We were also waiting in line for our car rental at Hertz (that we reserved,) which was also not ready. At around noon, my husband checked back at the front desk (after waiting in line of course) and was told that a room was still not available. I also asked if we could pay for an upgrade for another room that may be available, but was told no rooms were available. We needed to leave the hotel at 2 pm to drive to an excursion on the other side of the island so we checked back again for an available room before leaving. We were told that George was at lunch and that George told them they were not allowed to assign any rooms until after 3:30 pm, AFTER he returned from lunch. We retrieved some items from our stored luggage and left for our excursion (returning at 11:30 pm). The port staff were pleasant and helpful, dispite the kaos. We ran into other cruisers from our ship on the excursion who went to the "other" Sheraton and said they were checked-in and given a room right away. I have to say, I've stayed at many Sheratons, Hyatts, Hiltons, Fairmonts, etc, and have never ran into such an un-service oriented hotel worker. The lobby was crazy (far too small) most of the time we were there, you'd think they would want to get as many people into rooms as soon as possible. Of course, we were unable to use the "free internet" or pool before being assigned a room, so needless to say, we didn't get to see or use any of the ammenities. If this hotel wants to discourage cruise ship passengers from staying at this hotel, they are definitely on the right track -- actively keeping ALL guests from being able to check into rooms early, even Starwood members like me. The rooms were basic, no shampoo/conditioner, etc. but comfortable. If you are arriving after a cruise and staying in San Juan, I would suggest that you try another hotel who welcome and appreciate cruiseship passengers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for maritime folks”
Reviews.Author: Biggi61
Reviews.Content: We came from a cruise and added two days in San Juan. The hotel is located vis a vis the cruise ship piers and we enjoyed a great view of the cruise liners from our room. We also enjoyed the roof top pool. We walked everywhere in old town from the hotel. Very convenient and classy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stay!”
Reviews.Author: HappierTraveler
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the Sheraton Old San Juan. We did stay on Starwood Points. It is in a great location and the rooms were comfortable, clean and quiet. The lobby is a bit crazy, especially on weekends with all the cruise ship passengers coming and going. Very convenient to both cruise piers, though you do have to take a cab to Pan Am. We stayed pre & post cruise and have already booked for pre & post cruise next year.

Reviews.Title: “Staff & Location are the best assets”
Reviews.Author: Jeremysgirl09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one month with my husband who was in San Juan for business. The best things about this hotel is its location in Old San Juan and the staff. You can walk everywhere in Old San Juan easily and the hotel is right on the bay so some rooms have nice bay views and the patios of the restaurants have great ocean views of all the cruise ships coming and going. The staff overall was wonderful, friendly and very helpful-especially JANMARILY at the front desk and ALEX and LUIS who worked in both restaurants.
