The housekeeping staff was wonderful as well and if you put the sign on your door that you weren't interested in service, they actually respected that and did not come in. Often I would pass them in the hall and they would offer extra towels or see if there was anything we needed. Top notch housekeeping and I felt very comfortable that my things were safe in the room (unlike other places I have stayed in Puerto Rico). Negatives were there is no real hotel room service, only from the restaurants which are at the hotel, one being a burger place (mediocre at best) and one a more expensive Italian restaurant. The room service food available during the day is very limited and they stop at 11pm at night. Both restaurants are also pretty slow so don't go if you are starving. However the happy hour offered at the Italian restuarant, Il Palacio I think it was called, is great-VERY affordable drinks and appetizers. My other complaints were the water in the shower never held its temperature- it would go back and forth between hot and cold during every shower (and we stayed in 3 different rooms) and also half the equipment in the gym was broken or needed maintenance. These aren't the worst things to find in a hotel so overall I am giving them a good rating.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: sttlady
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton in Old San Juan was great. The hotel was clean and the staff was so friendly. I felt like they were having a contest or something to see who could be the nicest and most informative about the city! Another bonus was the rooftop pool and the workout facility overlooking the dock where the cruise ships dock. You can walk from the hotel to any of the great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location. Nothing unique about hotel itself.”
Reviews.Author: gregoryjm
Reviews.Content: Located in Old San Juan, which is what my fiance and I we were looking for. Otherwise, it's a pretty average hotel. It is located across the street from the cruise ship docks. There's a casino on the first floor, which is nice. For good local restaurants, I'd recommend walking a little bit away from the docks to find slightly lower prices and less touristy food.

Reviews.Title: “very expensive but friendly with no problems.”
Reviews.Author: scallawag540
Reviews.Content: Great bed very comfortable. Great spot to explore old san juan from. Great if you are going on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Sheraton Experience..”
Reviews.Author: Travaholic1
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for couple of nights. I loved the location.. but then entire Old San Juan is like few miles walk from anywhere anyway. Staff was not bad.. They should just have given me a brief overview of the facilities/services they had over there. I was a bit disappointed to see that my room didn't have much amenities, as a room in Sheraton with this kinda $$ should have had. My room being across from elevator was a bit noisy.. Everything was in working order though. I can stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel - do not hesitate to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: FDPevey
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone who has great things to say about this hotel â€“ location, location, location! What better opportunity in San Juan to tour to old city and enjoy the restaurants than being right in the middle of things? If you want to go tourist, thereâ€™s a Senor Frogs next door. If you want to go local, ask at the desk and theyâ€™ll steer you to the right local restaurant. Not porblem with noise once you're in the room - but the opportunity to enjoy San Juan the way you want out and about. I read the several reviews from visitors who had a delay in getting a room or weâ€™re happy with the service, and I canâ€™t help but wonder if they were at the same hotel where I was. Now, we didnâ€™t try to check in early and didnâ€™t ask for an upgrade after getting a great on-line room rate, but we did ask for directions, service at the restaurants, and help holding luggage when we had a late departure. Everything was handled well, the people were great, and the room was wonderful. I can't think of a single thing that I would change. If you like the standard Sheraton, youâ€™ll love this hotel. Enjoy San Juan, start or end your vacation right, be immersed in the culture and surroundings of the old city and stay at the Sheraton Old San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Best Way to Enjoy Old San Juan"”
Reviews.Author: WRT621
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times over the last 10 years or so. Last time I was there for a wedding in the Condado area, but decided to stay here with a group of friens so we could hang out day or night without having to drive. The price was great and we walked all over old SanJuan. I highly recommend this property for anyone traveling to San Juan, especially for leisure since you can see so much by foot and/or cab. Plus great for casino lovers too. The only drawback was the one night when a large cruise crowd showed up, but they were gone the next day. On the other hand, there was a large international ship at the dock offering tours and we hot to enjoy that also. Regarding the rooms, they are OK, not RitzCarlton like, but nice enough (I am picky about hotel rooms and have stayed at many of the other properties in San Juan). My advice, decide what you want to do/see in San Juan first and then choose your hotel. If you are looking for a beach vacation, do NOT stay here, but for everything else this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Unless you are going on a cruise, skip this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel30066
Reviews.Content: This place looked great online, but in reality, it seems to be poorly managed. We were not allowed to check in until 5:30pm because the rooms weren't clean yet, then we were finally given an unimpressive, dark, window-less room. Their excuse for the delay was that they were fully booked the night before. Really? Do they understaff the hotel and hope it's only 50% full? We attempted to eat at their restaurant, Chicago Burger Company, but left after 10 minutes of being completely ignored by the one stressed out employee trying to wait on about 15 tables by himself. The hotel was directly across from the ship piers, so if that's your destination, this place would be perfect. Otherwise, there's no real reason to choose it unless you get a good deal. It's nice and in a good location, but the poor service makes me not want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: rleon1992
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a medical conference. I find unacceptable that my room was scheduled to be available at 3:00 P.M. and I had to wait until 6:00 P.M. I was not even offered a discount or complementary refreshment to alleviate the in commodity. Also everything that people talk in the halls is heard inside the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Check in on Sunday”
Reviews.Author: MandyOwens
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, be prepared for a long wait if you're checking in on a weekend. The hotel just does not have the staff in place to turn rooms around quickly. Unfortunately for them, this means angry, frustrated guests who will remember their experience the next time they visit San Juan. My husband and I arrived early afternoon on Sunday, March 13th and were informed that we should check back at 3 pm because no rooms had been assigned yet. No big deal. We spent the next 45 minutes trying to track down a staff member to take our bags...a little annoying, but the hotel was busy and this was expected. After walking around Old San Juan for a few hours we returned at 5 pm and were shocked to find out that there were still over 20 guests in front of us waiting for rooms. Management at SPG really needs to take a look at this property and figure out these issues. If this property is having the same problems every weekend, obviously the solution is hiring a few more staff members to accommodate the heavy cruise traffic. Start your vacation on the right foot and stay at the Hotel El Convento just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great - Hotel not so much.”
Reviews.Author: Cookie510
Reviews.Content: Our 2 day stay at the hotel was post cruise. A huge let down in quality and service. We were told our rooms would be ready no later than 3pm and that they would call us when we could check in to the room. Walked around Old San Juan, had a delightful time. Returned to the hotel at 6pm and we told our rooms weren't ready. About an hour later we were able to check in to our adequate rooms. Location was great, hotel not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Long wait to get room.”
Reviews.Author: jenny1971
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the service that we got on March 13. Got to the hotel after a cruise. It was very busy and we found out we had to wait a couple of hours to get our room. After waiting 3 1/2 hours to get a room we were told by one of the desk workers that we may no even get a room! After my husband talked to another clerk she said to come back in one hour and then she would get us a room. I had a 10 year old son that we could not walk around with because he had a stomach bug. They did not care about that at all. This was a bad way to end a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Superior location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1philb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 days prior to a business trip to St Croix and two days after the trip. We had a suite overlooking the cruise ship terminal. The access to the attractions and restaurants in Old San Juan was truly superior. The hotel itself was adequate and the room location was quiet with a great view. Do not gamble at this casino - London rules on Blackjack and very few table games. Lots of slots but no really large payouts. This hotel is older and frankly need a renovation but the staff was friendly and the suite was large.

Reviews.Title: “Knock off the bad stuff”
Reviews.Author: amer_can
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in San Juan and the Old San Juan Sheraton could not have been a better place to stay. The staff were excellent. There is a new "green" policy that lets you decline daily maid/linen service..Great idea. There have been negative comments about this hotel but imho knock it off. Ignore any negatives and enjoy this place. Room 633 had a "juliet balcony" with view of the cruise ship docks.Again just great and I can heartly reccommend it. I am a senior and the peace and quiet, consideration and helpful suggestions from the front desk and T. Schmidtz were much appreciated.. Go and have a good time..

Reviews.Title: “I would not go there if it wasn't for location!”
Reviews.Author: rashiars511
Reviews.Content: I checked in a little late but had informed the guest services that I will be arriving in late and they said its okay. Upon arrival, we were given 2 double beds and it was our wedding anniversary. I requested for a king bed but they said that they have priority for those who did not book through orbitz or priceline. Several discussions went through but no use! Finally we got a room with a king size bed but we got it at around 9:00 pm and we checked out at 5:00am so, thanks! but no thanks! The staff was not friendly! I stayed at some other hotel for the first few nights and I loved it there but the people over here were rude. Anyway, the location is awesome. It's in the center and in front of harbor. Couple of minutes walk to all major eating joints....and the bus station. Taxi service is available 24X7. If you ask me in case I enjoyed my hotel then no!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not fancy”
Reviews.Author: PoisonPrincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights while en route to another Caribbean destination. It is clearly an old hotel, and the rooms aren't fancy. However, it is VERY well-maintained. Everything seemed freshly painted and carpets looked new. There is a casino which we did not visit. This seems to be a good hotel if you are taking a cruise, as it is very close to several of the piers. While the rooms are pretty sound-proof and quiet, if you open the window/door to catch some of the fresh breezes, it is pretty noisy. The pool was small and looked clean but the piped-in music was way too loud. All of the employees of this hotel seemed very well trained, and were exceedingly friendly and accommodating. Being in Old Town allowed us to walk around to explore the area; we dined outside the hotel for all of our meals, so I can't comment on food.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: mom2two2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night post-cruise and had a great experience. We had early disembarkation from the ship as we wanted to explore Old San Juan and as a result, were at the hotel at about 9:30 am with all our luggage in tow. Porter was at the back of the taxi right as we pulled up with a luggage cart, loaded everything and gave us a claim ticket to collect our bags later. Front desk was very helpful with directions on how to catch a free trolley out to El Morro. When we did return to the hotel to check in, we found a very clean room, nice and big with very comfy beds. Free internet access allowed us to check in and print boarding passes for our return flight home. We did not eat at the hotel so I cannot comment there. We asked for a very early wake up call as we had to get to the airport by 5:30 am and front desk called after the automated wake up call to make sure we had received it and had gotten up, which I thought was very nice. We did get this hotel at a cut rate though, through Hotwire as it was very expensive otherwise. We were really happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: cc1211
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel on Hotwire I wasn't sure what to expect. It truly is a solid hotel in a great location. You'll have to pay a premium for waterfront views, but it's not necessary as you'll simply be using your room to sleep. This hotel is a perfect "home base" as you walk the streets of Old San Juan and stroll along the waterfront admiring the cruise ships. The shops, the eateries and the historic sites are all at your fingertips during the day, and El Casino provides a delightful diversion at night. On a final note, the fitness center is compact but high quality - I got in some killer workouts and sweated out the previous night's rum while taking in a 9th floor view of paradise. I'd definitely stay here again but at the right price, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations.”
Reviews.Author: kschuren
Reviews.Content: We live two hours south of Chicago and couldn't wait to get out of the snow. We booked a standard room on Priceline and got the room at a nice discount to begin. When we arrived we were greeted with warm smile and upgraded to a superior king with a beautiful bay view on the 5th floor!! The elevators are key secured making us feel safe. After checking out the nice pool and excercise equipment we asked one of the ladies at the desk where to get some authentic Puerto Rican food for dinner, she suggested Latin Roots (only a block away) What a great place! We had Lechon and mufungo. Lechon is roasted pork on a spit...wow they cooked it right!! Flavorful, tender and mouthwatering. Then we walked around town and felt safe. We came back and enjoyed the casino and doubled our money! Our room was very spacious with the most comfortable bed, pillows and comforter. It's the first time I didn't have a hard time falling asleep in a hotel. The tv was a large flatscreen and we watched some college basketball. The bathroom had a large vanity and the water pressure was great. The towels were big and soft. In the morning we took the free trolley all around Old San Juan. The front desk ladies were very friendly and helpful again and told us where to go for some great pastries. They extended our checkout time by an hour...which was really nice. Then they got us a cab to the airport to meet some family then we were going on to Culebra. I left my purse in the cab and it had cash and credit cardsand expensive cell phone along with id etc etc. We filled out a missing report with transportation at the airport .(everyone was very helpful there too ) We were hoping that by some miracle we would get my purse back. (There are over 1,000 cabs in SJU) We had 3 hours to kill before going to the small airport so we all hopped in a cab and went back to the Sheraton. Everyone there was so sypathetic and tried to help us. My husband was talking with two gentlemen at the Sheraton who help with the cabs. They asked for a discription of the driver the best thing could think of was he played Air Supply cd and we all sang "I'm All Out Of Love" while he was driving us in the van. Then one of the guys said "that's Santiago, he plays that all the time!!!!" He knew another guy who had Santiago's cell and he helped us get ahold of him. Santiago had already gone home but found my purse in his van and drove it 25 minutes to us. We tipped him handsomely and the gentlemen who helped us. That gave me such a good feeling. The ladlies at the desk were celebrating with me and were genuinely happy for me!! Most people wouldn't have given a rip. But The Sheraton folks had real "class and heart" GOD BLESS YOU ALL AND WE HOPE TO SEE YOU AGAIN!!!!! GOD DOES ANSWER PRAYER!! WHEN YOU NEED A CAB CALL JUAN SANTIAGO..787-613-2099. GREAT HONEST GUY!! GOD BLESS YOU JUAN!!! WE'LL ALWAYS REMEMBER YOU AND WILL SEE YOU AGAIN!!!!! :) PS.. We had lunch at their outside restaurant and the chicken sandwiches were great!! Thank you Sheraton for making our stay memorable and very comfortable. FROM THE DOOR MAN TO THE WAIT STAFF EVERYONE WAS HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY. WHEN YOU GIVE A SMILE , YOU'LL GET A SMILE. :) The only small negative would be that their carpet in the room was showing some wear. But it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Totally awesome hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: cruizinroxyroller
Reviews.Content: Arrived late and was greated by a smiling front desk fellow named "Max".We had booked this room through Priceline for 4 nites pre-cruise and one nite after cruise. We werent sure what we were going to get for our $110/nite. To our surprise Max upgraded us to a suite for the 5 nites, and got us a fridge for our stay. He really went out of his way to make sure we enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton. The staff always waved and greeted us whenever we coming or going. Very friendly. The hotel was very busy, and there was always enough staff to keep everything running smoothly. The hotel is well situated across from the ship piers, and easily walkable. There is a Starbucks, Subway, CVS pharmacy,Senor Frogs within steps from the hotel. About 10 min walk into the heart of the downtown core. Everything seems to be open very late. Bus service right outside and taxis. Small rooftop pool, gym, and hot tub. Hotel was very clean, and always saw workers cleaning. I had read unfavourable reviews about this hotel, but I think these people would complain about anything. For us there was no negative here,,,and cant wait to revisit the Sheraton Old San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it if you can get a deal”
Reviews.Author: MarkTravel616
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for a winter stay in January for $106 per night taxes and everything included. It was worth that price but I realize this hotel can charge much more for the stay. The hotel was very clean. The front desk staff upon arrival were VERY friendly, offering suggestions on local restaurants and attractions. The room was clean and much larger than I had anticipated. Casino on site is minimal (think cruise ship size casino). The on site restaurant is adequate at best (please skip the over salted, cold yet expensive breakfast buffet) but they do offer a half-price drink happy our at their outdoor patio overlooking the cruise ship dock and water. All of the waiters at the restaurant were VERY friendly. Maid service was sporadic and frequently room had not been cleaned when I'd arrive back around 2 or 3 in the afternoon and was ready for a nap. For some odd reason, the maid only left two towels each visit. Two nights the room was not cleaned at all. Skip the touristy chain restaurants nearby and walk a few blocks to more authentic puerto rican fair. The pool is VERY small. The gym is VERY small. Overall was satisfied with the hotel but only because I got a much reduced room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: Lissette1
Reviews.Content: Although the area is very nice, the actual Hotel was very over priced. I live in Wisconsin and we have many family members that live in Puerto Rico but decided that it would be nice to not have to bother anyone. Thank Goodness I'm familiar with the area. The prices were ridiculously high even for tourists. We are once again going to Puerto Rico in June 2011, I have this time decided to rent a beach house and for just a few cents more I am able to enjoy the beach directly in front of the house and since there is a full kitchen, I am also able to enjoy cooking some of the traditional foods that I so enjoy. In addition, the cost of food if I don't feel like cooking is reasonable to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Stay ANYWHERE else but this Sheraton if you're not on a cruise”
Reviews.Author: JVanasco
Reviews.Content: If you're staying one night before or after a cruise, then the Sheraton is perfect - great location to the docks and to Old San Juan. If you're staying to see the city or Puerto Rico, however, then stay somewhere - anywhere - else. We had read the negative reviews here, but we bought a package and so were locked into the hotel. Our "water view" room was actually facing Senor Frogs restaurant, with a sliver of water - and the windows don't open to let in the water breezes. The window was tiny and the room was cramped, with not a lot of space to put your clothes. Really nice bed, though. Also, the breakfast is overpriced and eh - although the room does look over the water. There's not a traditional lobby - just a casino - so if it rains (as it did for 2 days on our trip), there's nowhere to just hang out for a bit and have a drink or read a book or talk to fellow travelers. The worst thing about the hotel, however - the reason why we wouldn't go back - is the service. In general, we find Puerto Ricans (my partner is one) to be friendly, accomodating, helpful people. Not at this hotel. When we arrived, the front desk staff insisted that we were at the wrong Sheraton and that we weren't booked into the hotel. When it turned out he had misspelled the name - which is why he couldn't find us in the computer - he got angry at us. When we asked a different front desk staffer if she had recommendations for breakfast, she couldn't suggest a single place. (We found one by waiting for a hotel computer and then consulting Trip Advisor!) When I had a health emergency and needed to find a doctor, the concierge argued - and then finally gave us the main number of a hospital switchboard. If my partner hadn't spoken Spanish, we would have been in real trouble. I have traveled all over the world and honestly I have never stayed in a hotel where the staff was this obviously rude and unhelpful. I don't know why they are unhappy, but they clearly are. We're planning to go back to PR in March - we are definitely staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: MassTraveler
Reviews.Content: Finished a cruise and decided to stay one more night in San Juan. Chose the Sheraton as it is walking distance from the cruise ships. This is very convenient. However the hotel is average at best. Nothing special. Don't stay here for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit tired.”
Reviews.Author: AlohaShan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Puerto Rico over Christmas and stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan for 5 days because of it's location which is awesome! We used it as a base to explore and drive around the whole island during the day, then we could park the car and walk all over Old San Juan exploring some really amazing restaurants, bars and shops. It would also be the perfect location pre or post cruise. That said, I wouldn't consider it anything more than basically a place to sleep. Our room was on a higher floor overlooking the docks where the cruise ships come in which was scenic but the room itself is plain but serves it's purpose. The hotel is older so the elevators are small, there's only 2 and they are slow. Be prepared for hordes of pre and post cruisers checking in with tons of luggage into the really small lobby, but considering the amount of turn over and 1 night stays this hotel has, I think they do a pretty good job. We checked out the casino which is small but ok for trying out a couple of slot machines. The only other thing is the hotel is impossible to find if you're not familiar with the area. It took us over an hour to get to the hotel from the airport when it should have taken about 15 minutes (granted it was at night). All the directions you get ahead of time seem easy enough but the words on the directions don't match the freeway signs and when you actually get into Old San Juan there's alot of one way streets that get confusing. There was no signage at street level, only at the very top of the hotel. But getting lost makes things memorable right?!?!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Stay in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: TropiCAL2003
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 11 AM after not sleeping during the night on a red-eye flight from LAX and were told we would have to wait for our room, and that many others were ahead of us from much earlier in the morning (despite reserving directly with hotel and stating we would be an early arrival and being a Hilton Honors member). We took a few bags with us that we did not want to leave with bellman (laptop and purse/cameras) and found a place for lunch that was so-so after walking up and down some streets when a local resident recommended a place to us. The map the hotel clerk had given us and mentioned place for lunch adjacent was closed. We went back to the hotel after lunch, and were told by another desk clerk we had to wait and that many others ahead of us, but then fortunately the woman desk clerk (she had talked to us initially to check in earlier) said okay to let us have our room. We had booked one overlooking the bay. Once we had our room we immediately crashed to sleep for hours. Later we went out for dinner and walked along Paseo de la Princessa which was a delightful introduction to San Jose in the evening with beautiful fountains, music, and vendors - totally enjoyable. Back to the hotel for a good night's rest before taking a taxi to go to the Celebrity cruise ship at another pier the next day. The room had a safe so we could lock up valuables and hotel was in a good location. We ate breakfast at the hotel in the morning which was decent (but expensive) and wait staff was not attentive to refill coffee or water or take order. In summary, good hotel in nice location but don't expect great service. I had to use my data card as I could not get Internet to work.

Reviews.Title: “Most Convenient Modern Hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: wecallis
Reviews.Content: If you want to see the sights of Old San Juan or if you need a hotel before or after a cruise, this is by far your best option. The hotel is within walking distance to everything in Old San Juan and the cruise port (note, however, that Royal Caribbean and Celebrity dock on the opposite side of the lagoon, closer to the Convention Center area). Although the rooms are a bit dated, they seem clean and were above par for Sheraton properties. The casino is the nicest in the area, and the only one nicer in Peurto Rico is at the Ritz Carlton. Restaurants are all around, and for anyone on a budget, a Starbucks is two blocks behind the hotel for an inexpensive breakfast, and a brand new CVS is a block away at the front of the hotel for snacks, drinks, and liquor. Overall, the hotel shows some signs of aging, but not as badly as many other hotels in San Juan, and the location of this property simply cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Parts of this hotel was below standards - parts were okay...”
Reviews.Author: much2buzy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for our post-cruise travels from December 26-28. Checking in was an absolute nightmare! Tiny lobby with crazy long lines. Took over an hour to check-in. Our luggage was a HUGE concern because once we checked in, the bellhop left our luggage totally unattended in the lobby for about 15 minutes. I spoke with a manager who was not all that concerned. I finally found the bellhop and asked him to put our luggage away. He assured me all was fine then left it unattended one more time! Needless to say, I was surprised when we did get our luggage delivered to our room later that afternoon. I thought for sure that it was out in the back alley. First room they gave us had an adjoining room and I could hear every bit of the neighbors conversation. I asked for a new room which they gave me without hesitation. Next room was okay. Faced the parking lot. The first night, we were wide awake until about 2am because of a band that was either playing right under our bed or somewhere too close for comfort. The room was decent, however, it had an odd smell and the windows would not open to let the fresh air in. The pool area was decent. Very pretty at night because of the lights in the pool area and the city. In my opinion the location was perfect for us, however, the hotel needs to bring its operating standards up. I thought the hotel was way over priced for what you get but heck... you are on vacation, right?

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: marta00969
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 3 nights. Dinner at rest. first night DISASTER!! Waited over an hour and 15 min for 4 hamburgers. Waitress, no clue. Management even more clueless!! We left and had a wonderful meal at AL Dente one block away. As we were leaving other patrons followed.

Reviews.Title: “Dreary Hotel, Freezing Cold Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SunFlight
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Sheraton. It was tired, with dreary rooms, few windows, was loud, and the cleaning service kept turning the temp down to 60 degrees!!! (insanely cold and so wasteful. But the beds were comfortable, the location was nice, the water pressure was great, and the reading chairs were also very comfortable. Our room faced the pier, and it was very loud with cheezy sidewalk music and the cruise boats set off a very loud horn late at night. (we needed to keep the window open because it was so cold in the room).

Reviews.Title: “valerie at front desk needs a lesson in customer service - "all double double rooms face parking lot"”
Reviews.Author: BRIDGEWATER_11
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU NEED A DOUBLE DOUBLE ROOM - I WAS TOLD BY VALERIE AT THE FRONT DESK THAT ALL THE ROOMS WITH TWO DOUBLE BEDS FACE THE GARGAGE. I am actually writing this review from the lobby of the hotel - front desk staff needs to remember most "Americans" understand a little Spanish. Before going on a cruise that leaves from San Juan I made reservations at the Sheraton Old San Jual for 3 nights. My husband and daughter were expecting some rest and relaxtion from the holidays - NOT. I called and confirmed our reservation two days before arriving. The reservationist told me that we had a Starwood Preferred Guest Double room with a "CITY VIEW" - and that I should check with the front desk at check in about getting a Harbor/Bay View. When we checked in I did just that - and the gentleman that checked us in told me that we are on the highest floor with a city view. Valerie was also at the front desk and with a straight face - said, "You even have a balcony". The bellman brought our bags upstairs and when we walked into the room - it smelt DAMP and Moldy. I walked over to the wooden shutters that covered the "Patio Door" to see our "city view" and the "Balcony", From our room our view was a 9 floor parking gargage that was across a narrow alley. THE BALCONY was 1 and 1/2' wide (and I am being generous) I asked the bellman about the view and she said let's call the front desk In Spanish - he told VALERIE that I was not happy with the view (this is the only side of the conversation I could hear) and after years of Spanish in HS and College and living in NYC - I understood perfectly what he said. Valerie had him put me on the phone and said "What can I do for You?" - pretending like she had no idea what I was talking about. THE WORST THING A FRONT DESK CLERK can do IS PLAY THE GUEST FOR AN IDIOT. She told me that all of the double double rooms faced the parking gargage and that if I wanted a room with a view I would have had to reserve a King Bed and have a roll away brought into the room. She also told me that the room would be smaller (if that was possible). THE MOST FRUSTRATING PART WAS THAT I SPECIFICALLY ASKED ABOUT THE SIZE AND VIEW WHEN WE CHECKED IN AND WITH A STRAIGHT FACE VALERIE TOLD ME I HAD A CITY VIEW WITH A BALCONY. IN ADDITION THE CAR ALARMS FROM THE PARKING GARGAGE WENT OFF ALL NIGHT LONG. I KNEW WHEN I BOOKED THE HOTEL THAT IT WAS IN OLD SAN JUAN - AND THAT IT WAS IN THE CITY - WHAT I DIDN'T EXCEPT WAS A VIEW OF A PARKING GARAGE AND THE SOUND OF CAR ALARMS. HONESTY IS ALWAYS THE BEST POLICY WITH GUESTS AND BEING - AND THIS IS OBVIOUSLY NOT THE PRACTICE ENCOURAGED AT THE SHERATON SAN JUAN.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you MUST stay in Old San Juan, and this is your only option..."”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug8277
Reviews.Content: We were spending 3 nights in San Juan, and were advised that Old San Juan was where we should spend our time. This was great advice. Deciding to stay at the Sheraton in Old San Juan based on price for the area (we booked last minute) was not our best decision. It is a very corporate and Americano feeling hotel, which was fine and something we expected. We were there for the sights of Old San Juan, not the hotel, so we thought it would be fine... plus it had a casino in case it rained. Okay, the casino was a total joke. Definitely head to the Condado area for that. The concierge at the hotel was atrocious. She was never at her desk, so to make a reservation or seek advice. You had to go find her in the lobby vs. calling from your room. Twice she gave us the wrong information, and when she took my number to call with an update, she NEVER called. Maybe its a Puerto Rican custom, or maybe just laziness, but in the three nights we were there, our room was only cleaned once after we asked three times for it to be taken care of. I have never stayed in a big name hotel that did not clean daily. The gym area was nice, and the rooftop pool small. Location is the only reason we chose this hotel, and in the end the only reason one should stay here. For over $300 a night, we expected more... and feel we didn't even get the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: richnindy
Reviews.Content: Most people who have reviewed this hotel have stayed for only a night pre- or post-cruise. We actually stayed six nights only because we got a $100 rate through Priceline. The location is actually pretty good -- go up a block and a half or so and you're right in the happening SoFo district. But the hotel itself is on a busy major street with no charm, and the hotel itself is . . . well, it's a Sheraton hotel. Front desk was fairly friendly, but we were repeatedly promised another room and no one ever followed through. We asked for another room because, like another reviewer, we were positioned on the 9th floor right between the elevators and the workout area/pool, so there was a LOT of traffic. We eventually got used to it, though. There are only two elevators, but we only had one extremely long wait. The room was clean and fairly sizable, with comfy beds and a decent bathroom and nice shower. Basically, what you would expect from a basic Sheraton. The lobby can get very crowded with people visiting the casino. The hotel is certainly nothing special, but it was a fine place to spend each night. We don't spend much vacation time in our hotel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Location --”
Reviews.Author: hotsy
Reviews.Content: We flew in a day early and came home a day late after our recent 12/12/10 cruise on the Millennium --- in retrospect, that was a very wise decision. The Sheraton, even with it's very hectic pace(casino is on the main level), was a very well-run and satisfying choice. It allowed us to walk Old San Juan, it gave us a very clean spacious room (with exceptional bedding), a roof-top pool, a very pleasant reasonable casual restaurant on the 2nd Floor -- with a terrace that overlooks the port. We would definitely go back ther again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Shir Hayam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night pre-cruise in December. Since we are Starwood gold, we tend to get upgraded rooms and this was no exception. We had a lovely view of the harbor, a comfy bed, and no noise or musty smell problems others have reported. The location was great for exploring Old San Juan. One of the concierges pointed us to a great, authentic Puerto Rican restaurant nearby (Mojitos). However, when we asked for breakfast advice the next day from another concierge, we were told of a great restaurant, but given the wrong address. Disappointing, but not a disaster. All in all, it was a lovely stay if you want to be in the heart of Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Do Your Research First!”
Reviews.Author: countryroader
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Old San Juan was recommended by both our cruise line and our travel agent as a great place to stay for the night before our cruise. With harbor views, location right next to the cruise terminal, and a block from the free tourist trolley in Old Jan Juan, it sounded perfect. But our cruise ship docked at the other side of the bay, so that wasn't convenient. Our room was small, cramped, with no view, and located right next to the pool so there was foot traffic back and forth. When we complained, we were told because our room was prepaid we could not move. Otherwise, not a bad hotel. Suggest: Before you make a reservation, find out exactly which room will be yours, and if leaving or arriving on a cruise find out where your ship will be docked. Otherwise, I recommend staying at a place near a beach and take a taxi everywhere, including into old San Juan and pick up the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - overpriced, has some nice features”
Reviews.Author: Rasalus
Reviews.Content: We reserved the OSJ Sheraton for 2 days before our Carnival Victory Southern Caribbean cruise at the end of Nov 2010. We reserved the room through Hotwire for about $125 a night. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is only a couple of blocks from the pier that our shipped docked at, so we were able to walk our backs from the hotel directly to the ship at boarding time (saving an extra taxi fee). Pros: Great beds â€“ very comfortable and large. Good air conditioning in our room. Very close to the free trolley pickup (which can take you around Old San Juan). Close to some of the better restaurants. Close to Senor Frogâ€™s and a CVS drugstore. Has hard-wired internet service. Hertz rental car facility in main lobby. Cons: A little noisy at night (depending on your room location). No continental breakfast. Casino is pretty small but takes up a good bit of the lobby floor space. Brumbaugh Street (in front of hotel) is completely congested with traffic at rush hour and cruise docking times. It can take 20 minutes for a car to travel 200 ft. at these times (including the free trolley). Not much parking space. If you have a car, I recommend using the parking garage across the street â€“ much cheaper than the valet service. When we arrived, the reception desk was very friendly & helpful. We arrived at a slow time, but I assume that if you were to check-in at the busy time (when the ship is boarding/docking), the friendliness would be replaced with more of a hurry-up attitude. They were very busy on Sunday morning between 10:30 â€“ 1:00. We had called the hotel in advance and asked them if we could check-in early (normal check-in is 3:00). They noted this and allowed us to check-in around 12:30 when we arrived. The entrance to the hotel is on the side of the building. Check-out is 11:00, but the official boarding time for the ship was ~ 2:30. The bellhops will watch your luggage from 11:00 to whenever you want to board (suggested tip 5-7$) which gives you some extra time to see Old San Juan before you have to board. Hotel has a nice sized exercise room and pool on the top floor. You can see a lot of the harbor and city from the top floor lookout. Although the hotel was nice, it was barely worth the above mentioned Hotwire price ($125 and no continental breakfast???). I certainly would not pay the $200 normal price. If you are taking the Carnival Victory on a southern Caribbean Cruise, this hotel is a good location for you. See attached pictures for more.

Reviews.Title: “Governor's suite, Big room, nice view, could use updating”
Reviews.Author: TheVitMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the Governor's suites prior to embarking on a cruise. I booked the G-suite after I figured out it would accommodate our group of 3 adults and 2 kids and be cheaper than 2 rooms. The suite was very large including a king sized bedroom and a massive entry/dining/living room area with great views of the city and port. We had a roll-away bed brought up and between that, the king bed, and the sofa pullout had room for all. The location was great for our needs. We were able to hike around OSJ and then when it was time to get on the boat we literally walked across the street. I have 2 issues with the place. First is that standards of cleanliness are not on par with other Sheraton's. Not flithy, but just not completely clean. Second, is that the decor and furnishings were in my opinion not up to "Governor" standards. The furniture was a bit worn and some of it really did not match with the decor, minor point no doubt. If you are booking the suite for the lap of luxury look elsewhere, if you want a big place to spread out this is it.

Reviews.Title: “We had a suite and size was good but basic amenities, great location.”
Reviews.Author: sadiedog
Reviews.Content: Old San Juan. Good thing it is Christmas, no cruise ships and still very busy. 3 people in our 'suite' and sleeping arrangments are comfortable but one bathrobe, iron but no ironing board, coffee machine make one indiv cup of coffee every 30 min or so. Needs general updating. Worn from general over use, very busy hotel. We are here over Christmas and rates are jacked up to $360 a night. Traveling with adult child so needed suite. Couch bed was comfortable. Our room was on 6th floor and have view of fort and parking lot from small balcony Little Casino is small but seems to be an attraction for many, not us. Nice bar on 2nd floor which isn't used much. Great view and breeze but slow service. Sent from my iPhone

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you can get a cheap rate, but if not, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: RunningOnAndOn
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Old San Juan is located across from the pier where the cruise ships dock and is, of course, in Old San Juan. The bottom floor of the hotel is taken up almost entirely by a casino. If you gamble, that's great; if you don't, it's a nuisance. Rooms are ok, nothing to write home about. The fitness room/gym is a joke. Old out-dated machines, rusty, and they make noise. Totally unacceptable for a Sheraton. I run every day outside but on one really rainy day I was forced to run inside on one of the 2 (yes, 2) old treadmills and it was definitely not up to par. I am often in San Juan on business and so I tried this hotel since the rate was so cheap, but I wouldn't stay here again unless I could get the same really low rate--and even then I would think about it as there are many good hotels in the San Juan area. By the way, if you bring a car, parking is over $21 per day, so factor that in as well. All in all, it really was not up to Sheraton standards, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: jsxtasy
Reviews.Content: great start point if your staying in the old city very nice hotel very freindly staff beutifully decorated for the holidays

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: VancouverJohnnie
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the mixed reviews we were not sure if we wanted to stay here prior to boarding our cruise at the Pan Am pier which we knew was not right at the hotel. ( there are no hotels any closer to this pier) We found the room clean and comfortable and the kids liked the roof top pool. The staff were friendly and when we noticed an error on our bill they quickly rectified the problem. I would not say it is a $200 a night hotel, but rather than using priceline or expedia (which quoted the $200 price) we called the hotel directly and they gave us a great rate using their "pay your birthdate rate plan" which worked out to a reasonable $135 a night. The free trolley to the fort is close, but we walked almost every where within the town without too much effort. Yes there are resort taxes that are not the hotels fault and apply to every hotel in the area (go some place like Kansas in the winter if you don't want to pay resort tax).

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at this hotel was AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: Ampadilla67
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the staff for making our stay a memorable experience, we are definitely coming back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DrinkMoreWine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights before departing on a cruise. We liked the location because of its proximity to Old San Jaun. We stayed in a Junior Suite w/ a partial view of the bay. The room was huge, it included a sitting area separated from the bedroom by a small office work area. The decor was not real trendy but the furniture was good condition and comfortable. The bathroom wasn't surper fancy but it was clean and everything worked. The king size bed had a good matress and was comfortable. We ate in both restaurants. If you have a hankering for a burger you won't be disappointed. The breakfast buffet was good and had a nice selection but can get crowded as it isn't very big. If you want downtown activities this is the hotel to stay at, if you want the beach stay somewhere else. Also as the hotel is in the city you will hear city noises, however, I sleep pretty lightly and they didn't wake me or keep me awake.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all”
Reviews.Author: dweaver86
Reviews.Content: I dont usually bother to write reviews, but this hotel does not deserve the rating it has so I have to warn others. If you expect a peaceful nights sleep steer clear. This hotel is loud. They gave us a room on the 3rd floor, we had just traveled over 12 hours and were completely tired. So we settled into bed about 9pm. All the sudden - music like it was being piped directly into the room. I called and complained and it seems their meeting rooms used for wedding receptions and parties until 1am is on floor two. So they moved us up to the 6th floor. That was fine until 1 am when slight sounds in the hallway carried into our room. What was worse was the parties letting out. It was so noisy. The rooms were OK, but given the price we paid to stay at the hotel, I feel it was a scam. Totally not worth it. Stay somewhere else. Also contrary to the advertisement on the hotel web site, it is about a 10 minute taxi ride to the cruise ship terminal.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Hotel in a Romantic if Underdeveloped Area”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDude69
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Old San Juan Sheraton in November on a 4-day vacation trip. I had a King-sized bed on the Starwood Preferred Guest floor with a living room attached to it. The best thing about the room was the modern comfy bed with nice white sheets, white blanket, and white comforter and plenty of pillows. There was also a widescreen TV (it was probably about a 32 or 40 inch). The decor of the room and hallways outside looked worn and outdated, as was the furniture in the living room attached to my room. The room had a strange musty smell that I couldn't tell if it was from cleaning solution. I almost called the front desk to complain but I got used to it, and it seemed to fade. The bathroom was huge with two sinks. All-in-all, it was pretty average but comfortable. The casino inside the hotel is on the ground level and is small and generic looking. I didn't give it a try. There is a restaurant called Chicago Burger attached to the hotel that is surprisingly good, as it doesn't look like much at first glance. I recommend getting the Jabirto burger that is made Puerto Rican style (with salsa, puerto rican cheese, and plantains...so good if a bit messy to eat). The fried pickle chips are really good as long as you don't try to eat too many. There is a pool on the roof with a heated whirlpool next to it. It's a small area but OK if you just want hang out. You can see the ocean from this area, but you have to stand up (it's a not a forever pool). There is also a small gym room near the pool that I used. There is barely enough equipment to do a full set of weight training exercises, but there are a couple pieces of cardio equipment like a bike and a treadmill. I did some weight training but chose to do some jogging outside the hotel. There is a CVS just down the street with reasonable prices on everything (a large bottle of water was around $1.50). The best thing about the location is of course Old San Juan. It's basically on a peninsula that you can walk from seaside to seaside in about 20 minutes. You literally can't get lost in Old San Juan, as it's not that big. I recommend walking to the old Fort Morro and also checking out the walls around Old San Juan that used to protect it from invasion in yesteryears. Walking around the town is fun for about two days, although there are a few too many tourist traps selling Puerto Rico coffee mugs and the like. There are no beaches within walking distance, but you can take taxis or a bus to nearby ones. I didn't have an ocean view, but I went to the pool on the roof to check it out, and it isn't really an impressive view for an "ocean view" as you can see the other part of the island on the horizon. There is construction going on all around the hotel (they're building more hotels and docks for more cruise ships). The mammoth cruise ships are neat to see in dock, but things get very busy in the lobby of the hotel when the ships are in and the cruise patrons are out. My check-in was a snap because there were no ships at the time. Old San Juan is not a fully developed resort town, as there weren't a lot of upscale restaurants or places to go. It has an old romantic feel, with its narrow streets and closed-in buildings very much like a Spanish town with pastel buildings everywhere. The sidewalks are so narrow there is only room for one person to walk on them. There are many abandoned buildings and lots of construction. I was disappointed by the restaurants in Old San Juan (I tried about 5 of the highly recommended ones), and I recommend eating outside of the area. There is a place behind the hotel called Latin Roots that has some sexy salsa dancing on the weekends with really good local bands. Really enjoyed it and can recommend it if you know how to sasla. Some good looking girls were there when I went. In terms of beaches, a local recommended Isle Verde for going to a beach because the water is calmer on that part of the island and better for swimming and wading. Everyone around the hotel and Old San Juan spoke decent English (I can't speak a word of Spanish and made out just fine). Overall, I felt the Sheraton Old San Juan Hotel was just an average hotel experience, with my only complaint being a musty smell and a noisy air conditioner. Staff was nice to me. Rating it 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Musty room and confused concierge”
Reviews.Author: Daverblond
Reviews.Content: We had arranged for a "city view" room but since we had never visited the hotel, we didn't realize that it actually doesn't have a city view at all. It faces either south to the cruise ship docks or north to a multi-level parking garage as tall as the hotel. Our room faced north. We had a lovely view of the garage. Since we were there to see the town, we had no intention of spending the day gazing out the window, however, they should change the marketing of this room to reflect reality. To make matters worse, there is a restaurant that gets very noisy at night in the lower level of the parking garage. We had to crank the a/c to drown out the noise. The room also smelled like someone's damp basement. The maid Fabreezed the room every day, but that lasted for about a 1/2 hour before the musty smell returned. There was no bar fridge, either. On the positive side, the room was large and the beds comfortable. The concierges were the oddest collection of people. None of them could answer a question correctly. By the end of my trip, I knew more about San Juan than they did. Thanksgiving Day fell during my trip. I asked if any attractions or shops would be open. The concierge stated quite confidently that the forts were open and most of the stores would be as well until noon. The forts were both closed and the stores were locked shut. On another occasion, I wanted to buy some stamps for postcards. The concierge told me to go the nearest CVS pharmacy. When I arrived, the staff looked at me like I was from Mars: they were a pharmacy, they didn't sell stamps. I would have to go to the post office. Guess where the post office was: about 50 feet from the hotel. By the time I got there, it was closed. You would think that the staff of the hotel would know that there was a post office a stone's throw from their place of employment. No.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: bobbypink05
Reviews.Content: Visited Puerto Rico for the first time ever with my boyfriend. I would have to say that this hotel was perfect. The location is great; walking distance to tons of restaurants, bars, shops and tourist spots. We tried the trolley on our first day and got a great overview of the town. The hotel was great; no drama at check in or out, rooms were spotless, casino was decent size, elevators were not bad, bellman was nice. It's a great place to stay if you are on a budget and want options. We took taxi to condado beach ($14) each way and to isle verde beach ($20) each way. I would definitely recommend isle verde beach; beautiful, more space and very clean. Overall we enjoyed our stay and will for sure visit puerto Rico again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Orlando_Fam
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the resort late in the evening. Bell Service was good, check-in was speedy and room was a bit on the smaller side but nicely decorated and most importantly clean. The hotel appears to have gone through a rehab recently. Workout room is average size and rooftop pool has great vistas and is average size. We had a room that overlooked the water. The only complaint was a little bit of noise coming from the rooftop air conditioner from the next building.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveling1mi
Reviews.Content: I purchased the room via priceline at a bid of $100.00 per night. Stayed 2 nights. Hotel is located right at the port for Carnival Cruise Line which was great as I stayed 2 nights prior to sailing. You can actually walk to the pier if you do not have much luggage and can walk a distance. However I took a taxi. $10.00. Service is great especially the doormen. There is a trolly stop 1 1/2 blks from hotel which is free. There are 2-trolley routes (2-buses), 1 trolley is enclosed which will take you to all the shopping in Old San Juan. You can hop off/on throughout the route. The bus run frequently!! The other trolley route, an open air trolley will take you to all the historical sites, i.e. the fort, museums, etc. Both of the trolley begin and end at the same location wihich is 1 1/2 blks in either direction of the Sheraton. There is a great restaurant behind the hotel called Latin Roots with great food. You must try the Roasted Pork which you will see a whole pig roasting in the window. You can get a combo which is 1/2 lb. pork and 2-sides for $12.00, or 1/2 lb meat only for $8.00. Inside the hotel is Chicago Beef Co. with good burgers if you must eat at hotel. The swimming pool at the hotel is on the roof with and excellant view of the Bay and the ships. Its great for enjoying the sun and relaxing and a nice pool and whirllpool. Very nice and quaint. Finally, the room was nice size and the beds at the Sheraton are really comfy. There is a casino at the hotel also if you are a gambler and they serve free drinks while gambling. I would highly recommend staying here if you want to be in Old San Juan. Great location, and great accommodations!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: pjcasey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. I upgraded to a suite for business reasons. The clerks at the front desk were difficult and did not want to accommodate the request even though they had the space and I wasn't asking for a free upgrade (and note to clerks - you should be careful about assuming that your guests can't understand Spanish...). The hotel was very noisy. Part of that is street noise which can't be helped. Part of it was guests who decided on one night to have an extended conversation outside my door. During the day the cleaning personnel were very noisy, talking and banging doors. Not a good place to get rest. A bright note: a clerk named George was exceedingly kind in giving advice about restaurants and drawing directions for us. The location is excellent for visiting the Old San Juan area. It becomes very crowded when the cruise ships are in port. The hotel food? Save yourself some grief and eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Old San Juan in September 2010”
Reviews.Author: Sgt_Gbabs
Reviews.Content: We were on holidays and wanted to stay close to resto and bars. The hotel is very well situated to everything. The check-in was really good, and when we had an issue with our room, they found another room right away. Be careful when asking about tours, they tend to want to "Sell" tours. The bus terminal is just 3 minute walk, and the ferry to the Bacardi factory is across the street. We stayed for 5 nights and would go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Worth for the location, nothing else”
Reviews.Author: Mmparise
Reviews.Content: Terrible check in experience. Crowded and slow. Check out even worse frobt desk asked to leave the spg line and go to the end of regular line. Room was clean but had no personality, it could be a holiday inn express. Would probably avoid going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JD1946
Reviews.Content: Right across from the cruise port and in the center of Old San Juan - I would definitely stay here again after our 2 night stay.... There were some deficiencies though - no luggage assistance upon our taxi arrival - and no offers for a luggage assist up to our room (we had 3 heavy bags). We got a suite facing the port and it was quite nice..........though the room next door was getting upgraded and caused some noise problems. We did not try out the hotel restaurant simply because all the major restaurants were literally within 2 blocks from us! Free internet of course and the property is within walking distance of everything in town.

Reviews.Title: “Just one night but it was perfect”
Reviews.Author: tourtheworld
Reviews.Content: Rather than have an over night layover back in the states, we opted to fly from St. Maarten to Puerto Rico for an evening (1 hour flight). Our arrival time afforded us time to do a little sight-seeing, grab some dinner and enjoy the hotel's amenities. Check in was easy and the service was terrific. Both our rooms were clean, stocked with nice toiletries and the bed was extremely comfortable. There was a large casino on the bottom floor but it could not be heard and we were on the third floor. The hotel's location allowed us to comfortably walk around Old San Juan, shop, eat and enjoy a bit of nightlife. When done touring the city we enjoyed the hotel's roof top pool. Later that evening we even enjoyed some room service. All in all it was a wonderful way to end our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Kaylasaunt
Reviews.Content: We originally tried to book to say in the other Sheraton in Puerto Rico, the one near the convention center but told it was overbooked and that the one in Old San Juan was the "sister" hotel and was comparable. Upon arrival to San Juan it was raining, the door man saw us arrive did nothing to offer us in the way of helping us with our luggage or offer an umbrella. Check in went smoothly, attendant was friendly. No assistance to bring luggage to our room. Elevators and hotel already looked outdated, but still trying to be positive and make the most of our stay. Elevator door opens and ugly, dingy turquoise rugs greet us. The hallways smell. Room had minimal outside light, no closet only a wobbly armoire to hold our clothes??? We left our luggage and went to lunch thinking we would calm ourselves and again try to make the most of our stay. However when we came back to the room we decided to check out, it was just unacceptable and did not want to ruin our stay anymore. We called again, and due to the fact that it was raining, the other Sheraton had cancellations and were able to give us a room. We checked out and informed the front desk why we were unhappy, how we were misled into believing that both Sheratons were comparable and also there really was not that much of a price difference between the two. We knew when we booked that since we prepaid, it was a no refund policy. However, we literally stayed in the hotel for about 2 hours and were going to spend our money within the same company. Sheraton did nothing in the way of offer us any form of compensation, refund or apply any of what we paid to our new room. The only positive for this hotel is the location which is right by the port. Also please tell your staff of young adults hanging out in the desk with the computers in the reception lobby to not assume people do not speak nor understand spanish. Very unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Loopska
Reviews.Content: Great location in Old San Juan. Very close to cruise ship docks and historic sights. It was very hectic at check-in time since many cruise ship passengers were either checking in or checking out. This made for a long lineup at reception and a long wait for the rooms to be ready. However, the rooms were clean and spacious and the food at the hotel restaurant was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darthy12
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night right before our cruise, we thought the hotel was wonderful. We loved our room, it was hugh! The comforter on the wonderfully lush bed was perfect. Our trip also included the breakfast buffet, which was also delicious. It was a great start to a wonderful vacation. The staff was very friendly and helpful, check in was easy and check out was just as easy. Only criticism, the lobby did not have enough seating, because when the cruise ship did come to port there was not enough seats for new arrivals to seat. I would say the problem is that the cruise ship let's off so early and people are anxious to get to their rooms. I say, check your luggage with the bell hop, which we did, prepack your bathing suits in a carry on bag and swim in the beautiful roof top pool, or soak whatever troubles you have away in the jacuzzi, and leave your troubles behind!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ATLGAPeach
Reviews.Content: Perfect Location in Old San Juan! Clean rooms, nice linens. Asked for a harbor view when I arrived but they did not have any rooms available facing the harbour. However, I was upgraded to a suite instead! Great and helpful staff. Hotel can be a bit crazy during cruise ship departure days which was Sunday when I was there, but wasn;t a big issue. I don't know what all the other complaints are for.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient...very convenient.”
Reviews.Author: allstuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights before going on a southern Caribbean cruise. Crusie shipped docked just across the street. Hotel is about 18 years old and needs some do-over, but is in pretty good shape. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. There is a casino in the hotel if you gamble. Hotel just at the edge of Old San Juan. Close to Al Dente, one of the best Italian restaurants we've dined at. Also close to La Bombalier, which has a great breakfast. One block from CVS drugstore, which has everything. No shortage of taxis out front. We were upgraded to a mini suite because of our Starwood status. Beds were comfortable and there were 2 flat screen TV's, but no HD. We would stay here again if we ever go on another cruise out of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - BEWARE!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JmaxBod
Reviews.Content: As an SPG member I was directed towards this hotel for my last night in San Juan before departing back home. I had booked a suite as quoted with a "beautiful city view of historic old san juan." I was expecting a lovely view with a nice view of the city and port. I was looking forwarding to relaxing in this city in my nice suite. Instead I was given a "suite" that just felt like a dark gloomy basement. The "historic city view" was a giant parking structure 5 ft outside the window. It was by far the most misleading room description I have been given in my 100+ hotel stays this year. I gave the hotel the opportunity to rectify the matter but nothing was done. They had no rooms to move me to and could only offer a small credit towards the $319 I was originally quoted. Keep in mind they ALSO charge a $25 service fee and TAXES on top of that. The hotel is a joke with no real management. I will be filing a formal complaint with SPG corporate. Unless you are boarding a cruise ship, DO NOT STAY HERE!! Your vacation will be ruined. What pissed me off the most was the front desk who was quite aware how misleading the description was. The bellman told me they get such complaints daily. DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Its a dump!!! No better than a motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Starwoods Hotel I've Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: amandas711
Reviews.Content: I hate writing negative reviews, but there is little to compliment about this hotel. The lobby constantly smells of grease and fried food (not sure why). One of the two treadmills was broken and when we reported it to the front desk, they shrugged. One morning we were awoken by the maid service before 8 a.m.; the next day they never came. We had to call the front desk three times that evening before someone came to drop off clean sheets and towels (though they did not offer to make up the beds or clean up). Other anomalies about this hotel include barking dogs in the hallways in the early morning(?); lots of small unsupervised children screaming in the gym and the pool. Because I have the Starwoods Credit Card, I typically stay at Starwoods properties (LeMeridien, Sheraton, W, etc.) This one felt more akin to a motel than a multi-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ob1dob
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife the night before a cruise departing from San Juan. It was a good, clean hotel. Staff were not overly friendly but they got the job done. The best thing about this hotel is the location - smackl in the middle of old San Juan. If you stay here and are looking for a great place for dinner, I highly recommend taking a short walk to the DragonFly restaurant 1 street over - Asian/Latin fusion - try the duck nachos!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a unique location!”
Reviews.Author: green-emeralds
Reviews.Content: The sheraton in old san juan is a gem... the service was great. The rooms were so very clean. The bed felt as if I was sleeping on a cloud, very clean. The sheets and blankets smelled so good and were like new! The check in was outstanding. We were there like 4 hrs. too early and the nice agent, named George, a very professional and friendly gentleman assigned us a room right away! The location of this hotel is terriffic. Located right in front of the bay where cruise ships dock. Near everything including El Morro Fortress (walking distance.) Plenty of restaurants to eat the best food you can possibly imagine. Do not forget to go to "La Bombonera" This is a 100 years plus restaurant/fonda, they make the best coffee with mallorca bread! They also make very good pastries, and food,too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: shaybabby
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to stroll around and explore old San Juan. There were great restaurants everywhere, cute shops. cool history and right next to the cruise ship ports. The room was night, bed was great, shower huge, a/c was heaven, and the restaurant upstairs served a decent breakfast buffet. The casino was nice too with NO smoking allowed! I also thought the staff was very friendly and nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms,”
Reviews.Author: SaraC72
Reviews.Content: The beds were large and comfortable. They put us on the top floor, which was great. Our view, however, was of the parking garage next door. The rooftop pool and hot tub were nice, but too small for a hotel this size. You think you're going to go relax by the pool? Forget it; there are already 40 people out there. The fitness center is great, with a lot of machines and treadmills that have fantastic views of the bay. The internet did not work at all the first two days we were there, which was a huge inconvenience. The concierge were very unhelpful and had not heard of several of the very nearby places we were trying to find. There was bottled water in the room that we assumed was free because there was no sign to indicate otherwise; later we were charged $4 per bottle! Avoid touristy restaurants right near the hotel, such as Raices. The food is mediocre and overpriced. Instead, try San Germain, which is fantastic! Go buy a gallon of water at the CVS next door. Do not rent a car, so you can avoid the $20 per day parking fee. Take the bus to Condado for only 75 cents instead of a $15 taxi. I prepaid with Priceline and still ended up with a hefty bill at check out. There are charges galore, including hidden ones. Also, I seriously doubt the legitimacy of their casino. The house won far more often than is statistically probable. Avoid the casino at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: RMGodwin
Reviews.Content: Like most reviewers, we were not cruise passengers, but we chose the Sheraton as a base for the first night of our Puerto Rico trip, before heading into the central mountains. The hotel is in a great location for any leisure traveler wanting to explore the Old San Juan area. The ferry and cruise ship piers are directly across the street. Everything in Old San Juan is within walking distance of the Sheraton. The room was a bit small, but it was very clean and comfortable. The roof-top pool is small, but the deck offers great views of the city, bay and mountains beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, not so good concierge service”
Reviews.Author: moorthyr
Reviews.Content: This trip was a combined work/personal trip to PR for 4 days, and I picked the Sheraton Old San Juan after doing a bit of research and deciding that proximity to OSJ would be nice for my wife while I was working. Largely, we were happy with how it turned out. The Sheraton OSJ is a nicely run hotel, if a bit dated (they are in process of renovating). The rooms were nice, beds comfortable, rooftop deck/pool/workout room great, and service mostly good. We were moments from the heart of OSJ, which was great. We walked out into the shopping district, great restaurants and more. There were a few things that were not as great: 1) The concierge - As a Starwood (Sheraton, Westin, W, etc.) hotel loyalist, I have gotten used to great concierge services at their hotels. This one was not so good. The two tours they recommended were classic "tell you what you want to hear" cases. Our tour of El Yunque was a 4 hour shuttle ride with less than 45 minutes of walking around the rainforest, even though the concierge indicated it was a 2 hour hike to a small waterfall. It also ended an hour later than promised. Several others on our tour had been similarly misled. Similarly, our bio-luminescent bay tour near Fajardo had incorrect times (told 4:30 leave-8:30 return, actually 4pm leave 10:45pm return), inaccurate info (what it would be like, were promised there would be bug spray there and there wasn't). Similarly, restaurant recommendations made no sense. They did not know about popular Trip Advisor restaurants, and recommended several with terrible reviews. Makes you question their motivation for recos. I would NOT TRUST their concierge. Book your tours directly with the tour companies recommended on Trip Advisor: http://www.elyunque.com/about.html - pricey at $300 for 2 people (if you don't have a group) but the reviews are good. http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g612474-d653791-Reviews-Kayaking_Puerto_Rico_Adventures_Inc-Fajardo_Puerto_Rico.html - gets good reviews and you'll save $20 pp booking directly with them... They will pick up in San Juan and bring you back (if you do this, wear swim shorts, bring bug spray, and I'd consider a headlamp :) ) http://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g147320-d584016-Reviews-Legends_of_San_Juan-San_Juan_Puerto_Rico.html - nice tour of San Juan, but a little rough around the edges... My review is posted there. and use Trip Advisor and other reviews for Restaurants (we loved Marmalade, liked Dragonfly and Cafe Puerto Rico, Raices was a bit touristy but decent). 2) Be careful leaving or arriving on Sunday - Sundays they are mobbed with cruise ship people. We knew that going in, so I was careful not to need stand in line to check out (automatic checkout), checked luggage before the cruise ship rush (11am-ish), etc.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Buxton Derbyshire in the High Peak Forest
Reviews.Title: “A ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buxtonworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated by the water edge.It is in the old town so is an excellant spot to wander the streeis of the old town and walls of this amazing city. When the cruise lines pull into port you think they are going to come into the hotel they are so close,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: tbpusa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days and it was the pefect hotel. Centrally located and very nice rooms. The a/c was very cold which may bother some but if you can get a rate on hotwire or pricelien like we did - it's worth it! From this hotel we were able to do many tourist activities on our own and save money as well. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Post Cruise Delight!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SherBare
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what the post cruiser ordered. We decided that after our 1 week adventure in the Caribbean Sea, we would not hop on a plane and go home. I highly recommend spending 1 more night in Old San Juan, Puerto Rico and we did so with this wonderful hotel. Very clean, comfortable and spacious rooms... great view to the ports.... within walking distance to El Morro. We spent the day enjoying all that Old San Juan has to offer. The only thing I would recommend is don't hesitate booking this place... it's always the good ones that go first! Try Priceline... we got a winner here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: traveler557711
Reviews.Content: What a zoo! This hotel is SERIOUSLY understaffed and ill-equipped to deal with the volume of guests and traffic it receives. The lobby is way to small to deal with all the guests and the desk attendants barely speak English. Not exactly what I was expecting from the pictures or a world class hotel like Sheraton. It seems that most of the guests are due to cruise ship business due to the proximity to the port. Though they knew we were booked on Cruise when we checked in no one mentioned or even noticed that we did not have luggage transfers, they could have at least offered the service to us. We realized at checkout that we 'd have to haul our own luggage to the cruise ship terminal. The bellboy had the nerve to tell us that it would not have mattered even if we did pay for the service, because they are independent contractors and Carnival does not reimburse the hotel for the fees for baggage transfers. The A/C unit was leaking a big puddle of water in the entryway of the room and since no one on staff spoke English we could not get any instructions on how to adjust the thermostat in the room. The hotel cleaning staff/maids hung out in the hallways outside of the room socializing, and made A LOT of noise for several hours starting at about 8am On the upside, the room itself was very nice and comfortable., too bad the rest of the hotel was such a zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - perfect for night before/after cruise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaLittleRed
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location if you are doing a Carnival Cruise. This hotel is across the street from the Carnival Pier 2. It's very nice, clean. They stored our luggage since we arrived before check-in & then again after check-out before our flight departed - allowing us to explore Old San Juan. Large rooms, A/C, big flat screen TV. Their rates are expensive so we did Priceline & I was surprised they accepted our offer of $75/night. Taxi to airport was about $23 (4 bags). It's a couple minute walk to a lot of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinWizard
Reviews.Content: stayed here 1 night, post cruise....nice hotel in old town....there's alot to see, do, eat, and drink nearby.....pricelined for $145 w/tax on a friday night.....even got a room on the 9th floor facing the harbor...quite nice of them...would definately stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: tsfl61
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel early in the afternoon, so was not expecting to be able to check-in, I just wanted to store my luggage while I went exploring. To my surpise, my room was ready, even though check-in is not guaranteed until 3pm. A bellman loaded my luggage (quite a bit since I was settling in for a 3 week stay while waiting for my apartment to be ready) and escorted me to my room, informing me of the hotel's amenities and services along the way. I was once again surprised to find that my room had been upgraded to a junior suite, due to the fact that I was staying so long, they wanted to ensure my comfort during the stay! My suite had a huge balcony with furniture, my room was more than I would have ever dreamt or needed. I felt guilty being in such an accommodation for so long without paying more for it. Throughout my stay, housekeeping was excellent. Even if I declined service, I would arrive back to my room to find coffee and towels replenished. Everyone I encountered from front desk agents to housekeeping to engineering to restaurant staff were extremely polite and helpful (I don't speak Spanish).
