The fitness room offers everything I could want, the pool is beautiful and well cared for, the food and service in Palio restaurant is excellent. I even had the opportunity to speak with some of the senior managers at the hotel who mingle with guests in the lobby each afternoon. I would highly recommend this hotel for all of the above reasons to anyone looking for a place to stay in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms are clean”
Reviews.Author: lisag67
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was fine. Not much ambiance but I wasn't expecting that. It is in a big tourist area and most of the hotel guests seem to be people arriving or departing from the cruise ships. Some reviews complained about the front desk service but I thought they were fine. When we checked in I requested a quiet room on a high floor and they gave me a room on the 9th (top) floor, same level as the fitness center and pool. No view to speak of but they had warned me about that and I didn't care. Beds were OK, not great but fine for two nights. The rooftop pool has a nice view; hot tub on the roof was lukewarm and they were not able to fix the issue during our stay. Still usable though. Clean room and an excellent location for visiting old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid on Sundays - terrrible experience”
Reviews.Author: pete_williams05
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel for one night (Sunday) after disembarking from the Carnival Victory and the experience was terrible. The lobby is a madhouse and there are no staff telling you which of the lines to stand in or managing the crowds at all. The staff are overwhelmed as there are too few of them to deal with the crowds. We could not access our room until 5pm and once in there it stunk of must and you cannot open the windows. I've had better experiences in $15 hotels in Thailand!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in OSJ...not much else”
Reviews.Author: pjfarr1
Reviews.Content: Having visited San Juan prior to many cruises, we were very excited to get a room at the Sheraton for a night prior to our cruise. We have always thought it would be a great place to stay given its location. We found it to be a fine hotel...pretty dated, small pool, old elevators which sometimes worked, but it was within walking distance to all the sights and sounds in Old San Juan. The room was basic and bed uncomfortable, but everything was clean. There were tons of restaurants right nearby. Highly recommend La Lechonera, which just opened behind the hotel. Would recommend if you want to be in OSJ without paying El Convento rates. Otherwise stay in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Awful!!! Stay elsewhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: montesaNewYork
Reviews.Content: The only thing good about this Hotel is location. Check-in people at the front desk are RUDE!! Pool area was dirty and the hot tub was disgusting. They also charge you an additional 23.00 per day for parking and they also charge 20.00 hotel fees plus the 20.00 taxes. For a little over 200.00 a night you can stay in much better hotel. Casino is really small. This Hotel has no beach.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Chaotic”
Reviews.Author: jrobba
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Old San Juan is in a great location for touring Old San Juan, but it comes with other issues. We stayed here for 2 nights because we were taking a cruise out of Puerto Rico, on celebrity cruise line. I thought the hotel would be ideal for us, being that it was in walking distance from the port. Well apparently it was the wrong port. While there are cruise ports near the hotel, the one we left out of was on the other side of the harbor. This was a total bummer. There was no transportation from the hotel to the port, which really was a deal breaker for me to stay here again. I thought the hotel was nice. Like I said it was in a good location to tour old San Juan. It has a very nice rooftop pool, and you can over look the city at night which is great. The rooms were average at best. Nothing fancy, nothing impressive. Parking near the hotel is a nightmare. There are some paid decks nearby, but you seriously feel like you're in Gotham city trying to park in some of these decks. I think our stay would have been significantly better had we had a less complicated way to get to the ship port. I ended up renting a car at the airport and using that to get around for the 1st day. The hotel actually has a hertz rental facility there at the hotel. So what I ended up having to do to get to the ship was drive to the ship, drop off all our luggage, and then go back to the hotel, drop off the car at the hertz facility there (which has terrible service that takes forever), and then literally walk the 4 miles back to the ship. So if you're crusing Royal Carribean or Celebrity, make sure to have an arrangement to get to the ship. It's too much to walk. And if you walk into San Juan, make sure to get a churro from the street vendor. Best in the entire world, I kid you not!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but just average services/ cleaniness”
Reviews.Author: TheTruth1
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in mid March 2010 as part of a conference here in San Juan. First off, this location is FANTASTIC. It is right in front of the cruise ship dock, it faces the ocean and is very close to all the tourist attractions of Old San Juan. Almost all of the attractions of Old San Juan are within walk distance of the hotel. However, the inside needs a little work... Service was mediocre at best. We called to ask for a hairdryer to be delievered to our room as there was none inside. They agreed to deliver it but it never came. Then the next day, we called ahead to get our car ready from the valet parking ( @ $21 per day) but when we arrived the car wasn't there. So, we waited for 5 minutes for the car to come around when it should have been there. Cleanliness was average. We ate lunch at the restaurant called "Palio". The server gave us a high-chair for my 2 year old son. I saw what appeared to be circular liquid stains on the chair. So, I wiped it using a wet napkin and it turned black. It was quite disgusting. And, in our room the carpet was stained with all kinds of colours. The washroom's tile grouts were very discoloured. We also experienced the same issue as the previous member regarding the pool. It was raining in the morning but stopped in the afternoon. It was also closed the entire day due to the weather. So, overall the hotel has an excellent location but a little let down by the average services/ cleaniness.

Reviews.Title: “hotel annoyingly closes pool for light showers earlier in day and refuses to open it”
Reviews.Author: Samantha1947
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location in old san juan and the outdoor pool on the roof. We arrived at 9:00 am on Sunday planning on leaving the next day at 9:00 am, and were told the room would not be ready until 3:00 pm. That was a bit annoying but we said ok and walked around the city until 3:00 pm. when we checked into our room and headed upstairs to the pool. We found the pool locked with a sign saying it was closed due to weather conditions.The sky was cloudy and it had rained off and on very lightly earlier in the day. There was no thunder or lightening at any time. Ida, the front office agent I complained to , said the hotel had a security policy whereby they kept the pool closed for any rain or even significant cloudiness. She spoke with her supervisor who refused to order the pool opened. I believe this policy of closing the pool for the lightest of showers or mere cloudy weather is unfair and is a deceptive practice. The hotel advertises having a pool for its guests without disclosing the patently unreasonable pool closing rules to which it adheres. I would not come to this hotel again because of this. Our room was clean but smelled strongly and unpleasantly of cleaning product. The window was fixed glass which could not be opened. The pool area was the only place in the hotel where a guest could sit and relax in fresh air. It was particularly annoying because the policy seemed so unreasonable and unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: ILoveIsrl
Reviews.Content: Hey, I just arrived to this hotel and the room is beautiful...new furniture and comfy bed and large flat screen hotel. However beware, the hotel restaurant prices are outrageously expensive. So I want to order delivery from local restaurant which is half the price but there is no fridge or microwave in the room. I asked for a fridge and the charge is $25 per night....holy cow! And the microwave is another $10 per day....double holy cow? I usually stay at Holiday Inn Expresses where Fridge and Microwave are part of the service included in the room. Granted, HI rooms are not as luxourious as this Sheraton but I'd rather have a fridge and microwave in the room. It's like you have no choice but to use the restaurant here in the hotel which is ridiculously expensive. Via La Holiday Inn Express.....$35 for a Fridge and microwave per night? Outrageous. I won't stay at a Sheraton ever again....it's down right greed and therefore despite comfortable rooms, I give it an "F" for greed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Seniors and Exploring Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: LHHTR31
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan from 2/18 - 2/21. Overall this is a nice hotel. Me and a buddy went down to PR for some R&R and found a pretty good deal on this hotel. The service is very friendly and the hotel and rooms are clean. Pros Almost everyone speaks English Staff is very accomodating and helpful Rooms are clean Pool area is on top floor and is small but very nice Perfectly situated to explore Old San Juan The on-site Chicago Burger Company is okay and reasonably priced. 3 computer stations with free internet access in the lobby Located very close to El Morro Fort for exploring. Cons If you are young and looking for a bit more excitement, I would suggest a resort in Isla Verde or Condado - This hotel is overrun with seniors that are cruising. I sat next to a 70 year old lady in the lobby that was knitting! There is NO WHERE to eat after midnight near this hotel Casino is a joke. Go to El San Juan Hotel in Isla Verde to gamble All in all, a nice hotel situated right in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: MassIS300
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise. We paid $200 for two nights on Priceline, and upgraded to a suite for an extra $50 per night when we got there. Glad we did. The suite was enormous with a balcony view of the waterfront. I peeked at some of the regular rooms which appeared small, so my room rating is based upon the suite only. There is a great burger joint (Chicago Burger?) at the base of the hotel. We also had breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant. It was pricey at $18 pp, but was good food. The pool has a pretty neat view on the top floor of the hotel, but it is small. Service was not the best - they failed to restock the in room coffee after the first night, and we didn't have any clean towels for the second day. I would recommend this hotel still for those that are staying here for a short duration, since it is central to Old San Juan, it was walking distance from the cruise ship pier, and the majority of our time was spent exploring the area and forts on foot. This is NOT a vacation destination by itself.

Reviews.Title: “Grungy”
Reviews.Author: TravelWells
Reviews.Content: Clients of mine just returned from taking a 7-night Princess cruise out of San Juan. They stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan the night prior to the cruise. They called me on their return to say they would not recommend this hotel as their room's bathroom was dirty and the carpet soiled. They recommended the newer Sheraton instead, based on their experience and after seeing both properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: tclarkjr
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline and worth the 75 dollars we bid but not the listed price. The pool was disappointing due to its size, very small. Located right in the middle of the action could ask for a better location to explore Old San Juan. The service was great, they allowed us to check in early and the staff was very friendly and helpful. parking is expensive compared to the Don Fela parking Garage right behind it. Definitely suggest it but only at a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Base for Seeing Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: C1andG2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a Friday night before boarding our Royal Caribbean cruise ship. I chose this hotel thinking that our cruise ship would be docked at one of the piers just across the street, but the ship came in to the Pan American pier, which is about a 10 minute taxi drive away at the other end of the harbor. We enjoyed the hotel, however, because it was so convenient for strolling around Old San Juan. Almost everything is within walking distance, and there also are trollies available if you don't want to walk so much. There are many nice restaurants close by. I had asked for two connecting rooms, and when they could not accomodate us, they said that they were upgrading us. Also, I have a Starwood Hotels preferred member card, so we ended up with two spacious rooms (#832 and 833) on the 8th floor in the front, with beautiful views of the harbor. They also gave us a late checkout (2:00 p.m.) on one of the rooms, which made it convenient for our departure to board the cruise ship. I over heard other people in the elevator complaining because they were denied a late checkout request. My only negative comment regards the pool, which is located on the roof. It is small, and the seating area around it is limited. The cement walls surrounding the pool area are high enough that it is hard to enjoy the view while sitting down. If having a nice area for swimming is important to you, then I would suggest staying at another hotel on the beach. But if you want a convenient location for enjoying the sights of Old San Juan, then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden costs”
Reviews.Author: nkramer50
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 day pre cruise and 2 after,great location for walking around,our room was freezing cold with a nice view of the parking garage since we got our room on Priceline.We booked an excursion with the concierge since it is suppose to be FREE, we thought we were paying for the transportation a $55.00 charge on our credit card and would pay for the excursion when we got there. When the taxi driver came to pick us up afterwards he wanted $50.00, we told him we paid the concierge, he said no that wasn't how he got paid. We had to pay him $50.00. And we paid the concierge 55.00 for ? Oh yeah for their FREE service.We complained but they said it was all explained to us. NOT

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but not worth the value.”
Reviews.Author: Dimka7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 2 nights. Location is simply perfect: in the centrum of Old San Juan. Hotel itself is very unkempt especially since the room cost is not cheap. They even had stains on the carpet and torn bed-sheets (see pics).

Reviews.Title: “one nigh”
Reviews.Author: london057
Reviews.Content: no beech an bad sevice and small pool no chram and small rooms and vary average

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the full price”
Reviews.Author: globeseeker007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a day following a seven day caribbean cruise. The hotel is in an excellent location being located in Old San Juan. It also has some fantastic views from the restaurant on the second floor. We left the cruise ship around 10:00 in the morning but had to wait until 3:00pm in the afternoon for our room. However, we were able to stay in a small room on the second floor which had a TV and a table with coffee, juice, and pastries. We were also able to check in our bags with the hotel for storage while we waited. We pricelined for this hotel and got it for $75 plus tax. After we arrived, they added on a resort tax. If you pay full price for this hotel, you're being overcharged as it is not worth it. Even though the room was clean and comfortable, we've stayed a La Quinta hotels in the states which were just as good as this one but also came with a continental breakfast. Breakfast wasn't included with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Old San Juan - not quite as advertised”
Reviews.Author: Kongpup
Reviews.Content: After reading the unflattering reviews of the Sheraton Old San Juan, we were hesitant about booking a 3 night stay to start our Caribbean cruise. But maybe those reviews were posted by people who were just too picky and besides, wouldnâ€™t it be cool to have your ship pull up right across the street waiting to take you away? Just too tempting to pass up. Unfortunately the negative reviews were spot on in this case. Our pricier â€œdeluxe bayviewâ€� room was completely forgettable, similar to any cheap motel along a U.S. interstate except that it had no closet but instead, a 24" wide armoire, insufficient for most couples taking a cruise; our clothes sat wrinkling in their suitcases for the stay. The photos on Sheratonâ€™s website showed our room with a large window, beautiful ship in full view, beckoning to you. Iâ€™m sure that room exists somewhere in the hotel, but it certainly wasnâ€™t ours. Our â€œdeluxe bayviewâ€� window was of the sealed industrial type with about 4 square feet of glass. If you pressed your face against the glass hard enough - is that the tail end of a ship over there? - Yes! The main component of our roomâ€™s view was a giant inflatable frog head perched atop the debris cluttered roof of an unfortunately placed (for us, anyway) Senor Frogs. The poor thing leaked. Each morning, it would be in a green heap, but when we returned in the afternoon, it would be reinflated and proudly ribbiting over San Juan bay. The all night commotions in the hallways (doors slamming, yelling, elevator chimes) were probably due to the proximity of this establishment as well as the hotel casino. This went on during each night of our stay. It also turns out that ships which are homeported in San Juan donâ€™t dock across the street, but instead depart a few miles away. To sum things up; while the Sheratonsâ€™ proximity to the wonderful restaurants and magnificent sights of Old San Juan (all in walking distance) makes up for a lot, Iâ€™m sure that it would be a fine hotel for partyers. For travelers, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Attended meeting next to Hotel at Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: NPEMDAD
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location abutting Convention Center. A one minute walk to get there. Brand new property that just opened in late November 2009. Staff was very helpful and general seemed sincere and helpful. Still needs to work out a few areas post opening, but all in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Musty - Keep Looking”
Reviews.Author: Sail_Dance
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel was the location. The lobby is small and cramped. The room we stayed in smelled musty. The construction was shoddy, trim falling off the ceiling, bad paint job, etc... The staff kept setting the AC at 65 degrees each day to try and dry out the room. If you turn up the thermostat, the problem gets worse... If you like sleeping in a cold damp cave, this is the hotel for you. The window to the room was tiny and did not open.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: BCape
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one night stay at the Sheraton Old San Juan and had a lovely time. I booked the hotel on Priceline for $70 a night and it was an absolute bargain. It started out well when they let me check in early (10AM) due to being sick. The room was nice, but had a view of a parking garage. For the price, it was fantastic and quite frankly as long as I can see the outside world I'm happy. The bed was very comfortable and the room was internet equipped through a cable. Parking was either self-park in a garage a couple of blocks away or valet, which was in the same garage for $20 a day. We did the self-park and it was pretty cheap, about $15 for about 30 hours that the car was there. I also felt safe in the parking garage as a female, but I was only there during the day. The area that the hotel is in is quite nice, right across the street from the cruise ship docks and within walking distance to everything in OSJ. The free OSJ trolley also has a stop very close to the hotel if you don't feel like walking. I would say that the forts were about a 15-20 minutes walk from the hotel. Also make sure you wear good walking shoes and lots of sunscreen to walk around, the heat it brutal! Pool was nice on the roof. Small and a bit chilly, but nice after walking around. Overall I enjoyed my time there and I felt the staff really made an effort to help my husband and I out in letting us check in early and pointing us to places to get cold medicine and what not. I would certainly reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't know about the pets!”
Reviews.Author: sunwolf74
Reviews.Content: Very convient a small walk from the port don't even have to take a taxi! Everything was good, the accomadations and everything, but when it came early morning and you heard "barking" it wasn't pleasent being right next door. We had no idea that pets were allowed and we don't even know if they have designated rooms, just in case somebody is allergic! It would have been nice to be informed when we are paying customers. Either on their website or when you check in just a "f.y.i". When we asked checking out their was a "dog show" in town and they allow pets, no apologies were given. I thought I would mention this for those that are allergic to dog hair, or to make sure your childern's shoes are on their feet so they don't pick up stuff and bring it into the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dblws
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for our pre and post cruise and found it to be the best location. We found everything quite expensive in San Juan, but I think it reflects the supply and demand of the area. Our stay (3 days total) was enjoyable, central and with the exception of one VERY rude desk agent, the staff were extremely helpful. I would stay here again and hope to return some day. Loved San Juan and the people as well.

Reviews.Title: “great location,but avoid room705”
Reviews.Author: jonatar
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a prime lcation and near everything in Old San Juan, some cruise ships berth just across the street. The rooms are comfortable and clean, but avoid room 705 which has a constant drumming noise all night with the occasional rattle of a large fan or something. I believe it had something to do with the pool equipment. When I complained the next morning they eventually changed us to a rather nice suite with a view of the cruise ships and harbour, This was an excellent room to have where you can watch all the cruise ships depart and all the comings and goings below. The other point I would make is that they serve the unpleasant and expensive coffee in a plastic cup, not what I would expect from a Sheraton or any 4 star hotel. Overall though it was a very convient place to stay in Old San Juan being near everything and the staff were friendly. If only they would soundproof the rooms and at least serve the same brand of coffee in the bar/restaurant which is in the rooms, in a proper cup or mug, this hotel would be an excellent choice. I would stay again provided I got a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - Great pre cruise and/or just touring OSJ”
Reviews.Author: Uremol
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on pre cruise Dec 19th. We got a great rate on Hotwire and were very pleased when we got there that they had upgraded our room to a bay view with a balcony on the 7th floor. The service is good, nothing more than most hotels. There are internet kiosks in the lobby (free for guests). Not sure if the inroom internet is free though. No complaints about the hotel or room, other than the fact that there was a small musty smell but we got used to it very quickly. The chekout was very smooth because we checked out on the TV screen and just dropped our key in the box, We got our bill slid under our door overnight and was just billed the 11% tax. We checked out at 11am and walked to the cruise terminal. There are options of leaving your luggage with the bellmen (not sure if there is a fee though) Can't complain about the location. I would recommend if you are on a pre cruise, but also even if your touring OSJ for a few days its a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: skljajic
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Top notch here - just across the cruise ship port in the old San Juan, near attraction and walking distance from many bars and restaurants. The room was fine and the service good. Will return there without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “great location for Carnival Cruise”
Reviews.Author: NicoleMike
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel IF you are on the Carnival Cruise. The boat docks across the street. They are currently remodeling hotel. New paint and carpet. The room was average.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location...but know what you're paying for.”
Reviews.Author: blivet
Reviews.Content: Great location for walking access to Old San Juan and some (but not all) cruise piers. Hotel has heavy cruise ship traffic given its location. Front desk staff is knowlegeable and helpful. Hotel is clean and well maintained. Pool and "gym" are rooftop and small. Free WIFI a is available if you have your own computer or for $10.95 to use their in-tv internet access. Three "free" computers are available in the lobby but never worked during our stay unless one used the credit card ( $6.95 per 15 minutes) option. Hotel also has a casino on the property along with two smallish restaurants. Excellent, but pricey, buffet breakfast ranging from continental (cold) to full (hot) starting at 6:30 am...maybe. Take note of the "terms and conditions" for room rates which do not include taxes (11%) and Hotel Service Fee (a surprising 11% per day). Avoid rooms near noisy ice machines (rooms ending in 12, 13, 14, 15). Hotel to airport taxis charge by the zone and average a reasonable $20-$25 each way depending on traffic and amount of luggage. A good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl50b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on November 27 the night before our cruise. For some lucky reason we were upgraded to a beautiful suite. The room was huge with a living area, working area and bedroom. Corner Balcony with a view towards the old town and harbor. Very clean and bed was quite comfortable. We left home on a red eye and arrived in San Juan 12 hours later so we were quite exhausted in could not take full advantage of the great location. Had dinner nearby and went to bed. Great location to explore Old Town. Staff was very friendly and helpful I almost did not book the Sheraton because of negative reviews but the great price and location overcame my hesitation. I am very glad we stayed here and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, pity about the dogs and the breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaScLo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week. It's location by the docks is nice. The rooms were a nice size and had nice views. I found most the staff were polite and friendly (bar one female receptionist), and were ready to help with your enquires. The pool located on the roof was small but adequate. What I hated about my stay in this hotel was: The amount of dogs during my stay, guests can have their dogs in their rooms, unfortunately the corridors were not very big so when a guest with their dogs walkied down the corridors, you feel like you are going to be ambushed. On certains days you could small the odour of dogs or see some faecal matter on the carpets, which the poor maids would have to clean up. The breakfast on offer is the hotel was not worth the price tag at all. There were 2 options one cold, price $15 for cereal, fruit, cakes, bread etc and one for $18 which would include pancakes, which were so hard they were more like rock cakes, and eggs and bacon. These were rather greasy so not worth the $3 dollars more. Two days of this was too much so we went to Starbucks instead. The hotel tax: We had to pay a fee of $88 at the time we went. One receptionist explained that this was to cover the use of "complimentary" internet services and gym facilities in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but wouldn't stay there again....”
Reviews.Author: NYSusan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here precruise on Nov. 13th for one night. We were given a room facing a parking lot that was being used that night for an Octoberfest. The noise from the band lasted until midnight. We asked for a room change and there was nothing available away from the band side. The room was clean and comfortable. Pool area was great. The only issue that I really had was 3 out of the 4 of us woke up with bug bites the following morning. I couldn't fnd any signs of bedbugs but there sure was something living in those rooms. I alone woke up with 5 bites, one on my face. Windows don't open so we can't blame it on mosquitos. The location is excellent and very handy to all sites in OSJ.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Enjoyed Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sparky67van
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Sunday after finishing a cruise. As it was early morning and room wasn't ready we could check in and they held our luggage so we could go and explore around Old San Juan. Our room was very clean, although it had no view, that didn't bother me. One thing that we did have a problem with in our room was the phone. Family tried to phone the room but unable to get thru. Tried thru the front desk several times but kept getting the run around. In the end because i had a cell phone ended up using that-- very costly. Otherwise restaurant was great, very good food. Location was great, used the free trolley service to get around Old San Juan. Overall enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Charming”
Reviews.Author: vabchtraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I didn't let the other reviewers keep me out of this hotel. Honestly, it was like we stayed in different properties. I found the staff there helpful, accommodating, and pleasant - even enjoyable. The property itself is stately and lovely and our room was exceptionally clean and free of any odors and/or mildew. The beds were sumptious - loved the linens! The check-in was extremely quick and uncomplicated and the room was ready. I liked the that the room key was used to activate the elevator, a nice safety feature. The rooftop pool and hot tub were clean and attractive and the view of the harbor, ships, and Old San Juan was terrific. The biggest plus for us was that we could get out and walk Old San Juan with ease. The free trolley stops just across the street at the ferry terminal - that's good transportation to get you up the hill. I could not have been happier with this hotel. I have only wonderful remarks to make!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: captainmcd
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and did not have high expectations, but nevertheless I was disappointed. We booked the room through the convention organizer, who got us a rack rate of $145 per night plus tax. For that I Had expected at least a larger room with a good harbor view, but we got a rather small room, no closet, and a dirty bath, with a used hairy cake of soap in the shower. The casino made the small lobby a noisy and unpleasant place. It did have a great location for cruise ships, but we were not on a cruise, but at the convention center, a few miles away. The new Sheraton opened today, and we moved to the new Sheration Convention Center. It has more room at a slightly lower price!

Reviews.Title: “Needs imrovement!”
Reviews.Author: OviedoDogjudge
Reviews.Content: There is alot of construction ,lots of hammering other noises all day.Restaurant closes early and moves outdoor seating at early times. Th rates should be reduced during that construction phase.

Reviews.Title: “The very best pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susanrita
Reviews.Content: The stay was 2 days pre cruise on the Carnival Victory. We went on this cruise in 2007 and stayed at the Condado Plaza and paid a lot more for our room and we felt the Sheraton was much better and in a better location for pre cruise. We paid $155.00/night before taxes and we booked direct with the hotel via telephone. We arrived at 1:30pm via taxi from the airport (taxi fare is a set rate for all taxis-$19.00 for a trip from the airport to the Sheraton plus $1.00 extra per suitcase). Greeted at the door by doormen and they couldnâ€™t do enough for us. Everything was taken care of. We went to the desk and there was no problem that check in was not for another two hours, are room was ready and we went up immediately. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful, check in was a breeze. We asked for a recommendation for â€œreal local Puerto Rican foodâ€� for dinner. They recommended the Raices, two easy blocks from the hotel, he even drew a map. The hotel is very nice, decorated plain but elegant. Everything was clean and in good repair. If you are very critical and choose to look for imperfections, they are there but you really have to look.. Ex.: some worn spots on carpet, evidence of previous paint layers etc-but they were hard to spot. Our room had a King bed which was very comfortable. The air conditioner is controlled in the room and worked well. There was a desk/chair- good size. An extra arm chair and foot rest that could easily sleep a child up to about age 7. The TV was new and a flat HD model with cable TV 30 channels and a pay per view movie channel, safe, ironing board and iron. Bathroom was standard for this type of hotel with the usual â€œgoodiesâ€�. There was a hairdryer and coffee maker in the room. Our room had a large window overlooking the port where the cruise ship would pull in. This hotel is in the middle of Old San Juan and close to the free trolley that runs all around Old San Juan on a regular basis. We walked to Raices as recommended and we were not disappointed. It is small, caters to locals, delicious, excellent service, and not too expensive at all (dinner for two with a beer/dessert came to $45.00 with tip.) As a nice touch, everyone dresses in authentic Puerto Rican dress. They spoke English well and all the dishes were Puerto Rican and not just the usual tourist dishes. Back at the hotel, they have a nice pool on the roof, small but adequate and very nice to swim in, there was also a Jacuzzi. The exercise room was with the pool and it looked well equipped. The machines looked new and they were in good repair. You do have to use your room key to access the elevator to the hotel rooms and pool area. The casino was on the small side but looked adequate. Saturday we ate at the Sheraton that has a breakfast buffet in the Palio Restaurant. Nice complete buffet and very goodâ€¦.the drawback was expense. It was $18.00 per person which we think is a little steep for breakfast. Luckily there is just two of us but, if you are a family with children, eat breakfast else where. We took the free trolley which runs all around Old San Juan. (Stop at an info booth to get a trolley map with all the trolley stops on it) We ate a late lunch and the Burger company which is also at the Sheraton-great food hereâ€¦HUGE hamburgers and portions. $9.00 for a burger bigger than a Whopper, and fries that were too much for use to eat and we shared one order of fries. In fact this held us for the rest of the day and we never had dinner. Of note we saw A LOT of people waiting in the lobby today with luggage. All seemed to be pre cruise guests. I would recommend coming two days before the cruise and not the day before. Iâ€™m sure the people waiting a long time in the Sheraton lobby would not give it high marks for checking in. Checkout was easy although elevators got very crowded in the morning due to the crowds of people trying to leave and get to their cruise ship. The Sheraton will keep your luggage for you downstairs and next time we will bring our luggage down VERY early, say about 6 or 7 am and store it downstairs so the wait for elevators a couple of hours later with tons of people will luggage can be avoided. Another tip, forget valets for your luggage, it take them forever to transport the luggage in the elevators too so peak â€œtime to go to the cruise ship timeâ€� you will wait forever for a valet and cart. Overall, this was a wonderful hotel and couldnâ€™t be more convenient for pre-post cruise stays. The staff was extremely helpful and we would stay here again regardless of what we had to pay. POST VISIT: addendum - When checking in for the Carnival cruise, we had packed in our checked luggage a hammer and screw driver because we were having trouble with one of the wheels on our luggage. We packed it just in case, it was my husbands â€œfavorite old screw driver and pliers. Unfortunately, â€œtools of any kindâ€� are contraband on cruise ships and we got called down to open our luggage. They also decided while the luggage was open to disallow my very good computer breaker/extension cord â€œfire hazardâ€� in cabin. I could not bring these on board but could throw them away or mail them home. Carnival said the Sheraton â€œmailedâ€� things. Well it was Sunday and we could FED Ex it for a ridiculous expense or wait for Monday and sent it US mail (cruise ship was leaving-not an option) In steps the bell man Alex and he offered to hold it for us while we were gone and we could stop at the Sheraton and pick it up -no charge (We gave him a tip when we picked it up) Alex saved the day for us as well as saving us from throwing away some items we wanted to keep. THANKS ALEX!!- I posted wonderful Alexâ€™s picture with this review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BKTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton San Juan before our Carnival cruise. We had a room overlooking the water where our ship was docked right outside the door. This hotel has a great location for cruise travelers as you do not need a car. Walk to shopping and El Morrow. Free wifi and pc/printer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to enjoy Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MSL_Tampa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Old San Juan prior to a cruise in September 2009. We chose to stay in the Sheraton Old San Juan due to its close proximity to the cruise ship port and the attractions in Old San Juan. You can literally walk across the street to board the ship. Also all of the attractions in Old San Juan are just a short walk away, very central location! A few years prior, we stayed in the Condado area and found that the taxi fees were quite high to travel back and forth between Condado and Old San Juan daily. The free Old San Juan shuttle bus and trolley system also has stops directly outside the hotel. The rooms themselves are not that great, are in need of renovation and are small. The roof top pool looks great in the pictures, and it is a nice touch, however the pool seems to be much smaller in person. The cost of the room was more expensive than most in the area compared to the value. We justified the extra premium on the cost with the great location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL...”
Reviews.Author: Frank00680
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in San Juan, PR. 40 years ago I left the city to go to college in the western part of the island (3 hours trip) and stayed there. My last trip to old San Juan was 10 years ago. I took a weekend break and reserved at Sheraton Old San Juan. Boy that was the best decision Iâ€™ve made in recent years. The hotel staff was very friendly, special note on Yaira, she was very kind and helpful. The assistant front desk Manager, Mr. Ramon Martinez, was also very helpful; especially on a problem I had with the reservation. The rooms were not too big but to be honest you donâ€™t need a football field to have a good time. Iâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodation. Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MisterMVA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenient if you visiting San Juan for a night or two. It's located in old San Juan near several cruise ship piers. We stayed for two nights so we could tour Old San Juan. The hotel itself is very comfortable (4 or 5 star quality). The room we had didn't have much of a view but the price was right. The hotel is close to all kinds of restaurants and we even found local entertainment one night down by the water. We visited both of the old forts nearby and walked all around the old town area. The hotel has internet access in the lobby which was great for airline check in. There is also a casino in the lobby - it was sort of fun to watch. We did visit the rooftop pool - kind of small but very refreshing and relaxing after a hot day of sightseeing. All in all a very very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, perfect”
Reviews.Author: BlondieK97
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location & it was at a good rate. Our previous experience in Puerto Rico was not so good, so I was a little aprehensive. Everything worked out great. The room was clean & comfortable....a little small, & a small window, but we didn't care about that. Everything about the trip was wonderful. In Old San Juan, You are soo close to so many wonderful restaurants. We live on St. Thomas, so we didn't care about going to the beach. We did not have a rental car & I loved being able to walk or easily get a taxi or other transportation. We had absolutely no problems with checking in or out (maybe they fixed that problem with the previous reviews); it appears they even offer several options for checking out. We enjoyed the rainforest while we were there. I don't recomend the breakfast at the Sheraton....highly overpriced & bad quality. From reading other reviews, we mostly ate breakfast at Mallorca. It absolutely has one of the best cups of coffee I ever had. The food is decent to average, but you can't beat the speed or the price! Ate dinner at Sophia's & Marmalade....absolutely wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a couple of nights.”
Reviews.Author: Eric1955
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here wih friends for 2 nights after our 2 week cruise. The lobby was jammed on check in with 4 cruise ships in port, but we were in our rooms in about 30 minutes. Much to ur delight, our room was on the 9th floor right beside the gym and pool entrance, what covenience. The room was adequate and clean, but the pool area was gorgeous. We sat on the pool deck with drinks overlooking the cruise ships in the harbour or should I say staring at them overlooking us! The grand staircase is lovely, but not being a gambler, I found the presence of the casino simply an eye sore and too much unecessary noise. The hotel's location is perfect and we thoroughly enjoyed walking around Old San Juan with it's marelous history and very European look and feel. You don't need a car if you're not planning on driving all over P. R.as you can walk all of Old San Juan in a few hours. We found a charming little waterfront cafe with great appetizers and drinks. I must mention the in-hotel restaurant. It is wonderful and not extravegantly expensive. Coming off a cruise ship, we were justifiably picky, but we had 2 great suppers on the second floor terrace overlooking the harbour. The food was excellent (and I know food), as was the service, and the spectacular veiw. They also served us a fantastic breakfast buffet in the moring out in the warm Feb. sun. What a way to beat the Canadian snowy February. I wouldn't make this my home base for a week, but it's great for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “oh well”
Reviews.Author: sport4799
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for 7 days. I was a bit dissapointed on how small it was. We had a car so we had to have valet parking, you really dont have a choice there is no where to park. The parking is $20 a day so be prepared. The hotel was nice not great. We had some water damage on one wall in our room. The hotel has to really upgrade. The pool is on the roof which is a wonderful view but very small. It is in a prime spot for sightseeing. I would go back but not for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location”
Reviews.Author: babybear96
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the sheraton for 3 nights and discovered the pool was under repair during our stay which was definitely a downer. The location of the hotel was great. The lobby is just busy...the casino hits you right away on the right..the master staircase is in front of you and check in to the left. All staff were extremely friendly. I found the room layouts to be confusing. Everytime I got off the elevator, I could never remember which way to go to get to my room. It was sort of a triangle layout. Overall, it was a safe, clean environment within wakling distance to everything. Something to know is if you are a tourist and getting picked up to go on tours...the hotels in old san juan are the 1st tourists to be picked up and the last to be dropped off.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for 1 night!”
Reviews.Author: Alison1980
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night in the Sheraton Old San Juan the night before our Royal Caribbean Cruise. We found the hotel to be of about a 3 star standard. It served the purpose we wanted it for but I didn't see it as a hotel you would spend more than a couple of nights in. We arrived at the hotel at about 11pm after a long flight. The taxi ride from the airport didn't take long although the traffic around the hotel was very bad and we were stuck in a queue for about 15 mins. We checked in smoothly and were given a free upgrade to the 'governers suite' which was nice. I feel bad passing comment as we were upgraded for free but I will mention a few things about the room in case you are thinking of booking that room. The room was huge with a seperate bedroom, bathroom, big lounge, dining area and 3 large balconys with a great view. It was nice but VERY dated. The decor was very tired and grubby and I wouldn't have been happy if i had paid extra for that room. There was a lot of traffic noise outside the hotel and we could hear car horns from the room at night. The pool on the roof of the hotel was small but we didn't have time to use it anyway. I felt that the hotel was nice and friendly but in desperate need of a refurbishment. As i said ,if it's only for one night it's fine and it was clean! We ordered room service as it was late when we arrived, the food was nice but expensive! The whole hotel including the room rates are very pricey but I think this is common for San Juan with it being a cruise port. The hotel was positioned right near the Carnival Cruise pier which would be ideal if you were cruising with carnival. The Royal Caribbean pier was over the other side, which we knew before we booked but it wasn't a problem to get a taxi and only took a few minutes. The hotel is ideally located if you want to explore Old San Juan, like we did! We had a full morning before our cruise to look around and found it to be very charming. We explored on foot and visited one of the forts and walked to the cathedral and round the brightly coloured houses and shops. San Juan is really a beautiful place to visit. The only major problem we had was when we arrived home and checked our credit card. There was a Â£16 charge on it which we had no idea what it was for. We paid for room service in cash when it was delivered including a tip and had nothing else while we were there! After sending numerous emails to the hotel i have heard nothing back! If you have any questions about this hotel or san Juan please contact me and i will be happy to help

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flutterby02
Reviews.Content: My Family and I stayed at this hotel for just one night. We were going on a cruise the next day. From the time we checked in with Front Desk to the time we checked out, the experience was the best. For 6 rooms to checkin at once, we were checked in within 20 mins tops. We went straight to our rooms, changed clothes, and went walking the grounds of Old Dan Juan. Let me just say night time, Wonderful. From the restaurants to the shops, everything was awsome. Our rooms were on the 7th floor with a beautiful view of the water and cruise docks. I was very sad that I had to leave the next day on my 7 day cruise. But, whenever I do the cruise again, I'll definatly stay here. Rooms: Excellent! Bathroom: Clean Service: Excellent!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: mex25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to our caribbean cruise and post cruise prior to flying back to Nor-Cal. 1.Location ,Location,Location-Right in the heart of Old San Juan,all the great shopping,walking distance to the Forts of El Morro and Christobal -a stones throw to the Carnival embarkation pier. 2.Grreat service-as a longtime SPG member check in was a little crowded on cruise sunday -However George at the front desk provided us with excellent service and upgraded us to a suite-Nice! 3.a 5 minute cab ride to the Pan Ameician pier for Royal. 4.The Casino 5.The live music in the Casino 6. A bell staff that never dropped the ball-no fiascos If our expecting a expansive property such as Westin -this is not a resort If you need a great pre or post cruise stay this is your property

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Carnival Cruisers & Old San Juan Visitors”
Reviews.Author: childfree_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a cruise. If you are cruising via Carnival, you wonâ€™t find a better hotel location as the Sheraton is across the street from the cruise terminal; while many others were waiting at the terminal for cabs, we took our luggage and walked one block to check-in. Check-in was busy but efficient. We arrived eight hours early (from our cruise) so our room wasnâ€™t ready (of course, we didnâ€™t expect it to be since it was 8:00 a.m.), but we checked-in and our bags were kept safe until our return that afternoon. Most of the people in the lobby seemed to be doing exactly what we were doing so even though it was crowded, we waited ten minutes tops. Our room was surprisingly large. We booked via Priceline and paid $98.00 for a Sunday evening. The bed was comfortable. Everything in the room worked the way it should and we were very pleased with our evening at the Sheraton. The rooftop pool was small but clean and what a view! Iâ€™ve included several photos so you can see for yourself. We had the best dinner at Palio, the hotelâ€™s restaurant. We sat outside on the terrace and not only was the food delicious but the service was impeccable. Checking-out consisted of calling down to let them know we were leaving and then when we reached the lobby, a doorman hailed a taxi for us. The entire stay was painless from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: DelawareSunburst
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Rio Mar for 4 days, we moved over to the Sheraton Old San Juan. Even though we are members of their Sheraton chain, the desk clerk would not grant us an upgrade. We arranged ahead of time for an early check in and when we did check in were told we would have to wait until 3:00 for the room to be cleaned. A few minutes later a room mysteriously became availabe. The room smelled musty and moldy and we were escorted to two more rooms before we could get one that did not stink as bad. The carpet was stained and the room had a small window that could not be opened. We lost power for 2 hours because of heavy rain(?!) The front desk on two occasions was rude and had an attitude. I asked for directions and she rolled her eyes when I wanted the names of the streets. The bell man was annoying when we needed a cab at checkout. He frantically practically pushed us out the door. Their hospitality service needs some brushing up to do.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a perfect location for cruisers”
Reviews.Author: puablo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for one night prior to a cruise out of Pier 4 and couldn't be more pleased. In addition to being directly across the street from the cruise terminal, the hotel is in a great location to start your own walking tour of Old San Juan. You would never need a cab to go anywhere in Old San Juan or to the cruise port. As for the hotel quality, it was very nice, quite clean, and quiet (though I was near the top floor). My view was nonexistent - just an interior courtyard - but the room was of clean and very comfortable. The price is pretty high for what you get, but it's competitive with other hotels in the area. For being a comfortable hotel in a fantastic location, I cannot complain.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: WhydoIhavetopick
Reviews.Content: It took several rooms to find and acceptable one. The room product is not bad. The beds seem slightly worn I found several rooms had week ac units. The bigger problem, and it is not the hotels fault, is lots and lots of families and kids. As a business traveler who's job requires him to be well rested in the AM, this is not a great place. Staff was friendly and accommodating which was a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location... Great Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: CherylTravels
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for location, it will be difficult to beat the Sheraton in Old San Juan. Everything you want to see in OSJ is right outside the hotel. It was great watching the ships sail in and out from the 9th floor pool. Although lacking a much needed mini-fridge, the room amenities were surprisingly good quality. There was a 32" flat screen TV, coffee machine, shampoo with conditioner, lotion. The sheets were high quality, as was the pillow top mattress. We had a room with 2 doubles. Four pillows on each bed (2 firm, 2 soft). Really plush comforter made sleeping wonderful. Taxi from the airport to the Sheraton is $19.00 plus $1.00 per bag (plus tip). Check in desk was fast and friendly and our room was ready for a 2:00 p.m. arrival. Bellmen were funny and concierge helpful with any questions. There is a casino on property which was very busy on Friday night. There is also a Chicago Burger and an Italian restaurant on site. We ate at the Chicago Burger Friday evening and for $15.00 a plate we had an enormous burger with all the toppings, fries, and a drink. Not bad given tourist town pricing. Starbucks is right around the corner, as is the Eden Spa and numerous stores. There is an information stand just outside the hotel (look for the green roof). The free trolley stop is an easy one block to the east. There are two trolley systems. The open air trolley goes all the way to El Morro fort. You can get off/on at various stops. There is also an enclosed bus that runs an inner loop around the store front areas. This was nice when we went to get our soda and water for the ship, because we didnâ€™t want to walk all the way back with the heavy packages. I highly recommend a morning walk around the base of El Morro, just beautiful! Of course, the coach outlet also has a special place in my heart lol. Internet is free, just ask for the password at the desk. The lobby is wireless, the rooms are hard-wired. Checkout is 10:00 a.m. on the weekends and the lobby is hectic with all the people coming/going from cruise ships. I have literally 100's of photos of my trip and OSJ.. PM or email me if you are interested in the link. Cheryl :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: isakalo
Reviews.Content: We got a wonderful suite room at the Sheraton old San Juan. The room was great, the service was very good and we got to enjoy some of the amenities of the hotel. My parents had selected to stay at the Ritz so we went to the beach there so I am not sure about the beach close to this hotel. The location on old San Juan was great to walk to the castle and to view the old city. We had a good experience with the hotel and there are nice restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: DCMcG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in February 2009. I am a Starwoods Guest Rewards member, and booked my stay using points, and paying a discounted rate. That was my main factor in booking the hotel. The hotel's location is really perfect, it's right off of the dock in what I guess is the southeast corner of Old San Juan. I was not travelling on a curise ship, and was entertained/annoyed by the constant stream of tourists flocking into the street in front of the Sheraton. If you are on a cruise and don't want to walk much (let's be honest, a lot of people on cruise ships don't want to walk), this location can't be beat. Old San Juan is a fairly small and easily navigated city, we were able to walk every where we went, to San Cristobal and other attractions in the city. There is a Starbucks right up the street, and many bars and restaruants right around the corner that are worth visiting. Besides the location, the hotel itself is nice, but not amazing. The only casino in town is located in this hotel, and it is a pretty nice casino, but was usally pretty crowded. There is a burger restaraunt attached to the hotel which is small and overpriced, but serves decent food. I was in a room with a king sized bed overlooking the port. It was a standard room, not too large, but definitely adequate. The gym is nice, it has everything you would expect in a hotel gym plus some extra equipment like a captain's chair and good selection of free weights. The pool, however, leaves something to be desired. It is a rooftop pool, but it's so small it barely qualifies as a pool. I laid out one afternoon, and as the sun starts shifting, there are only 3 chairs on the deck that continued to get sun past about 3 PM. Definitely don't chose the hotel for the pool. Even though I got a discounted rate, the percentage of taxes tacked on to the room was absurd! This hotel is definitely over priced, however if you have the money, to spare or have Starwood points, or happen to get a good deal, it's a great location with some decent perks.

Reviews.Title: “Way, way overpriced -- Casino more imporant to them than their guests”
Reviews.Author: NoneColumbus
Reviews.Content: This place is way, way overpriced for what you get. We stayed there, prepaid on Orbitz, before and after we went on a cruise, for some $360 a night and it was in no way worth anything like that. The biggest problem with this hotel is that their casino is obviously much more important to them than their hotel. The casino takes up most of the space that otherwise would be devoted to the lobby. The result is that the tiny, tiny lobby is way too small. It only has a few chairs and is most of the time a mad house of guests squeezing into that cramped space trying to get to the desk. Another result is that desk clerks are swamped and do not have time to be particularly polite or attentive. For instance, my wife made the mistake of standing behind another guest at the desk. The clerk snapped at her to get back behind the line at the end of the rope waiting line and was not a bit nice about it. The toilet in our room was stopped up the first time we stayed there. We called the front desk, which never did answer. I finally went down to the lobby. After a very long wait in a very long line, they told me they would send somebody up to fix it. They did not. The next morning, the front desk did actually answer and this time they did send someone who fixed the problem. The second time we stayed there, upon returning from the cruise, there was no remote for the television in the room. When the porter arrived with our luggage, I mentioned this to him, while tipping him generously. He said he would get us a remote. A couple hours later, no remote had arrived. So, I tried to call the front desk again and again it did not answer. So, I again went down stairs, waited in a very long line to tell them about it. Finally, we got our remote. The room was not cramped, but it was not spacious or $360 a night luxurious either. The room in any Red Roof Inn would put it to shame. The two double beds were uncomfortably small and uncomfortably hard. The second time we stayed there (after the cruise), they had a power failure about eleven that evening. The result was no light, no running water and no air conditioning in tropical San Juan. When I went downstairs, I was amazed to see that the casino was lit up like a Christmas tree and was operating full steam with all the machines whirring and clanging. That is, they had auxiliary power for their casino but not for their hotel guests â€“ a rather clear sign of where they place their priorities. When we checked out the next morning, there was still no power and no water. When we suggested upon checkout that we had not gotten our $360 worth, they said they could not compensate us for our very sweltering, miserable, nasty toilet night, because we had booked our room through Orbitz. However, if we wanted to pay for two more nights, they would give us a third night free. If I ever stay at another Sheraton, the Devil will be right behind me in an overcoat and an icicle will be hanging from his nose. We have visited San Juan many times and it is about our favorite travel destination. However, always before we stayed at the Hilton, which is much less expensive and a much nicer hotel. The reason we choose the Sheraton this time was that the Frommer travel guide for Puerto Rico said it was in Old Town and was close to where the cruise ships docked, supposedly an easy walk. There are two tourist areas in San Juan â€“ Old Town, which is historic part of San Juan, with the nicest tourist shops and Condado, which is a more modern tourist part of San Juan. The parking is much better in Condado. The restaurants are far better and far less expensive in Condado and far less likely to be tourist traps. For instance, we had a meal at Senor Frog's, which looks like a kid friendly place, about a half block from the Sheraton. Every time one of the children's sodas got anywhere near empty, they would grab it away and shove another in front of her without asking. When they gave us our bill, they had charged for every one of those unordered drinks at a very high price per drink and they got really nasty when we complained about the fact that we had not ordered those drinks. What can you do? We paid it. The final blow was that the Sheraton was not close to where most of the cruise ships dock. That that turned out to be a long way away on the far side of the harbor â€“ a $25 cab ride each way. The good hotel, the Hilton, is between Old Town and Condado. You can imagine the teeth gnashing that went on when our cab passed our beloved Hilton, both on the trip to and from the cruise ship. My advice. Avoid the Sheraton. Go to their casino, if you like, but don't stay there. Stay in the Hilton or in one of the many less expensive hotels in Condado. However, don't avoid Puerto Rico. It is a wonderful, safe place to visit. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay, good location in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: viajera79
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton Old San Juan through Priceline, so we got a great deal on a one-night stay for a layover to our next destination. The staff at the hotel was very friendly, and we were upgraded upon check-in. The hotel itself though, is in need of some upgrades or maybe just daily upkeep. The pool is tiny, although I understand that they probably don't have the space to have a bigger facility like some of the resorts. There was a mold on the ceiling and floor in our bathroom, and the walls were really thin - we could hear everything going on in the next room. There was only one vending machine in the whole place with water, and it was broken. Also, we asked to use the business center and it was closed for reasons we were not sure of. I probably wouldn't pay full price to stay here, but it was fine for the price we got online. The best part is probably the location - walking distance to lots of restaurants, shops and all the sights in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pre-Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: mic_sam
Reviews.Content: My GF and I stayed there the night before our cruise departed. First of all, The stupid American Airline, lost our suitcases. So we ended up at the Sheraton with Nothing and were very down and dissapointed. The front desk lady offered us a complimentary upgrade to a very nice suite and provided us some amenities for the night. The casino was closed due to Good Friday and the Chigago burger place was good, but it was just a burger. The hotel was surprisingly CLEAN, pretty and cosy. I don't understand where the bad review are coming from as I'm use to 5 stars hotel and I would recomment it to anyone who need a decent place to stay for a precruise night.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly quiet, roomy accommodations, but inadequate elevators”
Reviews.Author: lebelgo
Reviews.Content: As an SPG Gold member, I was given a corner suite, which was quite nice. I stayed here about 5 years or so ago when it was a Wyndham, and the property has definitely been upgraded in terms of amenities, decor, and quality/comfort of furnishings. Although it was a suite, the single sink was inside the bathroom. It would have been tough for a family. The hotel is in a good location for those wishing to spend a day or two visiting old San Juan on their way to either other islands or to other parts of the island (we were pre-cruise). It's near the entrance, so the traffic isn't too horrible coming in. Some other old San Juan hotels (such as El Convento) are a bit of a nightmare to get into by car or taxi. Basically, all of old San Juan is walkable, and there are plenty of good eating places nearby. Notwithstanding one of the member pictures on this site, our cruise ship was docked a couple of miles away, by the executive airport. Our room was across from a nightclub, so I was worried it would be noisy, but it wasn't (on a Friday night). The living room of the suite was next to the ice machine, which was quite noisy, but the noise didn't carry into the bedroom. The TV's are flat-screen but not high-definition. The casino is nice and friendly, but has no craps table (one has to go to the Marriott in the Condado neighborhood for that). The pool is fairly small, but with a view--and probably the best for Old San Juan. My main complaint relates to the elevators. There are only two and they are small. They were jammed-packed and we couldn't get in them in the morning when we were checking out. We were finally able to squeeze into an elevator going up, then had to go up and down the hotel, to the glares of frustrated guests. This hotel is probably a good choice for someone who wants to spend a day exploring old San Juan prior to a cruise or to a trip elsewhere in Puerto Rico or the Caribbean. It's not a place to soak in the sun, lie by the beach (not near a beach), nor lie by the pool. And I wish they'd do something about the elevator situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great everything”
Reviews.Author: PRJenx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton in Old San Juan from 3/3-3/7, and again from 3/15-3/17. Having read previous posts, I was a little apprehensive about staying there, although we had already booked the room. We had nothing but a great experience. The hotel staff were wonderful, especially Frances who I believe is a supervisor. The rooms were clean and spacious, and we had a great view of the cruise ships coming in to port. The location is the best around. There are many hotels in San Juan, but not that many in Old San Juan. So if you want to be within walking distance to all Old San Juan has to offer, this is the place to stay. I just have to say a few things to those of you who mentioned the staff or the pool in a negative connotation. First, the hotel is very very busy. They are directly across the street from the harbor, so they are booked solid a lot of the time. They have many many guests to attend to, and I think as long as you are patient, they will be patient with you. Second, for the hotel to even have a pool is a pretty great thing, considering they are in the middle of a very busy city. The pool is on the rooftop, with a spectacular view of San Juan and the water. Yes, it is small, but what do you expect in a city? Anyway, if you are hesitating staying here, don't. We would stay there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see sight in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: jimandnango
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, post celebrity cruise. Hotel was in a good location for checking out the city. Staff was wonderful. My son-in-law accidentally left his credit card upon check in, discovered it missing later, and asked if he left it there. Staff had him show identification before giving it to him in a sealed envelope. Very trustworthy. We got a good rate with priceline, under $100 dollars for the night. My son-in-law joking asked for the best room, and received it! A two-room suite on the 8th. floor, I was told they only have two rooms like that! We ate at the Chicago burger restaurant, and being from Chicago, we never heard of this place!! The burgers were excellent. The only drawback, beer in a paper cup??? Weird. Loved walking around Old San Juan, even into the wee hours. We felt very safe. Pool and hot tub were great. Pretty much had this to ourselves. Comfortable beds and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and location”
Reviews.Author: NJLisa
Reviews.Content: We reserved 4 nights at an AARP rate and were upgraded to a large 7th floor room with 2 French doors and a huge balcony with an unobstructed view of San Cristobel Fort and the harbor. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hall carpets are worn in places but the room was clean. When the doors were closed, the room was quiet. The hotel's location is perfect for exploring old San Juan and we walked everywhere easily and occasionally took the free trolley. The internet cafe down the street charged $3.50 for 20 minutes. La Bombonera or Cafe Mallorca on San Francisco Calle served excellent breakfasts. Raices restaurant is reasonable and serves Puerto Rican dishes. We also recommend the Parrot Club where we ate outside in the back to escape the noise of the main dining room. We asked the waitress to turn off the mechanical bird which kept calling loudly and learned that it was the famous coqui, a tiny tree frog, calling for a mate. We were very pleased with the Sheraton and Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel if you're not paying 5 Star rates!”
Reviews.Author: x2fr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in one of the Junior Suites (Rm. 831) on the 8th Flr courtesy of a very kind and friendly front desk staffer whom, without our prompting or requesting, simply noticed we were exhausted from our late night flight and realizing we were on our honeymoon, upgraded us to this room! The rest of the service staff and housekeeping were professional and friendly. They were very quick to respond to our requests (extra towels, bottled waters, etc.). Hotelâ€™s in a great location, right in the heart of Old San Juan, walking distance to many attractions, restaurants, and shops; very good place to be if itâ€™s your first time in SJ and/or donâ€™t have much time to tour it. Everything you need is conveniently around the hotel! Hard to beat this location especially for the wonderful sea breeze coming from the bay right into the suite! We slept with the balconies open and without a/c! The hotel has a nice well-equipped exercise room. The swimming pool is small but offer great views and sun tanning angles. The hotel restaurant was disappointing especially for breakfast; very pricey yet the quality was terrible. We were also discouraged from dining out on the beautiful patio because of the flock of annoying pigeons hanging around it; ready to pounce on your food or drop â€œstuffâ€� on you! I wish the hotel would solve that problem by discouraging the freeloading pigeons away from the patio not the paying guests! The suite we were in is bright and airy with its big windows and three wonderful balconies all offering great views. The closets are spacious and there are plenty of drawers. However, for a suite, I was surprised that there was only one sink in the pretty spacious bathroom. Bottom line, I highly recommend this hotel mainly for its location and service. However, having stayed in other Sheratons, this is one that can use an update/remodel especially in dÃ©cor. Itâ€™s showing its age and some of the amenities offered are not up to the brand standards of Sheraton as most travelers know and expect it to be. I donâ€™t know what the standard rooms are like in there but the suite we were in was good but not what I would consider luxuriousâ€” there were no bathrobes, the towels are not soft, and the drinking cups are cheap disposable ones that youâ€™d find in a Motel 6! This hotel is a good value only as long as you donâ€™t pay 4 or 5 star hotel rates for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Old San Juan Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: carbonegirl
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Sheraton Old San Juan as Celebrity offered to pay for our hotel as they shortened our cruise by 1 day. They offered us $300.00 towards hotel accommodation. We had stayed at Da House for $100.00 per night pre cruise and thought lets take advantage of this credit offered by Celebrity and stay at a higher class hotel. Wrong. The rooms were dark and carpets were on the dirty side. didnt' smell too good either. our view for 300.00 per night was a 6 level parking garage. could not keep our window open as people across the way could see in clearly. no shops, restaurant was pricy and nothing special. the swimming pool area was very small and there were about 10 chairs to use and they were all full and the only type of bar service was a vending machine in another room off the pool area. i have to say the curbside service was very good and they did allow us to check in far earlier than the designated 300pm. but other than that, i didn't find the amenities offered at this hotel any better that that of a boutique hotel while the prices was very different. needless to say, i was quite disappointed as i have been to many other Sheratons and this one was not comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton OSJ- Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: Suznf882
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Sheraton. We were there last weekend. We had two rooms with king beds. We paid $90 each for them on priceline. The hotel is an older building, but it is clean and the decor is pleasant. The fire protection system is up to date and includes sprinklers, smoke detectors and fire rated doors, all in excellent condition (Geek alert! Ok, I admit I'm a fire inspector by trade, I look for that stuff) Our rooms were on the small side, but adequate, certainly bigger then our cruise ship stateroom The in room coffee was excellent, but we had no condiments the first night. The bathroom had plenty of hot water and good water pressure (3rd floor), a nice shower massage and Bliss toiletries. There are only two small elevator cars serving the hotel, and at 3 pm and 10 am, it is a horrible situation. But these are the things that make a vacation an adventure! lol. Other times the elevators are slow, but hey, you are on island time anyway. The pool and jacuzzi area are small, but the views are wonderful, the jacuzzi hot with strong jets and occasional bar service. Although towels are provided earlier in the day, they do not seem to be replenished when the supply is exhausted. It pays to bring your own towel. The exercise room has plenty of equipment and 2 televisions. Again, towels are provided, but seldom replenished. DH found the business center and the policies to be quite frustrating. He ended up spending $10 to print out our boarding passes. (But there is an internet cafe down the street) The porters, particularly Umberto, were extremely helpful. They were polite, prompt and professional as well as personable. The concierge, not the most chipper gal around, was very knowledgeable about the local area. Although she couldn't make suggestions, she was spot on with all the detail in the world when we asked the right questions. She offered up perfect, detailed directions-including addresses- as well as a very useful map to everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel is in the most amazing location. We liked being in walking distance to many different choices for dining. We found wonderful food behind the hotel at Luis's Sports Grill and Genesis Cafe. Luis' had the most wonderful fish tacos and the Perfect Margarita! Genesis Cafe had fantastic chicken dishes from about $7. La Bombenera is a must for a breakfast of mallorcas. While there, we took the ferry to the Bacardi Factory, rode the trolley around town (stops at the hotel and its FREE!), toured the forts (amazing!) and WALKED. In summary, keeping in mind the age of the building, if you don't expect it to meet the same standard as a modern structure you will be pleasantly surprised that the "old girl" does so well. The hotel is clean and pleasant but does not pay much attention to detail. Service overall is non-personal but professional and ranges from adequate to excellent in our experience. The amenities are good and the location phenomenal. We can't wait to go back and we will absolutely stay here again...and again specifically for the location -especially for $90 per night!

Reviews.Title: “First-timer to Puerto Rico/San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Angelique0706
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of what you would expect from a Sheraton. It is located in Old San Juan and near the cruise ports making it ideal for an overnight stay before a cruise or a first-timer to San Juan. I did not plan to stay in my room or on-site for most of my trip. The restaurant was okay, with fantastic Pina Colada's! The Chicago Burger Company did not interest me since I live in Chicago and have been to the Chicago location. I did not visit the casino. The concierge was most helpful with scheduling my excursions to the bio-bay, el Yunque and the beach. I was close to the forts of Old San Juan (walking distance or use the free shuttles), shopping at the outlets, and great restaurants - try Raices for delicious Puerto Rican food! I only have two complaints...(1) the bell staff did not return to my room as promised to assist with a problem (although I probably should not have tipped him first). (2) The cleaning staff, although thorough with the cleaning, were quite loud in the hallways. One morning, the cleaning staff had half the hallway full of stuff (I guess they were organizing their carts). No problem, but just not outside guest room doors so you wake the guests who are sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sicilian1965
Reviews.Content: I have never had such a horrible time! We booked through Travelocity so everything was pre-paid, but upon check-in on a Sun pm, they charged our travel card over $1200 and didn't bother to inform us of this little incidental - we found out on the following Fri pm when after dinner, our card was declined. Instead of apologizing or offering something to make up for the inconvenience, they seemed aggravated that we'd discovered the error!
