I had to do all the trouble-shooting to resolve the issue - spent a few hours doing this - and they still had to resend the fax to the card co. to get our funds released. The room service is slow and over-priced. The rooms are sub-par - bare basics and not exceptionally clean. The bedside table was not dusted once during the entire week. Our room was on the back of the property so there was constant traffic noise and our view was a parking garage. We were never greeted leaving or returning. The man at the tour information desk was utterly useless. The restaurants were pathetic with the same un-service a plenty. I would never, never stay at this hotel again. Upon check out, we were charged taxes that again were included with our booking. When I brought this up to the attendant he told me Travelocity was lying about it and he wouldn't take them off the bill. I hope to have this matter resolved eventually, but sadly that is beside the point and after the fact.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is overpriced, tired, terrible service. Front desk can't be bothered to help either checking in, asking for restaurant choices, checking out, etc. Hotel is old, overpriced and just not worth the bother. Get a better hotel and take a cab to the pier. that's all this place is good for if you are about to embark on a cruise. And even then, I would never recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - offers little except location”
Reviews.Author: Maxx144
Reviews.Content: There are four reasons to stay at the Sheraton in Old San Juan: -It is clean and recently refurbished. -You want to spend a day walking around Old San Juan â€“ which is fun. -There are some interesting local restaurants within walking distance. -You are sailing from the cruise dock across the street. (But note that the Caribbean Princess and the some other large ships sometime sail from the Pan American pier, an $18.00 taxi ride though traffic to from the Sheraton.) Otherwise, this is an expensive, rather unpleasant hotel with little to recommend it. We had a â€œbetterâ€� room with a partial water view. With an armoire instead of a closet and a small window with a permanent wooden shade, the room seemed small and crowded. With the exception of the check in desk and a few couches, the entire lobby area has been turned over to a noisy casino. There is a hamburger restaurant on the ground floor and a typical hotel restaurant on the second floor. Given much better alternatives in the neighborhood, we saw no reason to eat at either. Internet is $10/day. If you have a laptop, try Starbucks. The dinky gym on floor 9 has two treadmills, a few trainers and a rickety universal. A rather nice compact pool area on the same floor is marred by blastingly loud music. And letâ€™s not forget the bellman who walked down our hallway at 7:30 am Sunday morning, loudly whistling Christmas carols and slamming doors as he picked up luggage. We would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: AVD29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan the night before embarking on a cruise. We had lost our bags en route and the front desk staff was very helpful (got us toiletries, contacted the airline). We are spg gold members and we were upgraded to a suite which was very nice considering the hotel was full. The rooms are just average for a starwood property, but about what you would expect for the Sheraton brand. The hotel is older and does have the smell which is common to all old hotels on the water. The roof top pool is nice and was not too crowded. The location is really one of the major positives, right in the middle of old San Juan, close proximity to historic sites, shopping and the pier. Right in the middle of the action if you like going out at night. I am pretty sure you are paying for the location and not the inside of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel was a single night stay before a flight or a cruise, but it is definitely not the kind of place for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Carnival cruise guest pre/post”
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday around 430p. There were only a few people ahead of us in line, but I believe we arrived after the crowd. Our luggage was sent up to our room in the next elevator after us. We stayed one night prior to a Carnival cruise and chose this hotel only because we could walk our bags across to the port. You are only able to walk to the Carnival port, if I was taking another cruise line, I would stay elsewhere and cab it. The staff was friendly and as accomidating as they could be. Rooms were clean and ours didn't have a view, but than again we didn't pay for one. I feel they do upgrade you and are nicer when they are less crowded. It seems at times they don't have enough staff working to accomidate the crowds and a lot of tension comes from that. Also, they only have 2 elevators so it takes a lot of time to get to and from your room and we happened to be on the 9th floor, so taking the stars each time was not always an option. We had them hold our bags after we checked out and it did take about 30 minutes for them to bring them to us. The hotel was a mad house sunday from about 1030A and it still was when we left at 1230p. I'm use to paying alot for drinks, I live in Chicago, however the drinks in the Burger place were outrageous and most of what we had were the local beer.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: campriley
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Wed at 2:30pm. No problem getting into the room. We had reserved the AAA rate and we were upgrade free of charge. All staff we met were very pleasant and helpful. The room was clean. We were on the 8th floor and the hallways were very musty. The pool is small. The view from the pool area is fantastic. The hot tub was only lukewarm. The location of the hotel can not be beat. You can walk across the street for a free shuttle around OSJ. There is a Harley Davidson clothing store in the Sheraton shopping complex next door. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience!”
Reviews.Author: iloveitloud71m
Reviews.Content: Convienience is king . Location , location , location! Pre or post cruisers , This is the most convenient place to stay. After walking off the cruise ship, across the street you can leave your luggage t as you wait for the afternoon check in so you can walk around and explore Old San Juan . Bi-lingual ,Friendly , helpfull front desk , even as the front lobby was mobbed with cruisers , luggage , you name it . Porters did a great job with our luggage! The rooms were alittle musty upon check-in , bathroom door was installed backwards , shower nozzle dows have a few leaks , a little pricey as well . A little less than one would expect from a Sheraton in the states . After considering other places to stay , you'll end up in the heart of Old San Juan anyway , so just stay there avoid taking taxi's and buses . Hard Rock Cafe & Senor Frogs & tons of things all within walking distance. Sheraton is a good base to work from.

Reviews.Title: “Almost impossible to check-in - Beware!”
Reviews.Author: mollyanne
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire many months before and got a great deal - however, it may not have been worth it for the aggravation suffered. We arrived here on a Sunday afternoon around 1:20. The line was already horrendous but the worst was still to come! There were 3 cruise ships disembarking in San Juan this day and the Sheraton OSJ was in no position to accept the incoming guests. Pre-registration was done and we were told they "start giving out keys" at 3 PM. We moved to the restaurant Chicago Burger and had a decent lunch while we waited. Food was good - service was a little slow. At 2:50 we got back in the dreaded line and were told rooms were not ready. OK - wait some more - at 3:30 we are back in line and once we reach the desk we are told "Nope - still no rooms". I very calmly said that was fine - I would wait at the desk til one was ready, as I was not going through that line once more! They told me I could not wait at the desk and since I refused to move they did call security! Fine - he stood behind me but I did succeed in getting one of our 2 rooms. The very rude front desk staff did promise our luggage would be brought to the room and another room key would be delivered within 10 minutes....whatever....they just wanted me away from the desk so we all got our wishes. The security guard did promise my husband that he would stay on it and true to his word we had our luggage and another room within 10 minutes. Our room was on the 9th floor - near the roof top pool. It was very dark and had the appearance of being clean but I'm not totally sure. The lighting was very poor - not even a lamp on the desk. No closet - just an armoire - that's OK because we're only staying one night. Happy to see an operating safe in the room as I have learned to trust no one! The bathroom was very large but once again I wasn't sure about the cleanliness and thought I saw a bug in the corner - it turned out to be fluff but why was it there in the first place? The bed was very comfortable and we did sleep well. Enjoyed a nice breakfast in Pallio the next morning - the staff was friendly and the portions were large. The final insult from the front desk was that they could not - or would not? - make change so we could tip the valet. We were told the hotel check-in nightmare happens every Sunday so beware - you could spend hours trying to get a room. Other guests told us the hotel has a practice of allowing guests to enjoy a late check out, for a fee, and this is why rooms are not ready at the prescribed check in time. Whether this is true or not I do not know. I only know we will never stay there again no matter what the price. The location is perfect - the one true plus for this hotel. You can walk anywhere in Old San Juan and the waterfront area. Next time we will stay in the Isla Verde area and take cabs!

Reviews.Title: “This place ROCKS !!!”
Reviews.Author: TSTBlondie
Reviews.Content: I never leave reviews for anything, but since I utilized trip advisor to help me find a place - I thought now would be a good time to return the favor. The Sheraton is hands down an amazing place to stay - I had a phenomenal view overlooking the bay with 2 huge balconies - the service was superb, the staff were the same - I could not have asked for a better stay in Old San Juan. This place is really in a phenomenal location - I walked to everything and pretty much saw all the sights there was to see in Old San Juan (and then some). I ate at a small cafe just behind the hotel called Cafe Berlin - it was AMAZING !!! I also ate at Cafe El Punto - again, AMAZING !!! Also, you MUST try the Pina Coloda's at Barrachina - again, AMAZING !!! What can I say, I was surprised by all the good food I ate and I have a very picky appetite !!! I hope to visit San Juan again in the future and if my travel plans have me in Old San Juan - I will DEF be choosing the Sheraton again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Mold/water leak in room, would try another hotel....”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGirl82
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel when booking a cruise through our travel agent. We flew into SanJuan a day early expecting to have a great weekend and enjoy SanJuan prior to boarding our ship. However, we had much disappointment! CHECK IN/ROOM: As for the hotel, check-in was very slow, our room was not ready, so went walked around the city for a bit. After a few hours, they notified us that we could check in. Upon arrival to the room, we noticed a terrible smell along with black mold growing on the ceiling and one of the walls was saturated with water, I'm guessing there was a leak somewhere. Now, to give the hotel some credit, it is VERY HUMID in SanJuan and therefore, the mold/moisture issue is not all their fault. BUT, I called the front desk to complain and was told "all of the rooms are full". So, I then requested a discount or refund as the room was seriously in bad shape. They told me that since I PREPAID for the room, I could not be discounted or refunded, Go figure, you pay as instructed and then are punished. Then, I continue to ask to speak with management and they state, "there is not management on the weekend", interesting. At this point, I was calling the 1-800-sheraton phone# found in our room to complain, when the conceierge showed up and noticed we were unhappy, he was the ONLY person that went out of his way to make our stay more enjoyable. He quickly noticed how bad the room was and called downstairs immediately and got us a new room, which was ready in 10 minutes. As for our 2nd room, it was better, no mold/water, but still not great, it was fine for the night, but thats about all I could have handled. It was still very humid and damp in the room, once again, due to the weather and not the hotels fault, but I dont think the A/C could keep up w/the humidity. LOCATION: It is very convenient to the pier if choosing this hotel for a cruise. And it is a great location in Old San Juan, walkding distance to the Forts, etc. HOTEL FOOD: We ate at a Burger place in the hotel which was actually pretty good, would recommend it, if you are in the mood for a burger/fries, etc. We also had breakfast at the restraunt in the hotel and the food was average for a breakfast buffet, not terrible and not great, but definately edible! CASINO: We only used for about 15 minutes. It was a pretty nice casino, and lots of people in there, but we didn't use this facility much. OVERALL: Would not return to this hotel as the rooms need some updating and the staff was not helpful. Good luck.....we spoke with tons of other people that stayed in New San Juan prior to departure, and their experiences sounded much better and the location was still not very far from the ship's port! Oh yea, everything in San Juan is VERY EXPENSIVE!! So bring your $$!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: GiveMeSunNorCal
Reviews.Content: Although not a resort hotel it was a great place to stay. We had stayed for one night after our cruise and everything was in walking distance for Old San Juan,e.g., shopping, restaurants, sightseeing. We are Starwoods members and they upgraded us to a suite with a balcony view of the harbor and a bedroom window view of the harbor. Great room...living room , changing room, bedroom with sitting area, and an adequate bathroom. Very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. The pool was small but quaint and comfortable with a jacuzzi and the view...some of the best in the city. Weight room just ok. Casino connected and fun. Staff was excellent. No problems with lines checking in or out. Would definitely stay again for the service and convenience of Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingNYCGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and i could have stayed a lot longer. Location: This was my favorite thing about this hotel. This hotel is ideally located in Old San Juan. It is the only major hotel right in Old San Juan. You can walk to everything in the area so a car isn't necessary. Beware if you do get rent a car, it is $20 per day to park. A car is not necessary unless you travel past San Juan itself. A cab should cost you only around $50 round trip with tip to go to the airport or the new San Juan area. If you are adventurous, take the bus. It is 50 cents and not all that bad on a raining day. Directly outside the hotel is where you can catch the ferry to the Bacardi Factory. the cruise ships dock right in front of the hotel so at times it can be a busy area. When the ships are in there are plenty of street vendors and local foods. Every type of restaurant is available in the area and they are all trendy with good foods and fair prices. Outlet shopping is also available within walking distance. Senor Frogs is literally outside the side door of the casino. Hotel: Casino is great. Friendly staff and the free sandwiches and beverages are delicious. It was clean although it could use some new carpet. The rooms were very clean but very basic. All you need is in the room but if you are looking for luxury, try a hotel in New San Juan. Some rooms have a water view. The rooftop pool is small but clean, comfortable, quiet and a view to kill for. Room Service was great. Food was very good. A decent amount of channels on the tv. Staff very attentive. FYI this is a non-smoking hotel. You cannot smoke anywhere, even the casino. Puerto Rico in general is smoke free. A couple of disappointments was there was no bar or a hotel shop, if you should need buy something such as toothpaste, toothbrush, etc. in a pinch. There is a walgreens in the area. There is no beach so if you are going there for the beach, you have to drive. I will definitely be going back and staying at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything else needs a great improvement”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location as it was right across the street from the port for a cruise. The location is excellent, it also is in a great area of old San Juan. Everything is within walking distance. San Juan is a great location to visit, so the hotel has value for only that reason. The checkin was very slow. The room was a disapointment. The hotel, especially the hallways are in need of an update. The Bathrooms are dated. The bed was comfortable. I requested a deluxe room with a view, but a deluxe rate only gives you a window with a shutter that will not open. It also fogs because of the AC. You will only get a balcony with a port view if you book a suite, so their room rate descriptions were deceptive. You only get a view of the side parking lot for a deluxe rate. The workout room was adequate, but one of the guest had to come in to ask us to turn down the TV as the walls are very thin. Most hotels will make sure that those noisy high traffic areas are not near a guest's room. It was embarassing for all. The equiement was old. The pool was small, but had a great view. The casino was a plus, it was bustling and had great Salsa music playing. The breakfast was adqueate. I would suggest that youo go off property for all meals. The staff seemed very put out at all levels.. The checkout was a nightmare. Do not try to check-out between 10A and 100P at the front desk. The express check-out on our TV was not working. When , you are in the lobby in the morning, there is traffic coming in from the ships and leaving. I made that mistake. They did not staff extra people to handle the great influx. There is no way 2 people can handle a horde of people. We also had to walk down the stair well as there was a line for the elevators on our floor. The hotel failed in many areas. If I was going on a cruise I would defiantely book again, otherwise I would not give the hotel another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff, and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kstewsc
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for anything in Old San Juan. The hotel was very nice and the staff was very courteous. Walking distance to great restaurants and sites.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: Jewels07
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed here prior to our July 27th sailing on Adventure of the Seas. Great location in Old San Juan, no need for any cabs to see the town or forts. Front Desk was not friendly, they definitely need some customer service training. Rooms were clean and spacious, we were pleasantly surprised. Casino takes up most of the hotel, can't review because we did not play. Bar was decent, just like any other hotel, bartenders friendly. Check-out was simple, however, do not wait until 12:00. Elevators were PACKED, had to ride up to get down to the lobby. Felt very safe here, and Old San Juan appeared clean to very clean. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a short stay (would not recommend for a "vacation" this is not a resort). The hotel is located next to the pier where Carnival docks (yes you can walk with your bags right on over there) and is only a short 10 minute cab ride to Pan Americano where Royal Caribbean docks. If you are looking to be close to Old San Juan and the cruise ships, this may be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for what you need but not for a real vacation!”
Reviews.Author: csgregory
Reviews.Content: This is ok for a one stay while flight travel from a cruise but I would not stay here for a true "vacation". It is well located but with solid taxi services in the town, staying at one of the more resort hotels I think would make much more sense. For kids, the pool was too small and staying where they had a beach would have been better. Nothing bad really, unless paying 16 bucks for breakfast buffet could be considered rip.

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Location Tough to Beat”
Reviews.Author: KahunaMon
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Old San Juan exceeded my expectations in most areas. We arrived mid-day on a Friday. Check in was a little disorganized due to simultaneous, convoluted problems with two group check-ins. However, our king suite was exactly as billed and our Starwood points were properly credited. We were on the 4th floor and had a great view of the bay and any cruise ships that came in. I would note that the balconies that come with the rooms are tiny. One or two people can stand outside the doors; otherwise you need to leave doors open if you want to have a chair in the balcony area. Our suite was spacious and very clean, with the usual Sheraton bed and amenities. We set out to hit the town right away, and discovered the biggest drawback of the hotel - - the elevators. The one on the right only worked intermittently, and they both were pretty slow. We tried to use the stairs with mixed results. One stairway led us to the street; another required us to exit through the restaurant's kitchen. The Sheraton's location can't be beat. We were a half block from Senior Frog's. Given the strength of the drinks there, that is the maximum you should try to walk afterwards. P.S., while Senor Frog's makes a lot of of drinks with a specific purpose in mind (incapacitating the customers), I got a great 1800/Grand Marnier tequila there, and thoroughly enjoyed the antics. A lot of locals go there, and I noticed most of them wisely stick to beer. Some of the best restaurants, Parrot Club, Aquaviva, and Dragonfly, are only a couple of blocks away, and we walked virtually everywhere in Old San Juan, including the El Morrow Fort. There is also a nice brew pub/steak house (Old Harbor) that is only a few blocks away. Cafe El Bombenara was an amazing old school place, with fantastic cafe con leche and great malloracs. We stayed here three days and I can't imagine a better place to stay to explore this area. There are also taxis aplenty, so commuting to other areas is easy as well. I enjoyed the Sheraton's Casino a lot. The drinks are free and they have abundant and vibrant live entertainment at night. Also, there are a lot of locals who come here and the scene is great. I just played slots and found them to be pretty fair. The pool is small, but it's located on the roof and has great views. It is a fun area during the day, and you pick up on the excitement of people waiting to go on cruises and get advice from those who just came back. Our favorite nightspot was the Parrot Club, which had the best drinks in town (we put this matter to the test). The signature Parrot Punch was very good, but the mojitos were beyond compare. Our bartender, Anthony, could well be dubbed the Ambassador for Puerto Rico. My wife and I have never met a friendlier person in all our travels, and he made fantastic drinks and guided us through the menu with aplomb. His insights on both the area and country were much appreciated. We loved the food at Aquaviva. This is a great seafood place with an intimate atmosphere and good vibe. Check out was a breeze, and our bill was accurate. Enjoy this place. I have tried to accurately convey the details, but really the overall experience was great. If you want to stay at the Ritz and lounge on a beach; stay at the Ritz If you want to see Old San Juan or take a cruise, the Sheraton can't be beat for its location.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Only”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddy54
Reviews.Content: Arrived May 31, 08 for an overnight before June 1st cruise. This hotel is in the perfect location for a pre or post cruise stay but I must say beware the price and the locals. The front desk staff was just so-so. The guys working as bellmen and concierge had a better attitude than the women at the desk. The young lady that checked us is handed me room keys and pointed to the elevator...she never made eye contact with me. Room was on 9th floor with great views of the cruise port and harbor. Very nice decor and apparently recently renovated. Great king size bed but pillows were very nasty...had some kind of brown stains all over them. Asked for new ones...took about 2 hours. Overall, we like the hotel but out of all the places we've traveled we have never been around people that are as rude, loud, and selfish as what we experienced in San Juan. Sheraton's rates at this property are much too high.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel - Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: TonyD285
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Sheraton Old San Juan in late May. We especially enjoyed its location, covenient to all the sights and sounds of the Old San Juan area. We found the personnel in the hotel to be friendly and hard-working. We had only to ask and our needs would be met. Our suite had a wonderful view of the cruise harbor area, directly across from Pier 2 which is a modernistic steel structure. The furniture in the suite was old and almost shabby, the rugs throughout the hotel are in desperate need of replacement, stained and poorly maintained. The casino was crowded with locals every night. Kind of surprising since the slots were pretty "tight." Nearby to the hotel are two restaurants which we would recommend highly. The Old Harbor brewpub, inexpensive with great made-on-premises beers, especially their stout. Their food was simple but plentiful and good. The other restaurant, Panza, is pricey but superb. Sort of a Continental-Caribbean place, beautifully decorated and with very attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and No Smoking - I think not!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jasper_J_Snodgrass
Reviews.Content: We booked......... a room with bay and city view "guaranteed." We got..............a great view of a multi story car park. The guy on the desk tried to of us off with some story that "...you could see the bay and the city before the car park was built." Thankfully he was in a minority and the other staff helped straighten things out the following day. But after 23 hours in transit to this place we really could have done without the hassle. Also problems with the strench of smoke in the rooms. The hotel is recently gone "non-smoking" but they haven't got rid of the smoke smells from the rooms that were previoulsy "smoking rooms" Good location - walking distance to Old SJ is no problem. Beautiful place - not on the main track for UK tourists but we'd go back to OSJ tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: CSIMelissa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located to the cruise terminals and other attractions in Old San Juan. I had a room on the top floor (9) and while I still heard music and partying from the street level, it wasnâ€™t that bad. The room was average size with average furnishings. The bed was very comfortable, however. The hotel staff was cold/unfriendly and the restaurants in and around the hotel were VERY overpriced. The service at the hotel restaurants was horrible and the food wasnâ€™t that great. It took 45 minutes to get my check when I had cheese fries at the Chicago Burger Company located in the hotel. My advice is to ask for your check when they bring you your food and you might actually have it by the time you are done. The only time I received "service with a smile" was when I ordered room service. Although overpriced, it was very good and the waiter that brought everything to the room was polite. The hotel itself wasnâ€™t bad and like I said, the location was excellent if you are cruising, but I feel the hotel is overpriced and overrated. The area around the hotel is somewhat rough at night, so my advice would be not to go out after dark. Puerto Rico is beautiful but I found the people there to be very rough and rude. Iâ€™m certainly not impressed with the hotel or the country!

Reviews.Title: “$10 a day for internet horrible staff!”
Reviews.Author: louueve
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk are horrible! don't expect a friendly greeting when you check in and don't ask any questions since they seem to think that you are bothering them when you do. The middle manager at the front desk seems to think that she's doing you a favour by checking you in. There is a $10 charge per DAY for internet, it's really backward. The comforters on the beds smell! and the rooms are run down. The lobby is ok and so is the casino. I get the impression that the people who run this hotel do not care about real vacationers, they only see the hotel as a place that people on cruises overnight will stay. Oh and by the way NEVER book anything on EXPEDIA. They messed up the reservation and did not want to correct it for us, and the lovely staff at the hotel did not care.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Not Much of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peregrino
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is the best thing about it. The carpets (both in the room and in the common areas) were stained and worn. There is a charge for internet access. We booked one night through Priceline and one through Hotwire. On one night we were charged an additional $9.96 for an amenities fee and the other an additional $15 for room tax. Not that it's a big deal, but the fees were unexpected and something that anyone planning to book through either Hotwire or Priceline should be aware of. Check with the extremely helpful staff about places to eat. We found good restaurants from both the bellhops and the desk staff. There are a lot of not so good and overpriced restaurants nearby, so it's really important to ask around rather than to just read the posted menus, which we did on our first night, to our regret. Not particular to this review--if you want a rental car, Charlie Car Rental had the best rates we found and, again, a really friendly and helpful staff. They will pick you up at the airport or your hotel and return you to either. The airport location is open 24 hours a day but the downtown location is just open during the day. Nice new cars at reasonable rates. You will need a car to visit the rain forest. If you do go there, be sure to take a tour with the park ranger. It's free and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent Business Traveler thinks it was just OK”
Reviews.Author: dsmulligan
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and always stay at Sheratons. I think overall Sheraton has nice properties and they are dependable. I feel pretty much the same way about the Sheraton in Old San Juan - it was OK, nothing to write home about. It is located in a weird area (yes, Old San Juan is far from downtown, but the hotel itself is at the bottom of Old San Juan right next to the port). --The hotel itself is modern and very clean - the room was the same. --Very small casino although most of the casinos in San Juan are about the same size. --Two mediocre restaurants - one burger place and one Italian. Food and drinks were decent, a little pricey given the quality. --The gym is pretty horrible. Don't bother. --The pool is OK, small but if you are like me, going for business, it doesn't really matter. If you are going to San Juan and want a great experience, visit the Condado Plaza Hotel. I stayed there right after the Sheraton and it was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Post-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: garciafa
Reviews.Content: Excellent American Hotel in downtown San Juan. Usual American amenities- 4 star quality. Only stayed one night after cruise. Never made it to pool or casino. Walked to local restaurants to have dinner. On Sunday nights there are street vendors and a fair-like atmosphere in San Juan along Paseo La Princesa (street that runs along bay from hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but pricey!”
Reviews.Author: Loves_Snorkeling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise departed. We arrived in San Juan around noon but could not get our room key until 3pm. This was a little inconvenient but we lived with it. The room met my expectations. It was clean, comforable with a nice view of the harbour. As other people mentioned, it was nice seeing the other cruise ships at the pier across the street. Ours was located at the Pan American Pier across the harbour. I found the price pretty high but I guess it's supply and demand. When there are several ships in San Juan, the hotels fill up fast. I booked a room about 1 year ago at a rate of $225.00. The rooms were going for over $300.00 recently. The location of this hotel is it's selling point. It is near walking points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: clubmeister
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we have stayed at the OSJ Sheraton. We stayed one night precruise. We love the location because we enjoy going out to dinner in Old San Juan as well as enjoy the abundant nightlife which is within a few blocks of the hotel. We arrived at 3:00pm and checkin was a breeze. We had a basic inside room. Definitely very quiet compared to the rooms in the back of the hotel where the noise from Senor Frogs can sometimes be heard. Our room was clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The biggest problem with this hotel is the lack of elevators. There are only two that guests use and they can be packed around checkout time. I would suggest that you checkout around 11:00 am to avoid the rush later. I would suggest this hotel if your are looking for location, location, location when it comes to enjoying Old San Juan. In addition, if your ship happens to use the OSJ pier, then it's nearly right across the street within walking distance. If you are using the Pan-American Pier, it is just a short cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Your basic Sheraton, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Chicago_Eric
Reviews.Content: It's pretty much your basic Sheraton hotel. There is nothing Puerto Rican about this place in any way. Not event the two restaurants (Chicago Burger & Tuscan Grill). Our room was clean and comfortable, but just the same as any Sheraton in the US. The staff was helpful. The location is really the draw. It is right across from the harbor and right in the center of Old San Juan. Just about anything in the old city is walking distance. It was fun watching the cruise ships enter and leave the port. If you're looking for a cute small hotel with local character--take a pass. If you don't mind the lack of character but want a good location and predictable facilities, this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Meh (ok for cuising)”
Reviews.Author: bekahblue22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty mid-level. Although our stay included some hotel related injuries, the location is prime. We picked the hotel because of its close proximity to the pier (as we were taking a cruise). The location is perfect if you plan to take a cruise sailing out of old San Juan, as it is literally steps away from the pier. This was highly convenient. The bar and gill attached to the hotel and casino is great. They have great drinks, but the service is slow. Its a nice place to read a book or lounge around and people watch (when you aren't in a hurry). We actually ended up spending about 3 or 4 hours there after we checked out of our room (and we didn't want to wait in line to get on our cruise). While the wait staff is on the slow side, they make up for it with unexpected attentiveness- i.e. going out of their way to light your cigarette for you. The casino was sub-par. Not very interesting and I was nearly accosted by an over-zealous security guard who wanted to check my ID. He kept saying "ID! ID!" and then when I said I was staying in the hotel and started to look through my handbag for my ID and room key, he "Puh!"-ed me away and shoo-ed me. The gaming is just not worth it at this casino. The picture of the roof top pool are pretty deceptive. Its TINY, but has a good view. As always, with a hotel, watch out for the hot tub. My party and I went up all geared up for a soak, only to find a nasty couple making out in there and god knows what else yuk- so we didn't go in. BEWARE OF DOOR STOPS OUTSIDE THE BATHROOMS! Two people in my party were injured (one VERY badly). The door stops outside of the bathrooms were placed WAY too far out from the wall. We had to put the ice bucket over it since everyone kept tripping over the stupid thing. The rooms were just Meh. We had a wonderful view of a parking garage from our window. The room was clean, but nothing special at all, just your run of the mill bland, exactly what you expect from an airport hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Also we enjoyed the bell boys, they were very friendly and gave lots of good advice.... Also if you stay in this hotel, you MUST MUST MUST eat dinner at Aquaviva (a few blocks behind the hotel). One of the best meals of my life!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for cruise departure”
Reviews.Author: TXWV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect spot for people arriving a day or two early for a cruise. The port is directly across the street! Getting there from the airport on a Friday evening took 2 hours though, when in all actuality it is only about 10 min. away. Our room was on a lower floor (4) and we had to ask the front desk to move us due to noise from the Casino. They promptly moved us to a suite on the top floor-very nice! Everyone there was very nice and the food in the hotel was below average but the service was outstanding. Old San Juan is such a cool town to explore (by foot if you want) and this hotel is at a great location to do so.

Reviews.Title: “place to stay if you want to experience old san juan”
Reviews.Author: kimspokane
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night post christmas cruise in order to see old san juan. While this hotel is not the Ritz, stayed there a week prior to our cruise and loved it, it has charm and location can't be beat. Check in: The hotel is very busy with cruise ship passengers. By the way the carnival port is directly across the street however the Royal Caribbean ship that we were on was about a 10 or 15 min cab ride away. Don't expect early check in. I assume the hotel is usually full to capacity and if many guests are not checking out until noon to get on their cruise there is really no way that I could imagine early check in. This creates a little congestion in the lobby as the people getting off the ships do so early morning. We had the bell hop keep our luggage and went to see the town, eat lunch. Upon our return we were able to check in. We were assisted by a gentleman at the front desk who was very very nice. There was a woman at the front desk who my husband said was a little rude so we just made a point to talk to the guy. The free high speed internet in the lobby and on the second floor is very fast. The "high speed internet" on our ship was so slow that each time my husband tried to log into his bank he timed out. Check out was simple. We left at 4:45 am for our flight. Our express check out receipt was already under our door and we just went downstairs. Bell hop got us a cab and we were at the airport within 25 min. Our room was on the 9th floor. Had a seperate king size bedroom, dining room, living room with pull out couch for the kids and two balconies from which we had incredible views of the fort, town and pier. Old San is Old thus the hotel is old as well. It has been updated but don't expect everything to be perfect. My guess is that it is as nice or nicer than most of the hotels in the area. It is not a resort. It is the location that made our stay a five star. We had several family members who stayed here pre cruise in regular rooms and were satisfied. We were very tired and almost did not walk up to the fort but then talked the kids into going and were not disappointed. The fort is a must see. The walk up was not bad and it was hot and muggy. We were so taken with the charm that before we knew it we were there. There are free trollys that will take you but we opted to see some of the town. The traffic is conjested and streets are narrow blue brick. I would not dream of driving there. We were only in Old San Juan for one day and so did not spend much time at the hotel. We ate lunch and dinner in Old San Juan and spent much of the afternoon walking around the fort and town. At night the town comes alive and has an exciting feel. Of course we fell asleep early but the kids had fun watching all the action from the balconies. We saw the pool and work out area. Neither were crowded but we did not use. They both looked clean and nice. Of all the ports we visited on our cruise we were most impressed with the history and culture of Old San Juan. We were there on sunday, Dec. 30. Many of the people in town were not tourists, just residents enjoying thier day off. I would highly recommend for one or two nights stay. If staying any longer I would recommend an incredible resort experience such as we had at the Ritz Carlton in Isle Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Pre- or Post-Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: mizlori
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 11/30 the night before our Princess cruise departed. Took taxi from airport to hotel. Charge for # of bags you have, so don't count your carry-on when you get asked how many bags you have! We had 3 checked bags so it was $21.50 to the hotel for 2 of us. Room was ready at 3 so we had to wait about 1/2 hour since we arrived at 2:30. Found out we had gotten corner room suite on the 4th floor. Though it faced the rear of the building with the balcony, the side gave us a view of the water and our ship in the morning! Rooftop pool and hot tub nice, but pool was cold and hot tub wasn't hot enough. Location great though. Bed was comfortable, sitting area nice, and bathroom clean. Did not eat here. Had the best mojito ever at Tio Danny's (next to Garibaldi restaurant on Fortaleza) and even went back for more before we left. Also ate at Aguaviva which was good. Sheraton location was absolutely perfect. We checked out at noon and walked to the pier to board our ship. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: audaciousred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton for a few days before our cruise. It's in a good place to explore Old San Juan. There is a free trolley that departs either across from the hotel at Pier 2 or a few blocks down. The concierge was very helpful. Our favorite restaurant is located on Calle Sol - El Jibarito. The pool was fine - didn't use the hot tub - wasn't hot and smelled of high levels of chlorine. The workout room was sufficient - got crowded later in the morning. The rooms were clean, the beds comfortable and we had a great view of the pier. The only drawback was the elevator traffic jam on Saturday morning. I would recommend this for a short pre or post cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in historic site”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, I was a bit hesitant in booking my stay here. However, I have only one day to explore and Old San Juan and this hotel seems to be the best place to stay for one night. After a $20 cab drive from the airport to the hotel, seeing the long cab line to get into the hotel front entrance, I decided to get off and take the 10 meters walk to premises entrance instead. I was offered to take my suitcase which I declined. As reported, the lobby entrance was not large and was being occupied by flowing baggages on one side of the door. Thankfully, there was not a line at the check-in desk. My SPG status was quickly recognized and I was given an upgrade to one of the suites on the 6th floor, a voucher for breakfast at the restaurant as there was no executive lounge and two other vouchers for drinks and chips at the casinos. As reported one of the elevator seems to have a mind of its own and quite slow. My ride to the 6th floor seems to be an exercise of leisurely watching the numbers increasing and everyone who got off seems to sigh in relief. Suite 604 living room has no windows except for the lone double door that opens up to the tiny balcony facing the cruise ships docks. The lack of windows means that there are not enough daylight and the living room is a bit darker than I would have liked. Still the room is nicely furnished with a business desk a nice sofa and twins ottoman. There are two small bottle of Spanish red and white wine for sale on the lamp desk. The bedroom is a large room with a king bed, the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper which is one of my favorite bed. A drawer-desk with a 32" TV on top and an arm chair with ottoman wrapped up the furniture in the room. A closet with the usual ironing board and mini-safe are provided. A lone window looked out into the concrete lobby roof is better left shut and provides minimal daylight. The two bed lamps provided more than enough lights to compensate for daylights. This room has adequate noise isolation for me but maybe because it is away from the streets and my neighbor is the quiet type. The bathroom was a large room by Sheraton standard. The issue with it is that it feels a bit empty as there are not enough furniture in the room. The bathtub also tends to leak water to the floor every time that I take a shower. I also have issue with getting enough hot water, in fact both of my showers were border of the cold side. The breakfast buffet was really good with lots of choices. It was too hot for me to have the breakfast out in the terrace so I stay inside. The service was average. Some people may dislike the location of the Sheraton due to its proximity to the docks but I find it very refreshing. Its downside is when the cruise ships rolled in, the traffic jam can be a killer if you want to get in or out of Old San Juan. The Sheraton is right in the middle of the action: restaurants and attractions are just blocks in all directions. If you want to explore Old San Juan, this is the perfect place to be in. If you can deal with the cruise ship crowds, the elevator and some lacks of the windows, the Sheraton can't be beat to explore Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: xdeleon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan from 10/6 until 10/9. My original destination had been the Sheraton in Humacao, but some unexpected difficulties with my travel plans ("we're sorry sir, but your drivers license has expired, we cannot rent you a car") left me stranded in San Juan. The desk managers at the two sheratons were kind enough to switch my reservation from one hotel to the other, and honor the first hotel's rate, which was considerably lower ($160 a night vs the $300+ a night for the same level suite at the Old San Juan location), while keeping me in the same level of suite. The hotel in general, and the suite itself was lovely. Quite comfortable and reasonably well-appointed. The hotel's Tuscan restaurant however, left much to be desired. The food was good, but the prices were ridiculous and the service was horrible. (Long wait, no offer to refill drinks, mumbled and didn't speak loud enough. And this with only three other tables used in the whole restaurant) The room service food was good, but again, quite overpriced. And the room featured bottles of water conveniently located next to the ice bucket... with tags noting that the room would be billed $4 per bottle opened. (There were also a couple of bottles of wine with similar notes, but that at least I can understand). And while there is free wireless in the lobby and in a couple of the public areas, the rooms only offer a wired internet connection which cost $10 or $12 a night, I forget which. The hotel staff were polite, friendly, and cheerful, the casino was small but enjoyable if not profitable, and of course, Old San Juan is beautiful and the Sheraton pops you right in the middle of it, which is very convenient. Old San Juan is a beautiful place, but I'm not sure I'd stay at the Sheraton again... especially at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Monster-Dawg
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, the location very convenient. The service was fantastic! The room service delivery guy was one of the friendliest people and the room service pizza - What a pleasant surprise. It was GREAT! I would stay here again and again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque view”
Reviews.Author: adatrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4-day weekend and had a really nice time. The lobby, casino and waterfront area can be very crowded at times. They didnâ€™t have early check in available but they can hold your luggage and had an area where you can freshen up. Once we checked in, we were upgraded to a suite with a picturesque view of the harbor and cruise ships. The suite had two rooms with a small balcony. The living room had a sofa, chairs and a TV. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool area was small but had a great view of the surrounding areas. The Sheraton San Juan Hotel is very close to everything with many yummy restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is beautiful and convenient”
Reviews.Author: futbolchic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and so convenient to the Old San Juan nightlife. The workout room and pool were open and easy to access. Hard Rock, Senor Frogs are within walking distance. Travel to the Bacardi plant was across the street, don't forget to check out the Don Q museum and free drinks available down the block. Also, the travel center located across from where the ships port has free drinks in the afternoon while open--of course we found out on the last day. I would definitely stay at this hotel if staying in the Old San Juan district--the staff was very friendly and attentive to our every need.

Reviews.Title: “I Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat concerned about staying at this hotel because of a few negative comments on this website. I stayed 2 nights and was pleased with this hotel. I got into a room even though I presented myself to the front desk at 10:30 a.m. As an SPG Platinum member, I was upgraded to a suite. There is a casino in the hotel, pool on the roof, and dining room/bar with outside balcony overlooking the bay and cruise ships. The hotel is across the street from all the cruise ship piers. Behind the hotel are numerous restaurants and bars. The room was quiet, and the decor was typical Sheraton. I have probably stayed at 30 different Sheraton hotels, so I know. I understand the upgrades were done 3 years ago when the hotel was converted from a Wyndham. Staff all friendly. Old San Juan is charming. I like this hotel and will certainly choose it again when staying in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for Price”
Reviews.Author: Ashleezmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here pre-cruise for one night and post-cruise one night. We had a total of 2 rooms. We paid $145.00 a night & taxes per room. After flying from LA on the redeye we arrived at the hotel on Saturday morning at 10:30 am and were pleasantly surprised that our rooms were ready. Very nice location to our cruise ship (right across the street and to all other places in Old San Juan. We walked everywhere!! Our room was on the 4th floor with a view of the pier. Very clean and beds were SO comfortable. We had room service for breakfast and the food was excellent and reasonably priced compared to LA. We checked out the first night at noon to walk over to the ship, and the elevators were a nightmare. Everyone has the same idea so we finally had to take an elevator up just to come down. Post cruise our rooms were not ready when we checked in at 11:00 am, but the hotel took our luggage and even loaned us beach towels to go to the beach. When we returned at 4:30 we picked up our keys at the front desk and grabbed the luggage. No problem. The hotel & casino were very busy as there were 3 cruise ships in port, but the service was still excellent. Nice hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Hidden”
Reviews.Author: harrieth
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton because it was one of the choices for our niece's "destination" wedding. Good: rooms very clean, good bedding, good service. Bad: lobby was very shabby, perhaps due to the many casino guests who were not staying at the hotel - lobby furniture stained and decidedly long in the tooth. A stark contrast between the rooms and lobby! Hidden: when we received our bill we had added costs for "porterage" even though it was so busy we had to carry our own luggage up to the room and "hotel services" even though we didn't use any! There are no refrigerators in the rooms and no business center. When I inquired about these and many other additional "fees," I was informed that because we were part of a group, they were added automatically. I found out that the "group" was the guests who had come for the wedding and received the "special rate." If we had NOT registered as wedding guests and simply come at the regular rate or secured an even better rate on a service like Priceline or Hotline, we would have stayed for less money. Meal prices do not make much sense. Breakfast is decidedly more costly than lunch and many dinner items - and there is nowhere that opens before 9 a.m. close by where breakfast may be obtained even though there are other options for lunch and dinner. I would not stay here again without inquiring about ALL fees and getting the rate of what that did or did not include in writing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lawmin
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton is very centrally located. Right next to various eateries (Aquaviva on Calle Fortalezza is a definite try) and the ports for the cruise ships which is a nice view. It's also next to some great walks next to the fort. The Sheraton itself is a waste of money if you're paying more than $140 which is what we paid on Hotwire. If you're paying more thant $190, try staying at the Howard Johnson which is also centrally located but around $130 for a smaller, windowless room. The Sheraton was such a disappointment. The rooms are bare, the bathrooms are sparse, and the windows are small. There was no 'Sheraton' bed which is one of the best parts of a Sheraton. The bathrooms had no shower cap, or sewing kit, or any of those little perks. The reception looked tired as did the rooms. The swimming pool is small but on the 9th floor so has great views. Definitely NOT worth the $245 plus rate that they had on all the other websites.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here for ANY Reason”
Reviews.Author: SJ*HL*S
Reviews.Content: We were only supposed to have a short layover in San Juan between the BVI and home but after our flight was cancelled, we were stuck for the night so we decided to stay at a nice hotel and enjoy San Juan....wrong hotel for that! We requested a non-smoking, "best available" room via [--]. Upon check-in, we were taken to a room that absolutely stank of cigarette smoke as soon as we opened the door. We thought, ok, maybe this is all they had. Then, I look up and notice the light fixture had no cover-just a bulb and from there, I see the mold on the walls and ceiling! No wonder the room smelled so bad. We called the front desk and were taken to a much better, larger, non-smoking room, which is what we booked in the first place! Before dinner, I decided to iron a white skirt with the iron/ironing board provided...another mistake! As soon as I touched the iron to my skirt, thick black goo leaked out onto it. After THREE calls to housekeeping, someone finally answered promising to come to our room in 5 minutes...45 minutes later, we gave up and went to dinner. Again, eating dinner at the hotel was a big mistake, my husband's fish was inedible and my calamari could easily have come from the freezer isle at anybody's local discount grocier! As if our short stay hadn't already been horrible enough, when it was time to check out, they tried to charge us for the room (which we had booked and paid for through [--]). We asked for a taxi to the airport-which we had a voucher for-and they tried to make us pay for a transfer to the airport instead! They only decent part of our stay was the Housekeeping Manager, who, after complaining about the iron and lack of service the night before, took my skirt and promised to send it back to me after it had been cleaned. I doubted it would happen, but it was ruined at it was, anyway. You wouldn't believe my surprise when it actually arrived a week later, good as new-the only good part of the experience, which actually shouldn't have been necessary anyway. Oh, and by the way, a month later when the AMEX bill arrived, they had charged our card for the night! We weren't surprised, but at least AMEX took care of it for us. The best advice I have, just don't stay here...NO MATTER WHAT.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: soberlady
Reviews.Content: The property was in a good location, we had rented a car with a GPS that could not find the hotel because in the GPS the street is spelled one way and on the hotel information it was spelled another. We thought we had reserved a room with a view, called ahead and were assured that the room had a view... well it was a view of another room. The hotel is triangular and the inside rooms face each other... so no view of the city. The bed was supposedly a sweet sleeper, which are usually wonderful, this one was hard as a rock, when I asked about some padding, I was mocked! But eventually got a couple extra blankets to pad it myself. The people at the desk were so curt, it was bordering rude. I was amazed, we have stayed at Sheraton Hotels all over the place and have never been anything but more than satisfied. The room itself, was very clean as was the entire hotel, but that is all that was good.

Reviews.Title: “Location was good”
Reviews.Author: gchelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton 3 nights. I wanted to be close to shopping and we were. There was not a lot of extras at this hotel, but for $109 a night through Hotwire compared to $280 a night, it worked. The room was clean, we did'nt really have a view of anything, but that was not a big deal for us. The hotel food was expensive you would be better off walking around which we did and we found alot of places to eat nearby. The pool was small, but we did find 2 beaches nearby. We were in walking distance of many retail stores and had the chance to see the cruise ships dock which was nice. We took the trolley which was free around Old San Juan and to the El Morro Fort. We took a taxi to the beach and discovered it would be better to rent a car so that we could go back and forth when we wanted. The parking near the hotel was scarce but at least one night we were able to find a spot on the street. The other night we parked for $12.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Chain With No Local Feel”
Reviews.Author: SN1752
Reviews.Content: I spent the 1st two days of an 8-day circumnavigation of Puerto Rico at the Sheraton. It is a standard chain hotel with no bells or whistles. It is geared specifically for cruise ship travelers who will only spend 1 or 2 nights there. The restaurant offers a pale imitation of local food so as not to offend the lame palates of the cruise people. It is unique that its location offers you a view of the Castille San Cristobal instead of the overly touristy El Morro. It's location so close to the restaurant area of Calles Fortaleza, Recinto Sur & Tetuan allows one to get out & enjoy the variety of food that the country has to offer. The casino is too small & don't expect the common "comps" that you receive at other hotel/casino locations. All in all, a decent place to stay when you need to overnight before or after a cruise or flight but a shameful place to stay if you have more than 48 hours in the country -- there is much more to see in the country than Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “OK.. I guess, nothing special, but nothing bad.”
Reviews.Author: adamz11202
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Old San Juan has good and bad aspects. The view is good... if you have a waterfront room. Our room was facing a parking lot. Oh well. The casino is large and the bartenders, bellmen, and Desk people are very nice. The valet parking was also nice. The hotel is very close to el morro and all of the restaurants downtown. It is also close to the ferry. It is not too far away from anything, and it is easy to get to from the airport.The concierge was helpful in getting me a tee time. And the pool on the roof had a nice view of the cruise ship docks. We didnt eat in the hotel, so i cant say whether the food was good or not. The room was nice and clean, and newly renevated. The bed was clean and it was very comfy as well.For the price however, you could stay at another hotel and save your money on duty free, restaurants or casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, the Bellmen were especially helpful”
Reviews.Author: superdrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed for free with starwood points but still got upgraded to the two room suite! Excellent property with beautiful ocean views. The bellmen were extra helpful with recommending places to eat etc. Join the Casino Players Club to park for free right next to the hotel and skip the $18/day valet charge. $5/pp per night tax (It is presented as a San Juan Occupancy tax, but I'm not sure if that is the case or not). Great location, as we did this pre and post cruise and were able to walk right to the port to embark and to the hotel after debarking. Having Hertz right there to get to and from the airport in a rental car was nice except for picking up there. The car wasn't ready and the attendent was unbelievably rude. The hotel staff on the other hand, did nothing short of spectacular. They even allowed me to check in early at 10 am after are cruise. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toflyer
Reviews.Content: Had a two night stay at the Sheraton San Juan. Wonderful looking Hotel from the outside, nice little patio in the front for drinks and dinner. the Hotel Room had a great view of the Harbour, very clean room, no complaints. Room Service was prompt and hotel service was great. I'm an SPG Platinum member, this is definitely one of the better Sheraton's I've stayed at, enjoyed the Small yet great Casino downstairs with everything but a poker table.

Reviews.Title: “Credit card statement”
Reviews.Author: TICKED-OFF-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sheraton two nights back in June 2006 prior to sailing on Royal Caribbean. Booked all reservations through RCCL representitive, including hotel stay. Checked in, had a great room and location, then checked out with no problems....at least I thought. Fast forward to today...Reviewed my January Credit Card Statement and the hotel charged by CC over three hundered dollars in early January, I was not in San Juan, I was home in the states, at work, after the holidays. Fraud comes to mine by the hotel. As mentioned earlier, I booked my vacation through RCCL, was provided a voucher for my stay at the hotel, and had to provide a CC number upon checking in for potential incidential services. Checked out of hotel, requested to verfiy I had no charges placed against my account, was told there was NOT a balance due and that the account had been settled with RCCL. Did the standard notification with CC company as a unauthorized tranaction. Moral of the story, I also reviewed this site prior to booking and had read others complaining about how the hotel billed their CC after the fact. If you stayed at the Sheraton in Old San Juan in the past or plan on staying there in the future, watch your CC statement, as their management and staff appear not to have the same integrity as their sites in the states. Buyer beware...Story to continue!!!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Puerto Rico-great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshireFarmgal
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to Puerto Rico and so I picked the Sheraton for it's location and aminaties at the hotel. I was happy with my choice. We were given a suite room when a bay view room was not available at check-in, but from my (standing) balcony I could see the cruise ships docked also. It was a plus to have the cruise ship docks across the wide BLVD from the hotel, made interesting viewing-also walking along boardwalk area was beautiful. Hotel casino was fun for a few slot machine games and low betting on the tables made it easy for non-gamblers to try their luck! (like us) Hotel lounge was nice-had a few late evening snack items-shrimp cocktail and nachios-both tastsy and local bottle beer very good too! Out front on the patio bar area there was a small latin band playing one night and that was a good time. The Ocean Park public beach was nice and only cost us $3.20 cents to drive-in and park the car. Safe and clean park. Beautiful views and waves!! Valet service at the hotel was a good deal at $18 per day-considering that Old San Juan's parking is pretty crowded on the side streets-etc. We shall return next year for a mini break-and most likely stay at the Sheraton again! Front desk staff very friendly and helpful also! Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: TXtravlr
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a trip to San Juan, Puerto Rico. I chose to stay at the Sheraton Old San Juan because all of the reviews on this site were very good. I had originally thought to stay to the east along the coast, but am so glad now that I stayed here. Not to mention so many of the reviews for the other Sheraton properties on the coast were terrible. First of all, the location is perfect if you want to truly explore all of Puerto Rico since it is in a very central location and easily accessible to all freeways and tollways. You can also easily walk to both forts from this central location. Also, I went down by myself for a four day weekend so I wanted to feel safe wherever I stayed. Each night, I felt completely safe leaving the hotel and walking only a few streets over to where all of the restaurants and nightclubs are. All you do is walk out by the valet, turn right, walk up some steps and you are in restaurant central! All very good restaurants too. As for the restaurant at the hotel, I did make one visit there on my last day for a late lunch. The menu was not impressive but I asked my waiter if they had crab cakes and when he said yes, he readily agreed to make me a crab cake sandwich even though crab cakes were not even on the menu. It was very good! I'm not a gambler at all, but if you like casinos then this is definitely the place for you too! Each night, I walked right by it but on the last night I walked in and it reminded me of what you find on a cruise ship -- maybe even better. There must have been several hundred slot machines, several black jack tables and roulette tables. The place was packed! You won't hear the noise at all though from your room. The rooms are exactly what I had hoped for. I stay at W properties quite a bit as a business traveler and this was a better room than most W properties. Plus, I used my hotel points for the entire stay. Water was hot, nice shower head with the new rounded shower curtain rods, lots of counter space in the bathroom, very comfy beds, nice flat screen tv and plenty of room to move around. I didn't bring my laptop but I believe they have free wireless in the lobby and a charge to use it from your room. Everybody was very pleasant and courteous at the hotel. I valeted my car each evening and I believe the cost was about $18/night. If you are going on a cruise and you want to stay somewhere for a night or two before or after your cruise, I would definitely recommend this hotel too. It is just off of Pier 3. If driving from the airport, take 26 West to Old San Juan and then veer left where it says Convention District but stay in the right lane. The hotel is a couple of miles down on the right. You'll see the port to your left and possibly some cruise ships. There is a lot of construction going on all over San Juan right now and this is the best, fastest way to get to the hotel. There is also some construction going on at the hotel but I did not notice it -- I believe they are working on the rooftop terrace and pool but I chose to go to beaches instead of the pool so I don't know what they were doing. All in all, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All around good experience for PR”
Reviews.Author: pwoconnor
Reviews.Content: The first thing anyone who travels to Puerto Rico must know is that the basic us "star rating of hotels" does not really apply. In other words, a four star hotel in puerto rico is not equivalent to a four star hotel in the mainland US. So this hotel may be billed as a 3.5 or four star but is not., it was a boderline three which is what we expected. That being said, it was a good experience. The room was cleaned fairly well and the staff were friendly and fairly attentive by caribbean standards. Room service was also decent but pricey. The location was nice as it is situated at the edge of old san juan just a short walk from major shoping/dinning streets such as san francisco. So a safe bet, I would say but expect to pay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimbo66
Reviews.Content: we stayed pre cruise in sept,and worried about the hotel reviews since there was so many negative reviews.. but to our surprise the hotel staff and room was great.. we stayed top floor with a view of the pier and the fort... i would visit the hotel on my next stay, it is the best location in town. we walked all over old sanjuan.. great hotel thanxs sheraton.....

Reviews.Title: “The room was great, so was the location!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-n-Buppie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after a carnival cruise. The location of the hotel to the port was THE BEST! I literally walked off the ship, out of the port, down and across the street to the lobby of the hotel. My luggage was 66lbs and the weather was hot and humid! The location was great! The room was great spacious and comfotable. I stayed in a smaller hotel before my cruise, and I could literaly fit my first hotel room, bathroom included, in the the bathroom of the Sheraton. The staff was nice and the location of the hotel in Old San Juan was perfect. Everything was in walking distance (food, scenery, shops etc). I would reccomend staying here if you are going on a cruise or just visiting San Juan. Also, I would reccomend eating in a resturant that is close by. I am not sure of the name, but it is on the same main street as the Sheraton (to the left, facing the water), the next block after the coldstone creamery (yum). They have tables outside and a small eating area inside. The food and service are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: janchip
Reviews.Content: I had read recommendations in Cruise Critic, and also the reviews on this site. The reviews were mixed and had to say had us a bit worried about our 3 day stay before we went on a cruise. We arrived Fri and stayed till Sun afternoon! We had a great time! The personnel at the hotel were great and suggested several different restaurants for us to get the feel of the country. Our room was on the 8th floor. I recommend that you join Starwood after booking a room there, as were put on a member No Smoking floor. We had requested a no smoking room and partial harbor view! We had a full harbor view-the view was fabulous. We also had an elevator, never a long wait, in fact most of the time we were the only people in them. We had the continental breakfast (buffet) which was $12., and if you wanted the full breakfast $21.95, which included hot meats, eggs, custom omelets, etc. Our room was very clean and so was our large bathroom. The only little part of a downside, the room had a slightly musty smell, and an edge of the ceiling at the corner plaster had come down by french doors that opened to the small balcony! The hotel itself is great, and what a location! We walked all evening on Friday and never was far from the hotel. We felt very safe. On Saturday, we walked to the toursit office, and took the free trolley to Old San Juan city, and then to Fort Morro. We had a very enjoyable time. Our Travel agent got the room about 5 months in advance for $135/night, for a partial harbor view! We feel that was truely a bargain. We had friends staying in the Caribe Hilton, they said they had a great room, but were close to nothing, and constantly had to take a cab to get anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: nurseiv
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel in July 2006. The perfect sleeper beds are fabulous. Staff was very helpful. The rooftop pool and jacuzzi were great and not crowded. You can take spectacular pictures from the roof. Great location in the heart of old san juan. Everything within walking distance. Variety of restaurants was good. Avoid buffet breakfast as it is $18.00 per person. Expensive for families. Rooms were very clean and the shower had the best water pressure of anywhere I have stayed in the world. Take the ferry boat to Catano for 50 cents and go for the free Bacardi Factory tour. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: j2000princess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan before departing on a 7 night cruise. My family arrived in San Juan a day before myself. Upon check in they were told that the room with two double beds and cot we had reserved would not be available. However, because of this, the hotel automatically gave us a complimentary upgrade to a two bedroom suite! When I checked in the next day I was at first a bit disappointed because of the close proximity of the casino to the lobby. I was afraid that it would be too noisy and too smokey, but I was happily wrong. Our suite on the fourth floor was not affected at all by the noise of the casino. The location of the hotel is great for those wishing to wander around Old San Juan. As soon as we walked out the hotel we were in the shopping and restaurant district of OSJ! We felt safe during our whole stay. For those people who wrote earlier that they were disappointed in not having a view from your room, you must remember that this is a city hotel- not every room has a view of the water. And even if you did have a view of the water, its full of cruise ships and barges- it is a working port afterall!! One of the two cruise ports in OSJ is right across the street from the hotel. Unfortunately, our cruise line was docked at the other port, but a short cab ride (which was arranged by the helpful hotel staff) was all it took to get from the hotel to the ship. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in San Juan prior to a cruise because of its great staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with service”
Reviews.Author: Tayo55
Reviews.Content: I just want to share my opinion of the stay during my vacation this year. I have no complaints about the hotel. The hotel was very clean, comfortable and staff was very efficient. We wanted 2 double beds and a microwave oven and we got what we wanted. My daughters loved it. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendly staff, great food!”
Reviews.Author: LilianeZ
Reviews.Content: In response to the many letters/reviews with regards to the Sheraton Old San Juan Hotel and Casino...I must say that we had a great time! The staff were both very accommodating, and friendly. We too stayed at the hotel for two nights (July 28th, 29th 2006) and yes, there was a Wedding reception going on, but it made the stay a little more "interesting". Let's face it, most of us have been married and had our receptions at hotels, so being in a hotel at the same time as a reception can be a little "loud" and "crowded" which is understandable. The rooms were excellent, clean, comfortable (especially the beds with the down filled comforters and such!). We would definitely stay at the Sheraton Old San Juan Hotel and Casino again in the future!. If it is "perfection" you are looking for,,,you may as well keep looking, because you can stay at a 5 star hotel and still run into problems of some sort. It's all in the way you allow yourself to be affected by inconviences. Take it from us,,,we have been thru the worst, and in the end, we say: "Oh well, it could always be worse!!"

Reviews.Title: “Music beat from 11 p.m. to 1 a.m.”
Reviews.Author: mothermade
Reviews.Content: What we thought would be a great location turned out to be horrible. First, it was busy. Lots of people and not enough elevators to move them. Second, we were woken by a wedding reception DJ and his music at 11 p.m. on the second floor; we were on the fourth floor. When we called the desk to ask about the music, they just told us it would be ending at 1 a.m.! We have small children who need sleep, as well as parents! Lastly, we parked our rental car with the valet and had fog light covers stolen. Tip: Don't give the parking valet your keys that state the car is a rental. Strangely the rental company only looked for the fog light covers--pieces of plastic that plug into where fog lights would be. No one walked around the car to check other things about its appearance. We tried to consult the hotel about the missing covers, but were told that the valet company is separate from the hotel. A customer service rep emailed us that she would have the manager contact us when he returned from a trip. We have never heard from them since that email. I have family in PR and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE IN OLD SAN JUAN”
Reviews.Author: NWTFTOM
Reviews.Content: What started out to be 2 relaxing days in San Juan prior to a 7 day cruise, turned out to be a complete nightmare at the Sheraton Old San Juan. My wife and I arrived on a Friday for a 2 night stay with another couple prior to departing for our cruise. Since our flight arrived first, we went on to the hotel ahead of our friends. When we arrived at the Sheraton Old San Juan, our bags were unloaded and brought into the hotel lobby. We checked in, and were told to go on to our room and that the luggage would follow shortly behind us. Once into the room we noticed that we were looking into a parking garage. This was disappointing, but it was what it was. Forty minutes later, our luggage had not yet arrived, so I called the Bell Desk to inquire. I was informed that our luggage was on its way, and would arrive shortly. When I asked about changing rooms in order to get a better view, I was transfered over to the front desk. The Asst. Manager informed me that since I had requested a room with two beds, that he could not make any changes. When I asked him why, he told me that all rooms with two beds face into the parking structure, and therefore he could not change it.
