I wondered who would design a hotel where all the rooms with two beds faced into a parking structure and only rooms with one bed had a view, but I told him we would keep the room that we were in. Thirty-five minutes later when my luggage had still not arrived, I went down to the lobby to find my bags. My luggage was still in the same spot as they had dropped it an hour and fifteen minutes earlier. Needless to say, I carried my five pieces of luggage to the elevator myself and took it to my room. Later that evening, I was awaken by the barking of a dog. If the dog were outside, I would have been more accepting of the situation, but the dog was actually inside the hotel. When I called to complain, I was told that the Sheraton Hotel was a pet friendly chain and that nothing could be done since the owner was not in their room. The dog continued to bark until 2:10 a.m. I can only guess that the owners decided to return to their room at that time and the dog then stopped barking. The next day, we went into Old San Juan at around 9:00 a.m. to spend the day. We returned at 3:00 p.m. to find that our room had still not been made up. When I called the front desk to ask about my room, I was told that due to the cruises there is such a large turn-over of guests on the weekends, that the rooms occupied by guests that are staying are not cleaned until all other rooms are done. So basically, since I was paying for two nights, I was getting less service than if I had stayed only one night. That evening, we went upstairs to the pool and hot tub. When we arrived, we noticed that the pool had algae in it and that the hot tub was actually cold. I called the front desk and was told that the hot tub was broken and that the pool would be cleaned the next day because there was nobody available that evening to clean it. Finally, the last day at the Sheraton Old San Juan. We got packed and headed for the elevator with our luggage. We waited anxiously by the elevator dreaming of getting on the cruise ship. We waited and waited and waited and waited. Seems that one of the elevators was broken and everytime the working elevator would stop, it was full already. After the first hour of waiting, I called the front desk to ask for help. I was told that my only option was to carry our luggage down from the sixth floor. Since there was four of us, and we had 10 pieces of luggage, that was not an option. So again, we waited and waited and waited. Then, 40 minutes later, a hotel maintenance man came walking down the hallway. I stopped him and asked if there was some sort of employee elevator on the floor. He said that there was, so I gave him $20.00 to allow us to use that elevator to get down. He agreed, and after 2 hours and $20.00 we were finally checked out of the Sheraton Old San Juan. Now, I want you to know that I am a member of the Sheraton Hotel / Starwood Properties frequent guest program and I not only complained to management at the Sheraton Old San Juan, but also to their corporate guest services. I have stayed at other Sheraton Hotels and have had wonderful experiences. This stay took place in February 2006, and as of yet, I have gotten no response from anyone. Also, I think it is pertinent to know that I paid $325.00 per night for this stay. For that kind of money, I have come to expect so much more that what I recieved.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but Terrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: CarribeanWanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for twice for business trips. I have to say that in terms that the hotel is convenient for those doing the cruise or those who want to be in Old San Juan. Having said that, I had terrible experience with this hotel. First, the front desk was not helpful at all. When I checked in, the room was not available. What made it worst was that the lady at the front desk told me to come back at a certain time, but when I did, the room was not yet ready. Also, you will need to follow up on everything. As an example, I had requested for laundry pick up at 6 AM, and left the hotel to stroll around the vicinity. When I came back at 9:30 AM, the laundry was not picked up, and apparently the front desk forgot to tell housekeeping. Another problem is that there is always an error in my bill e.g. breakfast charge even if I used a voucher. After a while, I was already beginning to think that the hotel is doing it on purpose. In my second stay here, after being given a room, I immediately went back to the front desk and returned the room. The room provided was not only dingy, there was this horrible smell. Lastly, for my stays, my starwood points were not credited correctly. It took me several weeks before the hotel could apply the correct points. Do yourself a favor... avoid this hotel. Your money is better spent somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: jb812
Reviews.Content: Having read a lot of bad reviews I was some what concerned about staying at the Sheraton Old San Juan. However this turned out to be a great hotel, the staff could not have been more kind and helpful and the room I had was very clean and in good repair. The facilities in the hotel are of a high standard except the pool which was a bit small and crowded at times. I would certainly recommend the location as well with the old town all within walking distance and the cruise ships right outside. I spoke to the manager by e-mail about the bad reviews before staying and they did admit there had been problems, and they ensured me they had worked hard to resolve the problems and that certainly was the case.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - enjoyed Sheraton OSJ”
Reviews.Author: Cajuche
Reviews.Content: I felt I had to post this review of the Sheraton OSJ after reading some of the negative ones; were we staying in the same hotel? We were very pleased with the place and would definitely stay there again. It was spotless, the staff is very friendly and the location is great. The one thing that I would warn folks about is the fact that not all cruise ships dock across the street (which is partly why we chose this hotel in the first place). Some Royal Caribbean cruises dock at the Pan America pier, which is a $15 taxi ride away. So check your cruise documents. All in all, don't let the other reviews scare you (we almost did); try it you'll like it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Unbearably noisy, clean towels missing, wildly erratic cleaning times, a receptionist lied to me repeatedly about the origin of the noise, and the manager was rude. Freezing A/C that cannot be switched off, and windows are sealed and cannot be opened. Quality/price: utterly unacceptable. Try some other hotel, even of much lower category.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Day Trips”
Reviews.Author: pixiez
Reviews.Content: Had a nice suite with a view of the habor. Staff was not that helpful, but location was great for day trips. Close to bus terminal for trips to Isle Verde and other beach areas. Also, right across the street from the Ferry ($1) to the Barcardi Rum Distillery. No frills hotel, but it was a good base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Subpar Experience.”
Reviews.Author: nlamb
Reviews.Content: We got off the Golden Princess cruise ship and walked right across the street to check in at the Sheraton. If you're staying a night here before or after a cruise, it's an excellent location. There are two cruise ships docks directly across the street, but some of the docks are on the other side of the harbor, so you might want to check on that. This hotel is also in an excellent location for touring Old San Juan, with it's brick streets, brightly painted buildings, churches, and forts. We tried to check in around noon and the lobby was a zoo. There was luggage piled all around and people everywhere, coming off the ships and checking out to get on the ships. We were told to come back around 3 and they took our luggage for us. We felt a little uneasy because we had to leave our luggage piled up in the lobby until they put it away. Spent the afternoon walking around Old San Juan and were able to check in when we came back. The elevators are a little scary, they're old and look like they need replaced. The hallways are somewhat dark but our room was beautiful. However, we had a partial harbor view reserved and got a view of the parking garage. There is a pool on the ninth floor with a great view of the harbor and the cruise ships. However, the pool is VERY small and has little seating area. The restaurant downstairs serves Puerto Rican food, however it is quite expensive. It also serves a breakfast buffet (decent) and lunch. I would definitely recommend this hotel for cruise ship passengers and anyone wanting to be in the heart of Old San Juan. However, don't try to check in until later afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great experience. Old San Juan is a great place to stay and go out and eat and drink. The Sheraton was clean, smelled nice and the beds were great. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Basic no frills, good area for a pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan for 1 night pre-cruise. I did read some bad reviews, but our stay was great. At the time of check in the lobby was packed. Many pre-cruise people checking in and out. After a short wait in line we are checked in. I reserved 2 rooms and we were given the room types we requested, they even send a cot up for free in one of the rooms. The only small problem (if you even want to call it a problem) was there are only 2 elevators and you may have to wait a few minutes sometimes. The rooms are basic, just how they look on-line. The rooms were very clean. This hotel is prefect for a (Carnival) pre/post cruise stay. We wera able to walk to the pier from the hotel. If you don't want to walk the 1 block there are taxi cabs available. The pool is small. It is located on the top floor, great views of the city and the Carnival destiny.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ltowngirl
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews on here had me nervous, but the hotel is fine. No need to worry if you are considering it. We stayed Feb 14-17, 2006. The lobby is small but clean and elegant. The rooms themselves are clean, new and standard Sheraton. We arrived around 11pm on the 14th, so they checked my husband and I into a room with two beds, with the promise that we'd be moved the next day. The room we were moved to the next day was exactly the same as the first room except it had the requested King size bed, and this time we had a view of the Ferry docks rather than the parking lot. Both rooms were on the 5th floor, and we had no noise issues. This hotel is fine if you want to be in Old San Juan, but don't stay here expecting amenities and things to do. As others have noted the pool is not that big or enticing- the view from the 9th floor is nice in the evenings and a good spot if you want to read and relax for an hour or two. I used the gym on one occasion- also on the 9th floor. It's nothing fancy but there are some treadmills, ellipticals, weights etc. It does it's jobs. My biggest complaint about this hotel is lack of room service. The kitchen closes at 11pm. Our flight was delayed from NYC and we had planned to be in San Juan by 730, but arrived at 1030 instead and were famished. By the time we called room service, we were told it was closed and when we asked the front desk for any place we could order from, they had no numbers for us. We were both tired, and unwilling to go out at that time for food so we fell asleep hungry. This struck me as weird, that there is nothing available after 11pm. I did order room service on another occasion. A burger for 15$. With tax it was 17$ I think (there is never tax in restaurants in PR) and ontop of that they add a 3$ gratuity. I was suprised when the delivery guy waited for me to tip him, when theyd already added the 3$?? We also had a drink at the bar on the ground floor Fogato- the drinks are decent. And we were on our way to dinner, but they serve complimentary snacks there. We had breakfast included in our room price. Beware of something about this- they have an array of breakfast laid out, and no one really tells you anything. They just seat you down and pour coffee. It's only once the bill arrives that you're told to pay extra. Apparently complimentary breakfast only covers the cereal and fruit. I had cereal and a small portion of eggs one morning, for which they charged me $8 extra. I just wish they'd told me earlier, as I wouldn't have minded not having the cold eggs anyhow. Talking amongst some of the other people eating breakfast everyone expressed suprise when the bills were presented. A perk that we were unaware of before is that there is free wireless internet in all the public spots, so bring your laptop and you can use free internet in the lobby/Fogato. It's hard/expensive finding internet in Old San Juan otherwise. I rated this stay a 4 because it was a comfortable stay. Nothing extra-ordinary, but nothing much to complain about either. The pics are of the room they moved us to.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, clean, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: DeborahVJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan the night before a cruise departure. The room was booked by our travel agent, through Royal Caribbean. The room was very clean and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. No refrigerator. No complaints. There was a very small casino in the hotel and a small, expensive restaurant. Just behind the hotel, there are less expensive places to eat. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away. In fact, skip San Juan & go to Vieques instead!”
Reviews.Author: SMUJD07
Reviews.Content: My wife & I, along with my sister & brother in law, stayed the nights of 1/18 and 1/19. We were supposed to stay 1 night longer, spend 2 days on Vieques, then come back for one more night to the Sheraton. In lieu of a voluminous diatribe, I'll hit the high points... 1. We are Starwood Preferred members - they screwed up our reservation and we were forced to leave a night early on 1/20 and go to Vieques a day early. Thank God we did - and no, we did not return for the last night! 2. An unknown hotel employee got ahold of the guest register, ate at their ridiculous restaurant "Fogata", and charged it to our room. The indiviual actually signed MY name - legibly - when the check came, so the person would have to have known the name AND room number. 3. My siser in law had her credit card number stolen in San Juan & is now dealing with that. We don't know if that occurred at the Sheraton, but it's the same thing all over town. 4. Don't let the pictures fool you - the hotel is next to a large construction site and the "pool" overlooks giant cruise & cargo ship docks. It's about as romantic as any loading dock could be... 5. If you want to be ripped off, have fun. If you want to deal with obnoxious tourists, a sprawling metropolis, and a dirty city, have a blast. 6. If you actually want to enjoy a trip to Puerto Rico, please see my review of Hacienda Tamarindo on Vieques Island.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sbcactus
Reviews.Content: The resort has a terrible management team & their attitude is the client is always wrong. We went to check in with 2 rooms and credit card charged for both rooms & only received one & when voiced why, they told us if we didn't like it, we could go elsewhere even though there were no rooms. When ordered room service breakfast, they brought only 1 breakfast & told me "I was wrong & only ordered 1" & went to get my form where; I pointed out that 2 were ordered & they said "do you want another breakfast", no I want to be treated like a human & a I'm sorry would have been nice rather than raising their voice at me. Never apologized for the room, breakfast, nothing, their attitude was if you don't like it leave. The pool area has 11 lounge chairs but yet the hotel has 240 room. The pool area was disgusting anyway. I would never stay here again, even on a bet.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for Sheraton Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in a suite at the Sheraton in Old San Juan and I am here to tell you that this Hotel has gone downhill in a big way! I have stayed here probably 12 times before, but that is when it was owned by Wyndham. Needless to say, I loved it then. But Sheraton is running this place into the ground. My wife and I used to love the breakfast buffet with all the fresh cooked items, now you get microwaved pancakes and french toast! The rooms used to be nicely outfitted, but now have a real cheap feel to them, and the wear and tear is evident all over. This has been our little get away for years and I was really upset to see how bad it has gotten. I still like the location of this particular hotel, but I'll have to stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Sheraton for one night prior to a cruise and loved it! It is in an excellent location for anyone desiring to see the historic areas of San Juan. The only drawback was that there was no beach. They had a very nice pool, though. I love the Sheraton beds! Very comfortable after a day of walking. We had a wonderful time in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for pre-cruisers”
Reviews.Author: Michris17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan for 2 nights prior to leaving for our Carnival Cruise. The location was perfect. Right in the middle of Old San Juan it was great for taking the walking tour and seeing El Morro. The hotel was also within 3 minutes to the pier to catch the ferry to The Barcardi Rum Distillery not to mention across the street from the pier for our cruise. The concierge was great giving us perfect driving directions to El Yunque and for an electronic store for items we forgot to bring. There is a little store across the street for souvenirs and toiletries. Only word of caution while the breakfast buffet is filling and the food is wonderful it is quite pricey...

Reviews.Title: “Great way to begin our Cruise Vacation.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had to write a short review about this hotel after reading some negitive comments. This hotel was the best way to start our cruise vacation. From the time we stepped in the lobby until we left it was a great experience. At check-in we were greeted by a very friendly receptionist. Before we had a chance to ask if any upgrades were available, she asked us if we would like to be in a suite. We acceped without hesitation. The room was wonderful. Two large rooms were very well decorated and spotless. The bedroom area had a king bed with feather bed and comforter. Along with two TV's and a large living room with sofa bed, desk area with internet available there was also a magnificent view of the bay and cruise ship area. We were lucky to have been there the weekend of their annual culinary festival. We got to try alot of their speciality foods and wines in a really festive atmosphere. The hotel is with-in walking distance to area attractions and several cruise ship docks. The hotel also has a casino on the same property with a great restaurant and bar area. We would definitely stay there again on our next visit to Puerto Rico. Give the hotel a try you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a nice clean hotel. I really did not mind the location, close to alot of things and easy to get a taxi to go anywhere you might want to go. If you are wanting nothing more than a room for the night, this is fine. Service was good, people were helpful, friendly, courteous. Breakfast buffet had to wait in line for a very long time but the food was good. It's nothing fancy, but like I said a good value for the money. I would stay again in this location, I was actually expecting much worse. My overall experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked four rooms staying one night before our cruise. The check-in was horrible. We arrived at the hotel at 1:00 p.m. but could not get into some of the rooms until after 4:00 p.m. So we decided to take our grandchildren to the roof top pool. But when I looked at the pool water it was green and the hot tub water was brown. This water was filled with contimination. After reporting this to the front desk they said they would have maintenace check into it. But never got back to us. The manger of the hotel is aggorant and nasty. They also put us in the wrong room --we were supposed to have too beds--but when we finally were able to go to the room there was only one bed and we booked it for 4 people. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aloha_29
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2-nights pre-cruise at the Sheraton Old San Juan Hotel and had a wonderful stay. After reading lots of mixed reviews, we were hesitant to give this hotel a try, but we're glad we stayed at the Sheraton. We requested a quiet room away from Senior Frogs and received a nice quiet room on the 4th floor with a terrific view of the cruise terminal and the San Cristobal Fort. Our hotel room was spacious, nicely decorated, and very clean. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make us happy. We had no problem getting extra towels and our check-in and check-out process was quick and painless. And it was convenient to be in walking distance to the Princess/Carnival Cruise Terminal. The only reason I didn't give this hotel an excellent rating is because Sheraton's restaurant was a little pricey and the food was only fair. We enjoyed spending a full-day sight-seeing in Old San Juan. We took a taxi to the El Morro Fort (since it's up hill) and walked downhill, exploring Old San Juan, and ended up touring the San Cristobal Fort as well. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sheraton Old San Juan for 3 nights before a cruise in Sept. We had gotten the room on auction so it was already paid for when we arrived. The room they gave us was beautiful but we wanted a view of the pier (might be too noisy for some) so they upgraded us for a small fee. Our room was huge, French doors looking out over the pier area. Large living room and the bedroom was large as well. The bedding was superb...comfy beyond words. They have done a very good job of getting up to speed. Everything we asked for was promptly delivered to our room. The staff was friendly and nice. We rented a car for the day from the Hertz Rental (in-house) and the gentleman was very friendly and helpful with maps and suggestions. We would definately stay there again. We did not eat in the hotel but it sure looked good!...

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Old San Juan with 6 of my classmates from high school, plus one advisor. We all took Level Four Spanish, and it was our "Senior" trip. We could not have had a better experience. The staff was amazing - the maid even lined up ALL our flip flops, and there were 4 of us girls! The front desk was very helpful in giving us directions to sites of attraction. After a particularly long day of sightseeing, the kitchen stayed open for us to eat a LATE dinner. We took several breathtaking photos from the rooftop pool and were able to workoff all the (amazing!) food we ate in the gym. By the end of the vacation, we had swapped phone numbers and addresses with a couple staff members. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visting Old San Juan. It's convenient location puts you within walking distance of Burger King, Starbucks, Fort El Morro, and a huge selection of authentic Puerto Rican restaurants, bars, shops and clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: CTKath
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night prior to our August 14th cruise. Our rooms were not ready when we arrived, so we had to wait a little while. We went out and had some lunch at a little restaurant up the street. The rooms were ready when we came back. My kids (25 and 20) were in a regular 2 double bed room on the 7th floor. My husband and I were upgraded to a king suite on the 5th floor. I wish we were staying more than just 1 night! The sitting room was small and we just used it to store the luggage in! The bathroom was adequate - nothing special. The bedroom was beautiful! It was on a corner and had 2 windows and french doors to a tiny balcony. We had breakfast at a nearby Starbucks and then had a taxi tour with a driver named Mo. We shopped a little and had lunch at a restaurant that was just across from the hotel, but I think it was part of the hotel. Can't remember the name though. When we were done, we went and collected our luggage (as we had checked out earlier, before our taxi tour) from the bell staff and continued on to the RCI cruise pier. I could see myself staying in this hotel again if we were ever to return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Carnival Cruise Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Creyes80
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located right in front of the Carnival Cruise ports. I couldnt believe how close we were to the port. The hotel itself is really nice. The staff was really polite. This hotel is definetly a nice one.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: frostypurplemanatee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, attractive, and the staff is friendly. We were in room 709 and had a great view of the cruise pier and the port area. It is about a $10 cab ride from the Royal Carribean pier and across the street from the Carnival pier. The beds are extremely comfortable and the bedding looked new! Housekeeping did a wonderful job. Also, the hotel is only about 4 blocks from a wonderful free music, food, and arts/crafts festival on the week ends. It was the highlight of our stay. The downfall is that no breakfast is included, which averaged us about 25.00 plus tip per day. The food was excellent in the hotel restaurant however. Make sure you visit Senior Frog's for a meal. It is located on the block behind the hotel. The Hard Rock Cafe was excellent too. This is a great hotel for honeymooners visiting Old San Juan and cruisers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: coachdog1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location if you want to explore Old San Juan. Check-in was ok, but a little slow. Staff was polite and professional. Some in our group did experience problems with their keys not working after a couple of days, and we were staying for a week. This required a stop at the desk to have this corrected. Lobby is very nice and clean. Our entire group was to be staying on Club level, but only a few of us were actually on the club floor. The others were given rooms on other floors but were given Club level access. The Club level amenities were sporadic. Some days we received them, others we did not. Club level offerings were somewhat limited for breakfast. Items were not replenished often, and many times we had to ask that they be replenished. We didn't visit during the evenings so I am not able to comment on that. The rooms themselves were in good shape. Furnishings and bedding appeared to be newer and in good condition. Room size was standard. Nice desk area with internet access. (Fee)Standard amenities were in each room. Great Sweet Sleeper bed. Bathroom was very clean with all amenities and plenty of towels. Housekeeping did a good job. Room was cleaned well each day. Bath amenities were replenished along with towels and coffee. Views from many of the rooms were very nice. Rooftop pool was small, but the area itself was very nice and well maintained. All in all this was a decent hotel. We needed to stay in Old San Juan, and for the money the Sheraton offered the best deal. I would stay there again on future visits if I needed to be in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Construction, front desk was horrible!! ”
Reviews.Author: nishnish2000
Reviews.Content: Checked in for 4 nights and paid $610. asked to be upgraded - said there were no rooms available. asked for a higher floor - said there were no higher floors available, instead the guy gave us 2 passes to the bar, which was nice. room was ok, 2 double beds. no mini-fridge. one night decided to go swimming, pool was closed due to weather conditions - it didn't even rain, the weather was perfectly fine. complained about this and the front desk said they would give us passes to the bar. they said the pool was closed for security reasons. they asked us to come downstairs and we spoke with the manager (guy), he said we closed the pool for security reasons, hence we were not gonna receive passes from the bar. so basically they told us to come down for NOTHING!!! Customer satisfaction not met, yet again. tuesday morning - 9 am , construction starts. this is absolutely ridiculous considering ppl are sleeping. stayed in Rm. 325 - the vending machine room was HOT HOT HOT - hence the sodas in the machine were also HOT HOT HOT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! absolutely ridiculous. the only good thing about this hotel was perhaps the ladies who cleaned our room, did a really great job and were extremely nice to us. apart from that, this hotel absolutely ---!!! never again. sheraton in other cities are pretty decent, but customer satisfaction was not met considering we stayed 4 nights. i'd recommend the Wyndham San Juan Hotel in Isla Verde - club babylon in there!!! -NG

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sheraton Old San Juan was very comfortable. The cleanliness, quality of the linens and furnishings, spaciousness of the rooms, were all that I would expect of a Sheraton. It was well-air conditioned and I slept very well here. Since this is not a resort hotel and not near the beach most vacationers would probably choose it only if they wanted to experience old San Juan, visiting the forts and walking the old cobble stoned streets. I would rate it as excellent for business travelers except for the trouble that I had with their high speed Internet connection. I had to be moved once because the Internet wasn't working in my original room. Then when it was working I couldn't access our Exchange e-mail server. The help desk said this was normal because the hotel did not have a mail relay setup. Not being able to access my e-mail made my business travel more stressful than it needed to be. Dinner from room service was excellent. Try the restaurant Baru if you stay here. It is within easy walking distance if you are wearing comfortable shoes (those cobblestones).

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Wait to Leave”
Reviews.Author: lvs2cruz
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews from Priceline and Hotwire hotel users getting stuck with terrible rooms even in otherwise nice hotels in San Juan, I decided I'd bite the bullet and pay almost $380 for two small rooms at the Old San Juan. I had made the reservations last summer before it changed to a Sheraton, and I had to make 2 calls to Sheraton and one to the mgr in San Juan to get the reservation transferred. The web site kept saying "reservation does not exist". Anyway, I got that straightened out, and we arrived as scheduled around 4 p.m on a Saturday. The check in took almost a half hour. One girl trying to handle everything. Our rooms were small (the balcony was literally 6 inches wide) but we weren't going to spend much time there anyway, so that wasn't a problem. The problems that will keep me away from this hotel in the future were the air conditioning that either blasted frigid air or no air (and in 92 degree San Juan, just turning off the A/C was not an option. Although we did try that for awhile just to get warm and opened the balcony doors, but the room was so humid we couldn't see ourselves through the condensation on the mirrors.) So OK, we fell asleep around 11:00 after a long day of airports and about midnight we were awakened by deafening noise -- music, laughter, screams and assorted motorcycles, tire screeching and police sirens. Although we were on the 8th floor, Senor Frogs at street level was starting to come alive and stayed that way until almost 4 AM. Bottom line, next time go ahead and use Priceline -- the room location couldn't have been worse and if you do decide to stay here, get a room on the other side of the building from Senor Frogs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: Nimdok
Reviews.Content: (revised rating) As readers of the messages here can see, the Sheraton Old San Juan is in the midst of renovating its reputation. They are, by and large, doing an excellent job. We had very few complaints during a three night stay last week, and all of them had to do with housekeeping issues. Fortunately, the front desk and management take any and all concerns very seriously, as we observed twice during our stay. First, the room. Our room was a nice, fairly standard Sheraton hotel bedroom on the fourth floor. It was quiet, comfortable and convenient, and a cut above the average hotel room. The hotel location is excellent, allowing access to both the waterfront and Old San Juan with relative ease. The valet staff is excellent, helpful and friendly, as is the staff of La Forgata -- the hotel's restaurant and bar. The food there is excellent. La Forgata is run by the same company as the Parrot Club and Dragonfly, and the quality of the food reflects it. The Churrascuro selections are excellent and the steak was one of the best I've had on a vacation. The negatives have, as said, to do with housekeeping. There were a couple of minor things, but the most blatant problem we had was with towels. We arrived back at the room one of the days to discover that no new towels had been left after cleaning. When we called for replacements the towels were delivered within minutes, and the person doing so was smiling and apologized for the oversight. Unfortunately two of the towels delivered were badly stained and torn, so I decided to let the manager know about the problem. Again, only small issues, but several of them and beyond just this one. The front desk staff was very apologetic, imnmediately summoning the manager. He listened attentively and offered his own apology, assuring me he would take care of things. When we went back to the room a few hours later not only were there twice the number of very clean and acceptable towels, but a small goblet of chocolates and a thank you note. A very graceful response to a minor but persistant problem, and I can state that we had no further complaints after this incident. All in all, this Sheraton is an excellent property and working hard to rectify the few shortcomings still in evidence. I heartily recommend this as a place to stay in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Consistency”
Reviews.Author: hit_the_lights
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Sheraton in Old San Juan over the Memorial Day holiday. We arrived at the International airport on Friday at 11:30am, and a $20 cab got us to the Sheraton in about 20 minutes. I chose the Sheraton for two reasons: Firstly, we only had 24 hours to spend in San Juan (the majority of our stay was in Vieques, which we flew to the next day from Isla Grande airport), so I thought Old San Juan would be the best place to stay. And secondly, I knew that the hotel had recently been renovated from a Wyndham to a Sheraton, so I thought everything would be pretty new and clean, and the Sheraton/Starwoods name has proven to be dependable for us. The Sheraton did not disappoint. We had lunch at the hotel, and the friendly waiter gave us a map and provided directions to a number of attractions, restaurants and shops to get us acquainted with the area. Our room, clean and non-smoking, featured a very comfortable king size bed (the sheraton sleeper beds are great), good bathroom, and a nice view of the bay. Getting around Old San Juan by foot was easy from the Sheraton...the walk along the water towards Fort Morro was gorgeous. We planned to visit Fort Cristobal that day as well, but got sidetracked on Calle de San Francisco and all the shops, eateries, and museums/arthouses that were there. We had dinner at El Picoteo at the El Convento Hotel. The paella was incredible, as was the fresh vanilla cake. If we ever return to Old San Juan for a night, I think I would stay here. We hit the casino back at the Sheraton for about 10 minutes. Its a novelty, but not the reason why we stayed there. We had breakfast the next day at a local diner on the south side of one of the smaller plazas. No one spoke much english, but the cafe con leche was great, as were the pastries. Fort Cristobal is an easy walk from the Sheraton, so we went there for a little culture and to take in some dramatic ocean and city views. Checking in (early) and checking out at the Sheraton was a cinch. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a stay in Old San Juan. There are cheaper accomadations available, but we found a great deal online and earned SPG points, so the decision was an easy one to make.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Respite”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A family group stayed in two rooms here after 5 days of bareboating. To us it felt wonderful. The rooms are comfortable with desk, yummy bed, comfortable chair as well as a small balcony. There are lots of drawers but a minimum of hanging storage. They don't change towels unless you leave on the floor. With the high humidity levels, they don't dry overnight so it is worth getting new ones every day. Used the concierge to book spa treatments at both Eden Spa and Los Muchachos. Eden Spa more luxurious and english speaking, Los Muchachos less pricey and little english, fun local color however. Two great restaurants in Old San Juan, Agaviva and Al Dente are within easy walking distance as is most of Old San Juan. Be sure to wear your sun lotion and take lots of water with you as you walk around however. The sun is still very strong. Got a good value on the rooms, had a lovely water view as well as access to the club level, but that is closed on weekends. There is a casino but we never visited and weren't impacted by it's presence. Suggest you ask for the taxi fare amount in advance - it was 18.50 from the airport for four people and bags and $20 to the airport for two.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: KarenL
Reviews.Content: We liked this Hotel. Great location for shopping and dining. Check in and out was a bit slow but the beds were wonderful and the hotel was clean. We found the staff to be friendly and would stay here again without hesitation!

HotelInfo.Name: Sheraton Old San Juan Hotel & Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 100 Brumbaugh Street | Old San Juan, San Juan 00901, Puerto Rico
